translated: He has a crown of Amitābha.

original: dmar po dang nag po dang dkar ba'i zhal can te /
analyzed: dmar po dang nag po dang dkar ba'i zhal can te /
translated: He has red, black, and white faces.

original: g-yas pa rnams su lcags sgrog dang padma dang ral gri dang / g-yon pa rnams su dril bu dang dgra sta dang / zhags pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams su lcags sgrog dang padma dang ral gri dang / g-yon pa rnams su dril bu dang dgra sta dang / zhags pa'o //
translated: In his right hands he holds a chain, a lotus, and a sword; in his left hands he holds a bell, a battle-ax, and a lasso.

original: byang du bgegs dgra rang 'dra'i ral gcig ma dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang du bgegs dgra rang 'dra'i ral gcig ma dang ldan pa /
translated: In the north is Vighnāntakṛt, in union with a Ekajaṭī female, who is similar to him.

original: don yod grub pas rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: don yod grub pas rgyas btab pa /
translated: He is sealed by Amoghasiddhi.

original: sngon po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can /
analyzed: sngon po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can /
translated: He has blue, white, and red faces.

original: g-yas pa rnams su rdo rje dril bu dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams su rdo rje dril bu dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang 'khor lo ste /
translated: In his right hands he holds a vajra, a bell, a vajra cross, and a chakram;

original: g-yon pa rnams su sdigs mdzub can gyi zhags pa dang gtun shing dang dgra sta'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams su sdigs mdzub can gyi zhags pa dang gtun shing dang dgra sta'o //
translated: In the left hands are a lasso, a pestle, and a sword, all with threatening gestures.

original: dbang ldan du gtum po chen por khro ba rang dang 'dra ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje ma dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: dbang ldan du gtum po chen por khro ba rang dang 'dra ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje ma dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa /
translated: In the northeast is Great Fierce One, in an angry mood, embracing a multicolored vajra-woman similar to himself, with a crown of Vairochana.

original: nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal can /
analyzed: nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal can /
translated: He has black, white, and red faces.

original: g-yas pa rnams su ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang / g-yon pa rnams su sdigs mdzub dang dgra sta dang zhags pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams su ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang / g-yon pa rnams su sdigs mdzub dang dgra sta dang zhags pa'o //
translated: In the right hands are a sword, a chakram, and a vajra; in the left hands are a threatening gesture, a sword, and a lasso.

original: me mtshams su 'dod pa'i rgyal po rang 'dra'i sna tshogs rin chen ma la 'khyud pa rin 'byung gi cod pan can /
analyzed: me mtshams su 'dod pa'i rgyal po rang 'dra'i sna tshogs rin chen ma la 'khyud pa rin 'byung gi cod pan can /
translated: In the southeast is Desire King, embracing a multicolored jewel-woman similar to himself, with a crown of Ratnasambhava.

original: nag po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can /
analyzed: nag po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can /
translated: He has black, white, and red faces.

original: khu tshur gnyis rgyab sprad cing mthe chung gnyis lcags sgrog tu sbrel bas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya 'dzin pa /
analyzed: khu tshur gnyis rgyab sprad cing mthe chung gnyis lcags sgrog tu sbrel bas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya 'dzin pa /
translated: With the two fists touching back to back and the two pinkies linked like a chain, he holds the mudra of Vajra Humkara.

original: g-yas pa dag na lcags kyu dang ral gri dag dang cig shos dag na rdo rje dang zhags pa dag go //
analyzed: g-yas pa dag na lcags kyu dang ral gri dag dang cig shos dag na rdo rje dang zhags pa dag go //
translated: In the right hands he holds a hook and a sword, and in the other two hands a vajra and a noose.

original: bden bral du h'um zhes pas dbyug pa sngon po rang 'dra'i sna tshogs padma la 'khyud pa 'od dpag med kyi cod pan can /
analyzed: bden bral du h'um zhes pas dbyug pa sngon po rang 'dra'i sna tshogs padma la 'khyud pa 'od dpag med kyi cod pan can /
translated: In the southwest, from hum, is blue Club-holder, embracing a variegated lotus like himself, with Amitabha as his crest jewel.

original: zhal sngon po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba dang / g-yas rnams su dbyug pa dang ral gri dang 'khor lo rnams te /
analyzed: zhal sngon po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba dang / g-yas rnams su dbyug pa dang ral gri dang 'khor lo rnams te /
translated: He has a blue, white, and red face, and in his right hands he holds a club, a sword, and a chakram.

original: g-yon pa rnams su snying gar sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang padma dang dgra sta'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams su snying gar sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang padma dang dgra sta'o //
translated: In his left hands he holds a noose with an outstretched threatening forefinger, a lotus, and a battle-ax.

original: rlung mtshams su h'um zhes pa las stobs po che rang dang 'dra ba'i sna tshogs las ma la snyoms par zhugs pa /
analyzed: rlung mtshams su h'um zhes pa las stobs po che rang dang 'dra ba'i sna tshogs las ma la snyoms par zhugs pa /
translated: In the northwest, from hum, is Mahabala, embracing a variegated lotus like himself.

original: rnga sgra'i dbu rgyan can zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar ba /
analyzed: rnga sgra'i dbu rgyan can zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar ba /
translated: He has a crown of Indra's drum, and his faces are black, white, and red.

original: g-yas pa rnams su rtse gsum pa dang ral gri dang / 'khor lo rnams dang cig shos rnams su snying @129b gar sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang padma dang dgra sta'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams su rtse gsum pa dang ral gri dang / 'khor lo rnams dang cig shos rnams su snying @129b gar sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang padma dang dgra sta'o //
translated: In the right hands are a trident, sword, and discus, and in the other hands are a heart, threatening forefinger, noose, lotus, and battle-ax.

original: steng du h'um zhes pa'am bhr'um zhes pa las gtsug tor 'khor lo can rang 'dra'i nam mkha' rdo rje ma la yang dag par sbyor ba /
analyzed: steng du h'um zhes pa'am bhr'um zhes pa las gtsug tor 'khor lo can rang 'dra'i nam mkha' rdo rje ma la yang dag par sbyor ba /
translated: Above, from hūṃ or bhrūṃ, is Uṣṇīṣa Cakravarman, in union with Ākāśa-vajrā, who is similar to himself.

original: mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa /
translated: He is sealed by Akṣobhya.

original: ser po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can phyag dag gis gtsug tor spyi bor 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ser po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can phyag dag gis gtsug tor spyi bor 'dzin cing /
translated: He has yellow, white, and red faces, and with his hands he holds the uṣṇīṣa on his head.

original: g-yas pa dag na 'khor lo dang padma /
analyzed: g-yas pa dag na 'khor lo dang padma /
translated: In the right hands are a discus and lotus,

original: g-yon pa dag na sdigs mdzub dang ral gri dag go //
analyzed: g-yon pa dag na sdigs mdzub dang ral gri dag go //
translated: and in the left hands a threatening forefinger and sword.

original: 'og tu h'um zhes pa las gnod mdzes rang dang 'dra ba'i sa 'dzin ma la snyoms par zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'og tu h'um zhes pa las gnod mdzes rang dang 'dra ba'i sa 'dzin ma la snyoms par zhugs pa /
translated: Below, from hūṃ, is Sumbha, in union with Bhūcarī, who is similar to himself.

original: mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa /
translated: He is sealed by Akṣobhya.

original: nag po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can /
analyzed: nag po dang dkar ba dang dmar ba'i zhal can /
translated: He has black, white, and red faces.

original: g-yas pa rnams na rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che rnams dang / g-yon pa rnams na snying gar sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang / padma dang ral gri'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams na rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che rnams dang / g-yon pa rnams na snying gar sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang / padma dang ral gri'o //
translated: In the right hands he holds a vajra, wheel, and jewel, and in the left hands he holds a heart-vajra, lasso, lotus, and sword.

original: 'di rnams thams cad kyang rang rang gi rtsibs kyi rtse mo'i steng du cung zad ma reg pa'i sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma rnams la g-yas brkyang gi zla ba'i stabs kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad kyang rang rang gi rtsibs kyi rtse mo'i steng du cung zad ma reg pa'i sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma rnams la g-yas brkyang gi zla ba'i stabs kyis gnas pa /
translated: All of them stand on variegated lotuses and suns that do not quite touch the tips of their respective spokes, in the posture of right leg drawn in.

original: zhal dang po dang 'dra ba'i mdog can /
analyzed: zhal dang po dang 'dra ba'i mdog can /
translated: They have the color of the first face.

original: zhal rnams ni dang po dang g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i rim pa ste shin tu khro ba spyan gsum dmar la zlum pa /
analyzed: zhal rnams ni dang po dang g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i rim pa ste shin tu khro ba spyan gsum dmar la zlum pa /
translated: The faces are in the order of the first, right, and left, and are very wrathful, with three eyes, red and round.

original: 'bar zhing sgra sgrogs pa shin tu 'jigs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bar zhing sgra sgrogs pa shin tu 'jigs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: They blaze and roar, and are very frightening.

original: gtsug tor dang 'dod pa dang mi g-yo ba dang gnod mdzes rnams ni rin po che'i cod pan can rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa rol pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor dang 'dod pa dang mi g-yo ba dang gnod mdzes rnams ni rin po che'i cod pan can rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa rol pa'o //
translated: Uṣṇīṣa, Lochanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā have jeweled crowns and are adorned with various ornaments.

original: de las gzhan rnams ni dbu skra dang smar dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa sna tshogs pa'i sbrul rgyan can /
analyzed: de las gzhan rnams ni dbu skra dang smar dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa sna tshogs pa'i sbrul rgyan can /
translated: The others have hair and moustaches that are reddish-yellow and bristle upward, and they are adorned with snakes.

original: mgo la thod pa lnga 'chang ba //
analyzed: mgo la thod pa lnga 'chang ba //
translated: They wear garlands of five skulls on their heads.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: They have the five symbolic ornaments such as the wheel,

original: mgrin par 'phyang ba'i mgo bo'i phreng ba can /
analyzed: mgrin par 'phyang ba'i mgo bo'i phreng ba can /
translated: and they wear a garland of heads hanging from their necks.

original: sbom zhing lto ba che ba rnams te /
analyzed: sbom zhing lto ba che ba rnams te /
translated: They are fat and have large bellies.

original: thams cad kyang gdan dang bcas par mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gdan dang bcas par mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: All of them are Acala together with their seats.

original: 'khor lo yang shin tu 'khor bas g-yo ba med pa lta bu /
analyzed: 'khor lo yang shin tu 'khor bas g-yo ba med pa lta bu /
translated: The wheel is like something that is spinning without moving.

original: kun nas bar mi 'chad par 'bar ba'i tshogs du ma 'phro bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas bar mi 'chad par 'bar ba'i tshogs du ma 'phro bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see that it radiates many masses of blazing light all around without interruption.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag @130a * //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag @130a * //
translated: Then Vajra Humkara conquers the three worlds.

original: rgya'i g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub dang mthe bong gis se gol byas pa las gshin rje mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang bgegs mthar byed rnams rang rang gi gnas su rang gi sku gnyis pa sprul te 'ongs nas mdun du bzhugs pa ci
analyzed: rgya'i g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub dang mthe bong gis se gol byas pa las gshin rje mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang padma mthar byed dang bgegs mthar byed rnams rang rang gi gnas su rang gi sku gnyis pa sprul te 'ongs nas mdun du bzhugs pa ci
translated: From the snapping of the thumb and ring finger of the Chinese Vajrapāṇi, Yamāntaka, Prajñāntaka, Padmāntaka, and Vighnāntaka emanate from their own places, emanate a second form of themselves, and come to stand in front.

original: bgyi zhes bka' nod pa rnams la grangs ji lta bar /🔽aom badzra aam ku sha a'a ka rsha ya h'um /
analyzed: bgyi zhes bka' nod pa rnams la grangs ji lta bar / aom badzra aam ku sha a'a ka rsha ya h'um /
translated: They ask, “What is to be done?”🔽One should give the command with the four mantras:🔽oṃ vajra aṅkuśa ākarṣaya hūṃ

original: aom badzra p'a sha ba ndha h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra p'a sha ba ndha h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra pāśa bandha hūṃ🔽oṃ vajra sphoṭa tarja hūṃ

original: aom badzra k'a li ta rdza ya h'um /🔽aom badzra mu shti gri hna h'um zhes pa'i sngags bzhi rnams kyis bka' bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra k'a li ta rdza ya h'um / aom badzra mu shti gri hna h'um zhes pa'i sngags bzhi rnams kyis bka' bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: oṃ vajra ghaṇḍi gṛhṇa hūṃ

original: de rnams ni phyogs bcu rnams su song nas bgegs kyi bdag po rnams lcags kyus bkug cing zhags pas mgrin par bcings la yang dag par bsdigs te /
analyzed: de rnams ni phyogs bcu rnams su song nas bgegs kyi bdag po rnams lcags kyus bkug cing zhags pas mgrin par bcings la yang dag par bsdigs te /
translated: Those [deities] go to the ten directions, summon the lords of obstructors with the iron hook, bind their necks with the noose, and threaten them.

original: khu tshur gyis bzung nas //
analyzed: khu tshur gyis bzung nas //
translated: Seizing them with the fists,

original: khro bo bcu rnams la gtod do //
analyzed: khro bo bcu rnams la gtod do //
translated: they are delivered to the ten wrathful ones.

original: khro bo rnams kyis kyang phyag g-yon pas lte ba las 'og tu rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rnam pas steng du bdag nyid kyi gzugs can gyi phur pa bzung nas /
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyis kyang phyag g-yon pas lte ba las 'og tu rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i rnam pas steng du bdag nyid kyi gzugs can gyi phur pa bzung nas /
translated: The wrathful ones also hold daggers in their left hands, the daggers having the form of single-pointed vajras below the navel and above their own forms.

original: sgra ring por brjod pa'i h'um yig las grub pa'i rang rang gi phyogs kyi rtsibs kyi rtse mo dang nye ba'i khron par bgegs rnams bcug ste /
analyzed: sgra ring por brjod pa'i h'um yig las grub pa'i rang rang gi phyogs kyi rtsibs kyi rtse mo dang nye ba'i khron par bgegs rnams bcug ste /
translated: They place the obstructors in the wells near the tips of the spokes in their own directions, which are created from the long-oṃ syllables.

original: aom badzra k'i la k'i la ya h'um zhes brjod pa sngan  ma can /
analyzed: aom badzra k'i la k'i la ya h'um zhes brjod pa sngan  ma can /
translated: They recite oṃ vajra-kīla kila-kīlaya hūṃ, which is preceded by oṃ.

original: mgo bo la phur bus 'debs shing /
analyzed: mgo bo la phur bus 'debs shing /
translated: They drive the daggers into the heads of the obstructors.

original: aom badzra mungga ra a'a ko ta ya h'um zhes gsungs shing phyag g-yas pas bzung ba'i rdo rje tho ba 'bar bas brdung bar bsams te /
analyzed: aom badzra mungga ra a'a ko ta ya h'um zhes gsungs shing phyag g-yas pas bzung ba'i rdo rje tho ba 'bar bas brdung bar bsams te /
translated: They recite oṃ vajra-mudgara ākoṭaya hūṃ and imagine that they strike with the blazing vajra hammer held in their right hands.

original: brdung ba dang phur ba 'debs pa dag gis bgegs kyi tshogs bde ba chen po de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i ngo bor bsam par bya zhing bgegs ltag ma rnams ring du 'bros bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: brdung ba dang phur ba 'debs pa dag gis bgegs kyi tshogs bde ba chen po de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i ngo bor bsam par bya zhing bgegs ltag ma rnams ring du 'bros bzhin pa ste /
translated: The obstructors are imagined to be of the nature of the single great bliss suchness, and the remaining obstructors flee far away.

original: de ltar steng dang 'og dang logs su 'khor lo'i khor yug chen po'i mthar thug par 'gro ba rnam pa thams cad du bgegs med par lhag par mos nas /
analyzed: de ltar steng dang 'og dang logs su 'khor lo'i khor yug chen po'i mthar thug par 'gro ba rnam pa thams cad du bgegs med par lhag par mos nas /
translated: Having thus imagined that one goes to the end of the great wheel-encircling rim above, below, and on the sides, without any obstacle whatsoever,

original: 'khor lo'i lte ba'i dbus kyi nang du bdag nyid kyi 'og tu yam las skyes pa ba dan gnyis pa can gzhu lta bu sngon po'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ram yig yongs su gyur pa me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa 'bar ba bdun🔽'dren pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i lte ba'i dbus kyi nang du bdag nyid kyi 'og tu yam las skyes pa ba dan gnyis pa can gzhu lta bu sngon po'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du ram yig yongs su gyur pa me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa 'bar ba bdun 'dren pa ste /
translated: in the center of the hub of the wheel, below oneself, from yaṃ arises a blue wind mandala in the shape of a bow with two streamers, upon which is a red fire mandala in the shape of a triangle, arisen from raṃ, with seven flames.

original: de'i steng du bam las byung ba bum pas mtshan pa zlum zhing dkar ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lam yig las skyes pa rdo @130b rjes mtshan pa gru bzhi pa 'dod par bya ba'i gser gyi sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du bam las byung ba bum pas mtshan pa zlum zhing dkar ba'i chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lam yig las skyes pa rdo @130b rjes mtshan pa gru bzhi pa 'dod par bya ba'i gser gyi sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Upon that is a water mandala, marked with a vase, round and white, arisen from vaṃ, upon which is a gold earth mandala, square and delightful, arisen from laṃ, marked with a vajra.

original: de'i steng du h'um sum h'um yongs su gyur pa'i ri rab rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um sum h'um yongs su gyur pa'i ri rab rnam par bsams te /
translated: Upon that, one should imagine Mount Meru arisen from hūṃ suṃ hūṃ.

original: der yud kyis rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi gzugs yongs su gyur pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyag mtshan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yongs su gyur pa'i chos 'byung dkar po gru gsum pa nam mkha'i tshul can /
analyzed: der yud kyis rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi gzugs yongs su gyur pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyag mtshan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yongs su gyur pa'i chos 'byung dkar po gru gsum pa nam mkha'i tshul can /
translated: In an instant, he completely transforms into the form of Vajra Hūṃkara, and he becomes Vajradhara endowed with the hand implements and so forth that will be explained, completely transformed into a white tetrahedral source of phenomena, the nature of space.

original: 'og tu phra zhing steng yangs pa /
analyzed: 'og tu phra zhing steng yangs pa /
translated: It is narrow below and wide above.

original: 'og zur nas byung ba'i sna tshogs pa'i 'dab ma can gyi padma'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan pa bsam mo //
analyzed: 'og zur nas byung ba'i sna tshogs pa'i 'dab ma can gyi padma'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan pa bsam mo //
translated: Think that it is adorned with a multicolored vajra cross on top of a multicolored lotus that emerges from the lower corner.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba ni sngon po ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba ni sngon po ste /
translated: The center of the multicolored vajra cross is blue.

original: phyogs so so'i rva gsum ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i kha dog can no //
analyzed: phyogs so so'i rva gsum ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i kha dog can no //
translated: The three prongs in each direction are the colors of Vairocana and so forth.

original: de'i dbus su bhr'um yig las skyes shing des byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa las yang dag par byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bhr'um yig las skyes shing des byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa las yang dag par byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pas /
translated: In the center of that, think that a wheel arises from the syllable bhrūṃ and is blessed by it.

original: gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa rta babs bzhis brgyan pa /
analyzed: gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa rta babs bzhis brgyan pa /
translated: It has four sides and four gates, and is adorned with four porticos.

original: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa la sogs pa rnam par bkra bas mdzes pas brten pa /
analyzed: dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa la sogs pa rnam par bkra bas mdzes pas brten pa /
translated: It is supported by variegated and beautiful lattices and half-lattices.

original: sna tshogs 'dab ma can gyi padma gnas pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang ldan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'dab ma can gyi padma gnas pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang ldan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa bsgom mo //
translated: It has thirty-seven platforms, with seats of moon and sun lotuses with variegated petals.

original: de nas nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor mtha' yas pa khyab pa'i sangs rgyas byon pa rnams /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor mtha' yas pa khyab pa'i sangs rgyas byon pa rnams /
translated: Then, imagine that the buddhas who fill the infinite sky come to the mandala.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid nyis 'gyur gyi dbyangs dang / yar la wa da dha lhag pa'i gsal byed nyis 'gyur gyi gzugs rnams su mos te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin nyid nyis 'gyur gyi dbyangs dang / yar la wa da dha lhag pa'i gsal byed nyis 'gyur gyi gzugs rnams su mos te /
translated: They are the nature of wisdom and method, in the form of the double vowels and the double consonants from ya to va.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang na gnas pa'i bdag nyid n'a da'i ngo bo la bcug pa rnams rang gi sems dang tha mi dad par mos nas de las gdan dbus ma'i steng du 'phros pa rnams dbyangs kyi phreng ba gnyis kyi gzugs su brtags te /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang na gnas pa'i bdag nyid n'a da'i ngo bo la bcug pa rnams rang gi sems dang tha mi dad par mos nas de las gdan dbus ma'i steng du 'phros pa rnams dbyangs kyi phreng ba gnyis kyi gzugs su brtags te /
translated: Having imagined that the nature of the syllable NĀDA, which is placed in the center of the palace, is not different from one’s own mind, one imagines that it emanates from that in the form of two rows of vowels.

original: de yongs su gyur pa zla ba dkar po de'i rnam pa gzugs brnyan du shar ba bsgom zhing /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa zla ba dkar po de'i rnam pa gzugs brnyan du shar ba bsgom zhing /
translated: One should meditate on the complete transformation of that into a white moon, which is the appearance of its reflection.

original: aom tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi zhes pa'i sngags nang gi brjod pas byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: aom tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi zhes pa'i sngags nang gi brjod pas byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: One should bless it with the inner recitation of the mantra OṂ CITTA PRATIDEVA KAROMI.

original: gsal byed kyi phreng ba gnyis kyi gzugs su yang brtags te /🔽de yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba dmar po de'i rnam pa gzugs @131a * //
analyzed: gsal byed kyi phreng ba gnyis kyi gzugs su yang brtags te / de yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba dmar po de'i rnam pa gzugs @131a * //
translated: One should also imagine it in the form of two rows of consonants.

original: brnyan du byas pa blta zhing /
analyzed: brnyan du byas pa blta zhing /
translated: One should look at the complete transformation of that into a red moon, which is the appearance of its reflection.

original: aom bo dhi tsi ttam au tp'a da y'a mi zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsi ttam au tp'a da y'a mi zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: One should bless it with the mantra OṂ BODHICITTA UTPA DA YĀMI.

original: de'i dbus su sngar gnas pa'i bar do'i srid pa n'a da las thig le dang zla phyed dang mgo bo dang ha dang au'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje'i lte ba la gnas pa'i h'um bsgom pa na /
analyzed: de'i dbus su sngar gnas pa'i bar do'i srid pa n'a da las thig le dang zla phyed dang mgo bo dang ha dang au'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje'i lte ba la gnas pa'i h'um bsgom pa na /
translated: In the center of that, in the intermediate state of the previously existing bardo existence, meditate on a hūṃ arisen from a hūṃ that is complete in stages from a drop, a crescent moon, a head, a ha, and an oṃ.

original: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod la /
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod la /
translated: Recite oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ.

original: h'um yig las spros pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pa de rnams kyang nang du 'dus pa na bya ba sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: h'um yig las spros pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pa de rnams kyang nang du 'dus pa na bya ba sgrub pa ste /
translated: The tathāgatas emanated from the hūṃ syllable make migrating beings complete buddhas.

original: 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i nam mkhar gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs su gyur pa rnams h'um yig gi nang du chud pa na /
analyzed: 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i nam mkhar gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs su gyur pa rnams h'um yig gi nang du chud pa na /
translated: When those tathāgatas who are urged by light rays and who abide in space transform into the form of Vajradhara and enter into the hūṃ syllable,

original: aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva dza: h'um bam ho: su ra ta stv'am /
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva dza: h'um bam ho: su ra ta stv'am /
translated: recite oṃ mahāsukha vajrasatva jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ suragata satvaṃ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags nang gi bzlas pas bskul ba'i rjes thogs su ro mnyam par gyur pa thams cad yongs su gyur pas rdo rje 'chang sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid bsgom zhing /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags nang gi bzlas pas bskul ba'i rjes thogs su ro mnyam par gyur pa thams cad yongs su gyur pas rdo rje 'chang sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid bsgom zhing /
translated: Following the urging with the mantra recitation, all of the equalizing of taste and complete transformation is meditating on Vajradhara, who is the nature of the three beings.🔽

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ta th'a aa ham /
translated: Immediately after the urging with the mantra recitation of the inner fire ritual, one should meditate on Vajradhara, the nature of the three beings, from the complete transformation of all things that have become of one taste.

original: zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should recite:🔽Oṃ, I am the state of all tathāgatas.

original: 'dzum dang bcas pa cung zad dmar brjes su 'brel ba'i dkar po'i mdog can /
analyzed: 'dzum dang bcas pa cung zad dmar brjes su 'brel ba'i dkar po'i mdog can /
translated: One should visualize Vajradhara, who is smiling, slightly reddish, and white in color,

original: ral ba'i thor cog nag po la gnas pa'i nor bu dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang de'i 'og tu g-yon ngos su gnas pa'i zla ba'i cha dang sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
analyzed: ral ba'i thor cog nag po la gnas pa'i nor bu dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang de'i 'og tu g-yon ngos su gnas pa'i zla ba'i cha dang sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
translated: who has a topknot of black hair with a jewel and a crossed vajra, and below that, on the left side, a crescent moon and the crown of the five buddhas,

original: dpral ba'i steng du thod pa lnga dang / 'khor lo can dang rna rgyan dang mgul rgyan dang / phyag gdub dang ske rags dang thal bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dpral ba'i steng du thod pa lnga dang / 'khor lo can dang rna rgyan dang mgul rgyan dang / phyag gdub dang ske rags dang thal bas brgyan pa /
translated: who is adorned with five skulls on the forehead, a wheel, earrings, necklace, armlets, belt, and ash,

original: zhal gsum pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum pa /
translated: who has three faces,

original: zhal g-yas pa dang cig shos sngo ba dang dmar ba /
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa dang cig shos sngo ba dang dmar ba /
translated: the right and left faces being blue and red,

original: zhal so so la spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: zhal so so la spyan gsum pa /
translated: Each face has three eyes.

original: phyag drug pa rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bus rnam par mdzes pa'i phyag gzung gis rang 'dra'i shes rab ma la 'khyud cing mtsho skyes la gnyis sbyar ba'i dga' ba'i tshogs dang ldan pa /🔽phyag g-yas pa dag gis ral gri dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag drug pa rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bus rnam par mdzes pa'i phyag gzung gis rang 'dra'i shes rab ma la 'khyud cing mtsho skyes la gnyis sbyar ba'i dga' ba'i tshogs dang ldan pa / phyag g-yas pa dag gis ral gri dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
translated: He has six arms. He is very beautiful with a vajra and a vajra bell held in the two hands that hold him embracing a wisdom being similar to himself. He is in union with Padmavati. He has a host of joys.🔽He holds a sword and a goad in his two right hands.

original: g-yon par thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon par thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a skull cup and a noose in his two left hands.

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can //
translated: He has a sun-like halo.

original: sna tshogs padma dang thod pa dang zla ba la skyil krung phyed pa gar gyi nyams dgu rnams kyi gar stabs can no //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma dang thod pa dang zla ba la skyil krung phyed pa gar gyi nyams dgu rnams kyi gar stabs can no //
translated: He is in the half-lotus posture on a variegated lotus, skull cup, and moon. He dances with the nine moods of dance.

original: de'i @131b thugs kar sna tshogs padma dang zla ba la ye shes sems dpa' dkar dmar zla ba'i 'od can /
analyzed: de'i @131b thugs kar sna tshogs padma dang zla ba la ye shes sems dpa' dkar dmar zla ba'i 'od can /
translated: In his heart, on a variegated lotus and moon, is the awareness being, white and red, with the radiance of the moon.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung dang ldan pa sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang rin po che'i cod can rin po che'i rgyan can /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung dang ldan pa sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan dang rin po che'i cod can rin po che'i rgyan can /
translated: He is in the bodhisattva posture, with the crown and jewel ornaments of the five buddhas.

original: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa'o //
translated: With two hands holding a vajra and a vajra-bell, he embraces the wisdom-woman who is similar to himself.

original: de'i thugs kar zla ba la ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' h'um nag po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zla ba la ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' h'um nag po'i gzugs so //
translated: At his heart, on a moon, is the concentration being, a black HŪṂ.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes pas sems can gyi khams sbyang ba'i don du //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs nas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes pas sems can gyi khams sbyang ba'i don du //
translated: Then, thinking “I will purify a buddha-field and become a perfect buddha,” in order to purify the realm of sentient beings,

original: shin tu dga' ba'i sgras bskul ba'i rgyal ba'i tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nang du chud pa na /
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba'i sgras bskul ba'i rgyal ba'i tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nang du chud pa na /
translated: the assembly of victors, urged by the sound of great joy, enter into the vajra-holder.

original: shes rab ma dgyes te rang rang gi rigs dang 'brel ba'i spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo'i gzugs su phyung ba de rnams shes rab ma'i nang du chud pa na /
analyzed: shes rab ma dgyes te rang rang gi rigs dang 'brel ba'i spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo'i gzugs su phyung ba de rnams shes rab ma'i nang du chud pa na /
translated: The wisdom-women are delighted and emerge in the form of goddesses such as Locanā, who are related to their own families. Those goddesses enter into the wisdom-women.

original: thabs yongs su mnyes par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: thabs yongs su mnyes par bsgoms nas /
translated: Meditate on the method being completely satisfied.

original: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhal du bcug cing rang gi lus kyi nang du bcug ste bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba sngon ma can byang chub sems kyi khu ba'i gzugs kyis /🔽shes rab ma'i padmar spros la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams zhal du bcug cing rang gi lus kyi nang du bcug ste bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba sngon ma can byang chub sems kyi khu ba'i gzugs kyis / shes rab ma'i padmar spros la /
translated: They emerge in the form of bodhicitta elixir

original: de yongs su gyur pa mi bskyod pa'i gtso bo can gyi dkyil 'khor du blta'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa mi bskyod pa'i gtso bo can gyi dkyil 'khor du blta'o //
translated: and are seen as the mandala of Akṣobhya as the principal figure.

original: sems can 'di la sems kyis bcug pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: sems can 'di la sems kyis bcug pa rnams kyang /
translated: The tathāgatas who have been placed in the mind of this sentient being🔽are invited in just that way and placed inside.

original: de lta kho nar spyan drangs shing bcug la nang du chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub sems kyi khu ba rdo rje nor bur gnas pas /
analyzed: de lta kho nar spyan drangs shing bcug la nang du chud pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub sems kyi khu ba rdo rje nor bur gnas pas /
translated: All the tathāgatas who have entered inside are the nature of bodhicitta elixir, which is placed in the vajra jewel.

original: dbang bskur ba rnam pa byang chub sems kyi khu ba'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba thob pa rnams rang rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par dag pa las
analyzed: dbang bskur ba rnam pa byang chub sems kyi khu ba'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba thob pa rnams rang rang gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par dag pa las
translated: The empowerment conferral is that all the tathāgatas who have obtained bliss and mental joy in the nature of the bodhicitta seminal fluid transform into the deities such as Akṣobhya and Vairocana from the complete transformation of their individual seeds.🔽The deities are created from the pure aggregates, constituents, and sense bases.

original: mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lha'i gzugs su grub pa rnams su ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la ldem par dgongs pas lhag @132a * //🔽par mos nas /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lha'i gzugs su grub pa rnams su ma 'ongs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la ldem par dgongs pas lhag @132a * // par mos nas /
translated: The future tathāgatas are empowered by the transcendent ones with the intention of the transcendent state.🔽With that, the transcendent ones imagine the deities to be superior.

original: blos rang rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams su btang ste /
analyzed: blos rang rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams su btang ste /
translated: With their minds, they send the deities to their individual world systems.

original: dkyil 'khor yang mi bsam mo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang mi bsam mo //
translated: The maṇḍala is not imagined.

original: de'i rjes su /
analyzed: de'i rjes su /
translated: After that,

original: mig ni gti mug rdo rjer bshad //🔽ces pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas /
analyzed: mig ni gti mug rdo rjer bshad //🔽ces pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas /
translated: the eyes are explained as the vajra of delusion.🔽As such, the deities are created in the maṇḍala of the body of the principal one.

original: mig dag tu chu skyes dang zla ba la 'khor lo dang aom yig las skyes pa'i gti mug rdo rje dkar po gzugs rdo rje ma la 'khyud pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: mig dag tu chu skyes dang zla ba la 'khor lo dang aom yig las skyes pa'i gti mug rdo rje dkar po gzugs rdo rje ma la 'khyud pa bsgom mo //
translated: In the eyes, on a moon and lotus, meditate on white Delusion Vajra, born from a wheel and the letter OṂ, embracing Form Vajra.

original: rna ba dag la chu skyes dang nyi ma la rdo rje dang h'um las skyes pa'i zhe sdang rdo rje nag po sgra rdo rje ma la 'khyud pa'o //🔽sna phug dag tu padma dang nyi ma la rin po che dang tr'am yongs su gyur pa las ser sna rdo rje ser po dri rdo rje ma dang ldan pa'o //🔽lce'i rtsa bar chu skyes dang nyi ma la a'a: yongs su gyur pa 'dod chags rdo rje dmar po ro rdo rje ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba dag la chu skyes dang nyi ma la rdo rje dang h'um las skyes pa'i zhe sdang rdo rje nag po sgra rdo rje ma la 'khyud pa'o // sna phug dag tu padma dang nyi ma la rin po che dang tr'am yongs su gyur pa las ser sna rdo rje ser po dri rdo rje ma dang ldan pa'o // lce'i rtsa bar chu skyes dang nyi ma la a'a: yongs su gyur pa 'dod chags rdo rje dmar po ro rdo rje ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: In the ears, on a moon and sun, meditate on black Hatred Vajra, born from a vajra and the letter HŪṂ, embracing Sound Vajra.🔽In the nostrils, on a lotus and sun, meditate on yellow Jealousy Vajra, born from a jewel and the letter TÂM, embracing Smell Vajra.🔽At the root of the tongue, on a lotus and sun, meditate on red Passion Vajra, born from an AḤ letter, embracing Taste Vajra.

original: dpral bar chu skyes dang nyi ma la ral gri dang ham yongs su gyur pa phrag dog rdo rje ljang gu reg bya rdo rje ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dpral bar chu skyes dang nyi ma la ral gri dang ham yongs su gyur pa phrag dog rdo rje ljang gu reg bya rdo rje ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: On the forehead, on a lotus and sun, meditate on green Envy Vajra, born from a sword and the letter HAṂ, embracing Touch Vajra.

original: snying gar padma dang nyi ma la rdo rje h'um las skyes pa'i dbang phyug rdo rje dkar po chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ma la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar padma dang nyi ma la rdo rje h'um las skyes pa'i dbang phyug rdo rje dkar po chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ma la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: At the heart, on a lotus and sun, is white Ishvara Vajra born from a vajra hūṃ, who is absorbed in Dharmadhatviśvarī.

original: gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa 'di rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin lha'i mig la sogs pa ster ba po rim pa ji lta bar sa'i snying po dang phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang kun du bzang po'i ming gzhan rnams te /
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa 'di rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin lha'i mig la sogs pa ster ba po rim pa ji lta bar sa'i snying po dang phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang kun du bzang po'i ming gzhan rnams te /
translated: These Mohavajra and so forth are the bestowers of the divine eye and so forth, the nature of the inner sense bases, and are, respectively, Kshitigarbha, Vajrapāṇi, Ākāshagarbha, Lokeshvara, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣhkambhin, and Samantabhadra, who have other names.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dang ; rin chen 'byung ba dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang rdo rje sems dpas rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dang ; rin chen 'byung ba dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang rdo rje sems dpas rgyas btab pa /
translated: They are sealed by Vairochana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, and Vajrasattva.

original: ral pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan can /
translated: They have topknots and diadems.

original: spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa /
translated: They have three eyes.

original: phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa zhal gcig pa phyag gnyis pa /
translated: They have one face and two arms, and they possess the five symbolic ornaments.

original: phyag g-yas pas 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin po che dang ; padma dmar po dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang rdo rje dang dkar po 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin po che dang ; padma dmar po dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang rdo rje dang dkar po 'dzin pa /
translated: His right hands hold a wheel, a vajra, a jewel, a red lotus, a crossed vajra, and a white vajra.

original: g-yon pas rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon pas rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /
translated: His left hands hold a vajra bell.

original: g-yas brkyang gi rkang stabs can rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang gi rkang stabs can rnams so //
translated: He stands with his right leg straight.

original: 'di rnams kyi shes rab ni dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram gyi sa bon las skyes pa phyi'i skye mched rnam par dag @132b pa'i ngo bo rang 'dra rnams te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi shes rab ni dza: h'um bam ho: kham ram gyi sa bon las skyes pa phyi'i skye mched rnam par dag @132b pa'i ngo bo rang 'dra rnams te /
translated: Their wisdoms are similar to them, born from the seed syllables j, hūṃ, vaṃ, hoḥ, khaṃ, raṃ, and are the nature of the pure external sense bases.

original: 'on kyang g-yas brkyang gi zla bo'i zhabs stabs can /
analyzed: 'on kyang g-yas brkyang gi zla bo'i zhabs stabs can /
translated: However, they stand with their right legs drawn in.

original: phyag g-yas pas me long dang pi wang dang dri'i dud dang bcud kyi snod dang / na bza' sna tshogs dang chos 'byung 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas me long dang pi wang dang dri'i dud dang bcud kyi snod dang / na bza' sna tshogs dang chos 'byung 'dzin pa /
translated: Their right hands hold a mirror, a lute, a perfume conch, a nectar vase, various garments, and a source of phenomena.

original: g-yon pas rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yon pas rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: Their left hands hold a vajra bell.

original: sgra rdo rje ma ni g-yon pas kyang pi wang 'dzin pa rin chen 'byung ba'i cod pan can no //
analyzed: sgra rdo rje ma ni g-yon pas kyang pi wang 'dzin pa rin chen 'byung ba'i cod pan can no //
translated: Rūpavajrā holds a lute in her left hand and has a ratnasambhava crown.

original: lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang mgo bo'i padma dang zla ba rnams la spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma rnams so //
analyzed: lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang mgo bo'i padma dang zla ba rnams la spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma rnams so //
translated: At the navel, heart, throat, and head lotuses and moons are Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Tārā.

original: gsang bar padma dang zla ba la padma par ba ma du ba'i mdog can zhal gsum pa /
analyzed: gsang bar padma dang zla ba la padma par ba ma du ba'i mdog can zhal gsum pa /
translated: At the secret place, on a lotus and moon, is Padma-bhava, the color of smoke, with three faces.

original: zhal g-yas pa dang cig shos dkar ba dang dmar pa /
analyzed: zhal g-yas pa dang cig shos dkar ba dang dmar pa /
translated: The right and left faces are white and red.

original: phyag g-yas pa gsum lcags kyu dang tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang gri gug gis mdzes pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa gsum lcags kyu dang tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang gri gug gis mdzes pa /
translated: The three right hands are beautiful with a goad, Brahmā’s head, and a flaying knife.

original: phyag g-yon pa gsum na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang zhags pa 'dzin pa spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lnga can skra grol ba gcer bu g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can no //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa gsum na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang zhags pa 'dzin pa spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lnga can skra grol ba gcer bu g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can no //
translated: The three left hands hold a skull cup, khaṭvāṅga, and noose. He has three eyes, the five symbolic ornaments, loose hair, is naked, and stands with right leg straight.

original: lha mo lnga po 'di rnams ni rim pa ji lta bar sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams te /
analyzed: lha mo lnga po 'di rnams ni rim pa ji lta bar sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams te /
translated: These five goddesses are the natures of the purities of the earth, water, fire, wind, and space elements, respectively.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ba dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyis 'khyud cing rgyas
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ba dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyis 'khyud cing rgyas
translated: Vairochana, Akshobhya, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, Ratnasambhava, and the natures of the pure aggregates of form, consciousness, perception, formation, and feeling embrace and seal them.

original: btab pa'o // padma 'bar ba ma ni m'a ma k'i bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: btab pa'o // padma 'bar ba ma ni m'a ma k'i bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: The blazing lotus is Mamaki, and thus she is sealed by Akshobhya.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i de bzhin nyid la rdo rje sems dpa' ni spyi gtsug tu padma dang zla ba la rdo rje 'bar ba ma la 'khyud pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i de bzhin nyid la rdo rje sems dpa' ni spyi gtsug tu padma dang zla ba la rdo rje 'bar ba ma la 'khyud pa ste /
translated: Vajrasattva is on the crown of the head of the suchness of the aggregates of form and so on, embracing Vajra Blaze on a lotus and moon.

original: de ni ye shes kyi khams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi khams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: He is the essence of the pure element of gnosis.

original: mgo bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga rnams su rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag med dang mi bskyod pa shes rab dang bcas pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mgo bo dang mgrin pa dang snying ga rnams su rnam par snang mdzad dang 'od dpag med dang mi bskyod pa shes rab dang bcas pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: At the head, throat, and heart are Vairocana, Amitābha, and Akṣobhya, together with their consorts, who are the essence of the purification of body, speech, and mind.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i lha 'di rnams ni yang dag par sbyar ba'i bde ba chen po @133a * //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i lha 'di rnams ni yang dag par sbyar ba'i bde ba chen po @133a * //
translated: These deities, such as Kṣitigarbha, are the great bliss of the perfect union.

original: zhu bar gyur nas skye mched dang khams dang phung po dang lus la sogs pa rnams la nang du thim par bya'o //
analyzed: zhu bar gyur nas skye mched dang khams dang phung po dang lus la sogs pa rnams la nang du thim par bya'o //
translated: They melt and dissolve inwardly into the sense bases, elements, aggregates, body, and so forth.

original: de'i rjes su ha hi hu he ho ham zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags rnams kyis go cha bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su ha hi hu he ho ham zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags rnams kyis go cha bsam par bya ste /
translated: After that, one should visualize the armor with the mantras that will be explained, “ha hi hu he ho ham.”

original: snying gar aom ha yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: snying gar aom ha yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: At the heart, “oṃ ha” becomes Vajrasattva.

original: mgo bor na ma: hi las skyes pa'i rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: mgo bor na ma: hi las skyes pa'i rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: At the head, “na maḥ” arises from hi, and it is Vairocana.

original: spyi gtsug tu sv'a h'a h'um las grub pa'i padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: spyi gtsug tu sv'a h'a h'um las grub pa'i padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: At the crown of the head, “svā hā” arises from hūṃ, and it is Padmanarteśvara.

original: phrag pa gnyis su boo sha ta he las rdzogs pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: phrag pa gnyis su boo sha ta he las rdzogs pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: In the two shoulders are the perfect Akṣobhya from the two bhrūṃs.

original: mig dag la h'um h'um ho las skyes pa'i rdo rje nyi ma'o //
analyzed: mig dag la h'um h'um ho las skyes pa'i rdo rje nyi ma'o //
translated: In the two eyes are the Vajrasūrya born from the two hūṃs and hohs.

original: yan lag thams cad la phat ham las skyes pa'i rta mchog go //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la phat ham las skyes pa'i rta mchog go //
translated: In all the limbs is the Hayagrīva born from the two phaṭs and haṃs.

original: drug po 'di rnams ni rim pa ji lta bar rdo rje phag mo dang gshin rje ma dang rmongs byed ma dang skyod byed ma dang skrag byed ma dang gtum mos 'khyud par byas pa'o //
analyzed: drug po 'di rnams ni rim pa ji lta bar rdo rje phag mo dang gshin rje ma dang rmongs byed ma dang skyod byed ma dang skrag byed ma dang gtum mos 'khyud par byas pa'o //
translated: These six are embraced by Vajravārāhī, Yamī, Moharā, Cāriṇī, Bhītī, and Caṇḍālī, respectively.

original: de la rdo rje phag mo ni dmar mo zhal g-yas pa dang cig shos sngon po dang ljang gu phyag g-yon pa gsum thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang zhags pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de la rdo rje phag mo ni dmar mo zhal g-yas pa dang cig shos sngon po dang ljang gu phyag g-yon pa gsum thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang zhags pa 'dzin pa /
translated: Vajravārāhī is red, with the right and left faces blue and green, holding a skull, khaṭvāṅga, and noose with the three left hands,

original: phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis lcags kyu dang tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa gsum gyis lcags kyu dang tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and holding a goad, Brahmā head, and flaying knife with the three right hands.

original: gshin rje ma la sogs pa rnams ni sngo ba dang dkar ba dang ser ba dang ljang gu dang dud kha'i mdog can /
analyzed: gshin rje ma la sogs pa rnams ni sngo ba dang dkar ba dang ser ba dang ljang gu dang dud kha'i mdog can /
translated: Yamī and so on are blue, white, yellow, green, and smoke-colored.

original: dbu skra grol ba gcer bu zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa phyag bzhi pa /🔽g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang bcas pa'i kha tv'am ga dang dril bu /
analyzed: dbu skra grol ba gcer bu zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa phyag bzhi pa / g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang bcas pa'i kha tv'am ga dang dril bu /
translated: She is naked, with loose hair, one face, three eyes, and four arms.🔽With the two left hands she holds a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup with a ḍamaru.

original: g-yas pa dag gis cang te'u dang gri gug dag 'dzin pa /🔽phyag rgya lnga pa can /
analyzed: g-yas pa dag gis cang te'u dang gri gug dag 'dzin pa / phyag rgya lnga pa can /
translated: With the two right hands she holds a ḍamaru and a flaying knife.🔽She has the five symbolic ornaments.

original: g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can rnams so //
translated: She stands with her right leg straight and left leg bent.

original: 'dir lha dkar po rnams ni zla ba'i 'od can zla ba'i dkyil 'khor can te /
analyzed: 'dir lha dkar po rnams ni zla ba'i 'od can zla ba'i dkyil 'khor can te /
translated: Here the white deities have moon light and moon disks,

original: gzhan rnams ni nyi ma'i 'od can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor can no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni nyi ma'i 'od can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor can no //
translated: while the others have sun light and sun disks.

original: de ltar bdag nyid la bsams nas rang gi shes rab ma la yang mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin 'di thams cad yud kyis bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid la bsams nas rang gi shes rab ma la yang mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin 'di thams cad yud kyis bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having contemplated in this way on oneself, one should contemplate in an instant all of this on one’s own wisdom consort, the nature of the purity of the eyes, and so forth.

original: de'i go cha ni aom hom hram hr'i sv'a h'a zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags rnams kyi steng /
analyzed: de'i go cha ni aom hom hram hr'i sv'a h'a zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags rnams kyi steng /
translated: Her armor is the mantras that will be explained: oṃ hoḥ hrīḥ hriḥ svāhā.

original: de la lte bar aom bam las @133b skyes pa'i rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: de la lte bar aom bam las @133b skyes pa'i rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: There, at the navel, Vajravārāhī arises from oṃ vaṃ.

original: snying gar ham yom las skyes pa'i gshin rje ma'o //🔽mgrin par hom mom las skyes pa'i rmongs byed ma'o //
analyzed: snying gar ham yom las skyes pa'i gshin rje ma'o // mgrin par hom mom las skyes pa'i rmongs byed ma'o //
translated: At the heart is Yamai, born from ham yom.🔽At the throat is Mohini, born from hom mom.

original: mgo bo hrem hr'im las skyes pa'i skyod byed ma'o //🔽spyi bor sv'a h'um las rdzogs pa'i skrag byed na 'o //
analyzed: mgo bo hrem hr'im las skyes pa'i skyod byed ma'o // spyi bor sv'a h'um las rdzogs pa'i skrag byed na 'o //
translated: At the head is Camunda, born from hrem hrim.🔽At the crown is Bhima, born from sva hum.

original: yan lag thams cad la h'a ba ta las skyes pa'i gtum mo ste /
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la h'a ba ta las skyes pa'i gtum mo ste /
translated: At all the limbs is Chandika, born from hava.

original: drug po 'di rnams bdag po'i mgrin pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: drug po 'di rnams bdag po'i mgrin pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: These six hold the lord’s throat.

original: yang shes rab ma'i spyi bo'i nang du zla ba la gnas pa'i aom yig sku'i rigs kyi rang bzhin zhu bas /
analyzed: yang shes rab ma'i spyi bo'i nang du zla ba la gnas pa'i aom yig sku'i rigs kyi rang bzhin zhu bas /
translated: Again, inside the crown of the wisdom-being consort, the syllable om on a moon melts, the nature of the family of awakened body.

original: de'i rdul phra rab kyis rnam par spras par snying ga'i bar du bltas te ;
analyzed: de'i rdul phra rab kyis rnam par spras par snying ga'i bar du bltas te ;
translated: Visualize that it spreads with its subtle particles as far as the heart.

original: thugs rdo rje las 'og tu snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig thugs kyi rigs kyi rang bzhin snga ma bzhin pa des lte ba'i bar du khyab nas /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje las 'og tu snying gar nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig thugs kyi rigs kyi rang bzhin snga ma bzhin pa des lte ba'i bar du khyab nas /
translated: From the heart of the mind vajra below, the syllable hum on a sun melts, the nature of the family of awakened mind. As before, it spreads with its subtle particles as far as the navel.

original: lte ba las 'og tu nyi ma la gnas pa'i sv'a yig rin po che'i rigs kyi rang bzhin snga ma lta bus rked pa'i bar du khyab cing /
analyzed: lte ba las 'og tu nyi ma la gnas pa'i sv'a yig rin po che'i rigs kyi rang bzhin snga ma lta bus rked pa'i bar du khyab cing /
translated: Below the navel, on a sun, is the syllable sva, the nature of the ratna family, as before, extending to the waist.

original: gsang ba'i steng du nyi ma la a'a: yig dmar po 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi rang bzhin du rked pa khyab pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i steng du nyi ma la a'a: yig dmar po 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi rang bzhin du rked pa khyab pa ste /
translated: Above the secret place, on a sun, is the red syllable a, the nature of the passion family, extending to the waist.

original: brla gnyis kyi nyi ma dag la h'a yig ljang gu sngar bzhin du rkang pa'i mthar thug par khyab par bsams nas /
analyzed: brla gnyis kyi nyi ma dag la h'a yig ljang gu sngar bzhin du rkang pa'i mthar thug par khyab par bsams nas /
translated: On the suns of the two thighs are the green syllables ha, as before, extending to the tips of the toes.

original: rigs lnga tshogs pa can du byas te /
analyzed: rigs lnga tshogs pa can du byas te /
translated: Having made the assembly of the five families,🔽the vajra gem is generated from the syllable hūṃ and blessed, and the lotus is generated from the syllable hrīḥ and blessed.

original: h'um yig gis rang gi rdo rje nor bu aom las skyes shing byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de'i padma hr'i: yongs su gyur pa dang bhr'um las skyes shing byin gyis brlabs pa'i ze 'brur bltas la /
analyzed: h'um yig gis rang gi rdo rje nor bu aom las skyes shing byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de'i padma hr'i: yongs su gyur pa dang bhr'um las skyes shing byin gyis brlabs pa'i ze 'brur bltas la /
translated: Looking at the stamen,

original: rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba las /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba las /
translated: one is urged by the light rays from one’s heart.

original: lus gcig la cung zad dgod pa dang yongs su 'khyud pa dang gcer bu nyid dang skra grol ba dang spu ldang ba'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / 'dod pa gzhan la mngon par 'dod pa dang dran pa dang sems pa dang yid 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: lus gcig la cung zad dgod pa dang yongs su 'khyud pa dang gcer bu nyid dang skra grol ba dang spu ldang ba'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / 'dod pa gzhan la mngon par 'dod pa dang dran pa dang sems pa dang yid 'byung ba dang /
translated: and the characteristics of desire for another, recollection, intention, and the mind being disgusted,

original: cher myos pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
analyzed: cher myos pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
translated: and the characteristics of great intoxication.

original: gnas skabs lnga thob pa bsgrubs pa'i rig ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyen pa'i rang bzhin la rang nyid thabs su gyur pas /🔽aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko nya ham /🔽zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rjes su chags pa'i @134a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs lnga thob pa bsgrubs pa'i rig ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyen pa'i rang bzhin la rang nyid thabs su gyur pas / aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko nya ham / zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rjes su chags pa'i @134a * //
translated: Having attained the five states, the one who has accomplished the knowledge consort who is the nature of the perfection of wisdom, by means of the method of oneself,🔽one should enter into union with the thought of passion for all tathāgatas with the mantra, “Oṃ sarva tathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: bsam pas snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pas snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: “I am of the nature of the adamantine passion for all tathāgatas.”

original: de la rjes su chags pa'i dus su mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pa las bsgrubs pa'i rig ma dang rang gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa bsal ba kho nas snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa'i dus su mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pa las bsgrubs pa'i rig ma dang rang gi bdag nyid la tha dad pa bsal ba kho nas snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: At the time of subsequent passion, one enters into union by the mere elimination of difference between the established knowledge consort and oneself, from the manifest meditative stabilization of equanimity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su chags pa'i bsam pas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su chags pa'i bsam pas kyang /
translated: And with the thought of subsequent passion for all transcendent ones,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad la dbye ba sel ba'o zhes pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad la dbye ba sel ba'o zhes pas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the elimination of difference from all transcendent ones becomes the identity of the gnosis of equanimity.

original: de ltar yang skyes pa'i gzugs de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gzugs kyis btsun mo thams cad kyi bdag nyid phyag rgya chen mo la sogs pa longs spyod pa ni sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mnyes par byed pa ste
analyzed: de ltar yang skyes pa'i gzugs de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i gzugs kyis btsun mo thams cad kyi bdag nyid phyag rgya chen mo la sogs pa longs spyod pa ni sangs rgyas rnams yongs su mnyes par byed pa ste
translated: Thus, the form of the arisen one, the identity of all transcendent ones, in the form of the great vajra holder, enjoys the identity of all queens, such as the great seal and so on, which is the complete satisfaction of the buddhas.

original: / nor bu gnyis kyi 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon nas zhal nas zhugs te zhu zhing /
analyzed: / nor bu gnyis kyi 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byon nas zhal nas zhugs te zhu zhing /
translated: The light rays from the two jewels invoke the tathāgatas, who enter through the mouth and melt in the stomach.🔽The nectar of the five awarenesses falls into the lotus and is held by the tongue at the tip of the uvula.

original: padma'i nang du lhung ba rnams kyis ye shes lnga'i bdud rtsi de lce'i rtse mo'i rol pas 'dzin bzhin par bsam mo zhes pa sbyor ba dang po zhes pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: padma'i nang du lhung ba rnams kyis ye shes lnga'i bdud rtsi de lce'i rtse mo'i rol pas 'dzin bzhin par bsam mo zhes pa sbyor ba dang po zhes pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi called “the first yoga.”

original: de nas snying ga'i 'od zer gyis yang dag par bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas bcug ste /
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i 'od zer gyis yang dag par bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas bcug ste /
translated: Then, the tathāgatas summoned by the light rays from the heart enter through the crown of the head of Vairocana.

original: 'dod chags chen po las bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba padma'i nang du byang chub sems kyi zhu ba'i ngo bor rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po las bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba padma'i nang du byang chub sems kyi zhu ba'i ngo bor rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: They experience great bliss from the great passion and are perfected in the form of the melted bodhicitta in the lotus.

original: de las byung ba'i h'um bum a'am hr'i: kham bhr'um h'um hr'i: t'am aam a'am aim a'im aum a'um aam aa: ram ham a'am rim lam r'im lam dzham lim gam bham l'im nam ram aom aoo aeem dza: h'um bam ho: zhes pa'i sa bon rnams kyis yud ces pas
analyzed: de las byung ba'i h'um bum a'am hr'i: kham bhr'um h'um hr'i: t'am aam a'am aim a'im aum a'um aam aa: ram ham a'am rim lam r'im lam dzham lim gam bham l'im nam ram aom aoo aeem dza: h'um bam ho: zhes pa'i sa bon rnams kyis yud ces pas
translated: From that, the seed syllables HUM, BAM, OM, HRIM, KHAM, BHRUM, HUM, HRIM, TAM, AM, A, IM, E, AI, O, AU, AM, AH, RAM, HAM, A, RIM, LAM, RIM, LAM, JHAM, LIM, GAM, BHAM, LIM, NAM, RAM, OM, OOM, EIM, JAH, HUM, VAM, HOH.

original: rdzogs pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa mi bskyod pa'i bdag po can lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor blta'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa mi bskyod pa'i bdag po can lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor blta'o //
translated: By the word “instantly,” one should see the mandala, which has the nature of the thirty-seven deities, the essence of the indivisibility of emptiness and great bliss, the nature of Akṣobhya.

original: de nas 'byin pa'i sngags rnams kyis bskul nas spros te /
analyzed: de nas 'byin pa'i sngags rnams kyis bskul nas spros te /
translated: Then, having emanated by the inciting mantras,

original: so sor sprul ba mtha' yas pa rnams kyis rigs dang rjes su mthun par 'gro ba'i don byas nas gnas ji lta bar dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor sprul ba mtha' yas pa rnams kyis rigs dang rjes su mthun par 'gro ba'i don byas nas gnas ji lta bar dgod par bya'o //
translated: one should establish the infinite individual emanations in their respective places, having performed the welfare of living beings in accordance with their type.

original: de la h'um zhes pas @134b mi bskyod pa nag po zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa rnams kyis rdo rje sems dpa' lta bu bdag nyid kyi nang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la h'um zhes pas @134b mi bskyod pa nag po zhal dang phyag dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa rnams kyis rdo rje sems dpa' lta bu bdag nyid kyi nang du bsdu'o //
translated: With hum, one should gather into oneself Akṣobhya, who is black, with faces, hands, implements, and so forth, just like Vajrasattva.

original: de nang du bsdus kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa ni dkar po kho na'o //
analyzed: de nang du bsdus kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa ni dkar po kho na'o //
translated: Even though he is gathered into oneself, Vajradhara is white.

original: bum zhes pas mdun du rnam par snang mdzad dkar po zhi ba /
analyzed: bum zhes pas mdun du rnam par snang mdzad dkar po zhi ba /
translated: With bum, one should visualize Vairocana in front, who is white and peaceful,

original: phyag bzhi pa ;
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa ;
translated: with four faces,

original: g-yas pa dag gis 'khor lo dang dril bu dag dang g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dag gis 'khor lo dang dril bu dag dang g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: holding a wheel and a bell with the right hands and a skull cup and a lasso with the left hands.

original: aam zhes pas lhor rin chen 'byung ba ser po phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: aam zhes pas lhor rin chen 'byung ba ser po phyag bzhi pa /
translated: With am, one should visualize Ratnasaṃbhava in the south, who is yellow and has four faces,

original: g-yas pa dag gis rin po che dang lcags kyu dag dang g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang zhags pa dag 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dag gis rin po che dang lcags kyu dag dang g-yon pa dag gis thod pa dang zhags pa dag 'dzin pa'o //
translated: holding a jewel and a goad with the right hands and a skull cup and a lasso with the left hands.

original: hr'i: zhes pas nub tu 'od dpag med mdog dmar po phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: hr'i: zhes pas nub tu 'od dpag med mdog dmar po phyag bzhi pa /
translated: With hrih, one should visualize Amitābha in the west, who is red and has four faces,🔽 holding a lotus and a noose with the right hands and a skull cup and a lasso with the left hands.

original: g-yas pa dag gis mda' dang / padma dag dang / g-yon pa dag gis gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa 'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dag gis mda' dang / padma dag dang / g-yon pa dag gis gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa 'o //
translated: The right hands hold an arrow and a lotus, and the left hands hold a bow and a lasso.

original: kham zhes pas byang du don yod grub pa ljang gu phyag g-yas pa dag gis rdo rje dang lcags kyu dag dang / g-yon pa dag gis dril bu dang thod pa dag 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kham zhes pas byang du don yod grub pa ljang gu phyag g-yas pa dag gis rdo rje dang lcags kyu dag dang / g-yon pa dag gis dril bu dang thod pa dag 'dzin pa'o //
translated: With KHAM in the north, one imagines green Amoghasiddhi, who holds a vajra and a hook with his right hands and a bell and a skull with the left hands.

original: bhr'um zhes pas dbang ldan mtshams su spyan ma dkar mo phyag brgyad ma g-yas pa rnams kyis 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' 'dzin pa'o //🔽cig shos rnams kyis thod pa dang dril bu dang / zhags pa dang gzhu bsnams pa'o //🔽h'um zhes pas me mtshams su m'e ma k'i sngon mo phyag bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bhr'um zhes pas dbang ldan mtshams su spyan ma dkar mo phyag brgyad ma g-yas pa rnams kyis 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' 'dzin pa'o // cig shos rnams kyis thod pa dang dril bu dang / zhags pa dang gzhu bsnams pa'o // h'um zhes pas me mtshams su m'e ma k'i sngon mo phyag bcu gnyis pa /
translated: With BHRUM in the northeast, one imagines white Locana with eight faces, holding a wheel, a vajra, a sword, and an arrow with her right hands and a skull, a bell, a lasso, and a bow with the left hands.

original: g-yas pa rnams kyis mda' dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams kyis mda' dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma 'dzin pa /
translated: With HUM in the southeast, one imagines blue Mamaki with twelve faces, holding an arrow, a sword, a vajra, a wheel, a jewel, and a lotus with her right hands and a skull, a flag, a jewel, a lotus, a sword, and a wheel with her left hands.🔽With TRAM in the southwest, one imagines red Pandaravasini with four faces, holding a wheel, a lotus, a sword, and a jewel with her right hands and a skull, a flag, a jewel, and a lotus with her left hands.

original: g-yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang lcags kyu dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang lcags kyu dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The left hands hold a bow, iron hook, bell, lasso, skull cup, and khaṭvāṅga.

original: hr'i: zhes pas bden bral mtshams su gos dkar mo dang dmar mo phyag brgyad ma g-yas pa rnams kyis mda' dang padma dang ral gri dang rdo rje 'dzin pa /
analyzed: hr'i: zhes pas bden bral mtshams su gos dkar mo dang dmar mo phyag brgyad ma g-yas pa rnams kyis mda' dang padma dang ral gri dang rdo rje 'dzin pa /
translated: “ Hrīḥ!” In the southeast corner, Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Rakta-devī have eight hands. The right hands hold an arrow, lotus, sword, and vajra.

original: g-yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang thod pa dang zhags pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kyis gzhu dang thod pa dang zhags pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The left hands hold a bow, skull cup, lasso, and bell.

original: t'am zhes pas rlung gi mtshams su sgrol ma ljang gu phyag brgyad ma g-yas pa rnams kyis autpala dmar po dang ral gri dang lcags kyu dang mda' 'dzin pa /🔽cig shos rnams kyis 'khor @135a * //
analyzed: t'am zhes pas rlung gi mtshams su sgrol ma ljang gu phyag brgyad ma g-yas pa rnams kyis autpala dmar po dang ral gri dang lcags kyu dang mda' 'dzin pa / cig shos rnams kyis 'khor @135a * //
translated: “ Tāṃ!” In the northwest corner, green Tārā has eight hands. The right hands hold a red lotus, sword, iron hook, and arrow.

original: lo dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lo dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang gzhu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The other hands hold a wheel, lasso, skull cup, and bow.

original: de bzhin du lha gzhan rnams kyang rang rang gi bskyed pa'i sa bon rnams kho nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha gzhan rnams kyang rang rang gi bskyed pa'i sa bon rnams kho nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the other deities should be summoned with their own seed syllables.

original: de la rim pa gnyis par shar phyogs su rdo rje drag mo dkar mo phyag bzhi ma la g-yas pa dag na mda' dang lcags kyu dag dang / de las cig shos dag na gzhu dang thod pa khu bas gang ba dag go //
analyzed: de la rim pa gnyis par shar phyogs su rdo rje drag mo dkar mo phyag bzhi ma la g-yas pa dag na mda' dang lcags kyu dag dang / de las cig shos dag na gzhu dang thod pa khu bas gang ba dag go //
translated: In the right hands she holds an arrow and a goad, and in the other two a bow and a skull-cup filled with blood.

original: lhor rdo rje gzugs ma ser mo phyag bzhi ma /
analyzed: lhor rdo rje gzugs ma ser mo phyag bzhi ma /
translated: Yellow Vajra-Rupa is in the south, with four faces.

original: g-yas pas rdo rje dang mdung 'dzin cing g-yon pas zhags par dang khrag gis gar ba'i thod pas brgyan pa'o ;🔽/ nub tu 'dod chags rdo rje ma ming gzhan rdo rje 'dod chags ma dmar mo phyag bzhi ma g-yas par ral gri dang rdo rje 'dzin cing /
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje dang mdung 'dzin cing g-yon pas zhags par dang khrag gis gar ba'i thod pas brgyan pa'o ; / nub tu 'dod chags rdo rje ma ming gzhan rdo rje 'dod chags ma dmar mo phyag bzhi ma g-yas par ral gri dang rdo rje 'dzin cing /
translated: She holds a vajra and a spear in the right hands and a noose and a skull-cup filled with blood in the left hands.🔽Red Vajra-Raga, another name for Vajra-Rati, is in the west, with four faces.

original: g-yon pas chus gang ba'i thod pa dang dril bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pas chus gang ba'i thod pa dang dril bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: She holds a sword and a vajra in the right hands and a skull-cup filled with water and a bell in the left hands.

analyzed: dbang ldan du rdo rje gnod sbyin ma dkar ser phyag bzhi ba g-yas pas dbyug pa dang autpala la 'dzin pa /

analyzed: cig shos kyis thod pa dang cang te'u 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: bden bral du sgra rdo rje ma dmar sngo phyag bzhi ma g-yas pas sha kti dang / dung 'dzin pa /

original: g-yon pas 'khor lo dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pas 'khor lo dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: rlung mtshams su sa rdo rje ma ljang dkar phyag bzhi ma g-yas pas bum pa dang rdo rje 'dzin cing /

original: sgron ma dang bdud rtsi bcu'i rdzas kyis gang zhing mi'i pags pas g-yogs pa'i thod pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa cig shos so //
analyzed: sgron ma dang bdud rtsi bcu'i rdzas kyis gang zhing mi'i pags pas g-yogs pa'i thod pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa cig shos so //

analyzed: rim pa gsum pa la shar phyogs su bzhad ma dmar mo phyag gnyis rdo rje dang dril bu dang bcas pas bzhad pa'i tshul can no //

analyzed: lhor sgeg mo sngon mo phyag gnyis rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pas 'gying ba @135b dang bcas pa'i sgeg pa'i tshul can no //

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: h'um gi glu len cing gar sngon ma can /🔽rked pa'i phyogs su rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcing bas g-yas rol du bzhag nas rol ba dang bcas par mgo bo cung zad g-yon gyi char dud pa ni rdo rje sgeg mo'o zhes so //

translated: Singing the song of hūṃ, with a previous dance,🔽with the two vajra fists bound at the waist, placing them to the right, with playfulness, slightly bowing the head to the left, is Vajralalita.

analyzed: nub tu glu ma ser mo sgeg pas lus cung zad g-yo zhing phyag gnyis 'khar ba'i sil khrol 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the west is Gītā, yellow, with a slightly swaying body, and with two hands holding a musical instrument.

analyzed: byang du gar ma ljang gu pad kor gyi tshul la sogs pas gar byed pas phyag gnyis sbrel ba'o //
translated: In the north is the green dancer, with her two hands joined in the manner of holding a lotus bud, and dancing.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: lag ba gnyis bskor zhing grol ba gzhogs gnyis su bskor ba /
analyzed: lag ba gnyis bskor zhing grol ba gzhogs gnyis su bskor ba /

analyzed: sgeg pa'i ro'i dga' ston las gar byas te gcig mgo bor gar byed pa'i tshul can zhes pa gar ma'o zhes so //
translated: From the feast of the joy of the dance of passion, she dances, with one hand in the manner of dancing on the head.

original: dbang ldan mtshams su gling bu ma dmar mo'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan mtshams su gling bu ma dmar mo'o //
translated: In the northeast is the red flute player.

original: mer pi wang ma ser mo sgeg pa'i nyams kyis lus cung zad g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mer pi wang ma ser mo sgeg pa'i nyams kyis lus cung zad g-yo ba'o //
translated: In the southeast is the yellow lute player, with a slightly swaying body in the mood of passion.

original: bden bral du rnga mu ku nda dkar mo'o //
analyzed: bden bral du rnga mu ku nda dkar mo'o //

original: rlung mtshams su rdza rnga ma du ba'i mdog can no //
analyzed: rlung mtshams su rdza rnga ma du ba'i mdog can no //
translated: In the northwest is the smoke-colored tabor player.

analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams ni phyag gnyis rang rang gi rol cha sgrogs pa lhur len pa'o //

original: de las phyi rol gyi sna ma bu la me mtshams su me tog ma dkar mo g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gis me tog phreng ba dang 'khor lo 'dzin pas gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje thal mo spyi bor bzhag nas phab ste
analyzed: de las phyi rol gyi sna ma bu la me mtshams su me tog ma dkar mo g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gis me tog phreng ba dang 'khor lo 'dzin pas gar byed pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje thal mo spyi bor bzhag nas phab ste

analyzed: / snying gar me tog 'bul ba'i tshul dang ldan pa'o //

translated: In the southwest is Dhūpā, the color of smoke, holding a censer and a jewel with her left and right hands.🔽In the northwest is Ālokā, the color of gold, holding a lamp and a lotus with her left and right hands.

original: dbang ljan du dri chab ma dmar mo dri'i dung dang ral gri g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gis 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ljan du dri chab ma dmar mo dri'i dung dang ral gri g-yon pa dang cig shos kyi phyag gis 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: shar du me long ma dkar mo phyag zung gis me long 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: lhor ro ma dmar mo phyag gnyis ro'i snod 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: byang du chos ma dkar mo phyag gnyis kyis chos 'byung dkar mo 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: thod skam lnga dang 'khor lo can la sogs pas rgyan du byas pa lha'i gos can /

analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar stabs can no //

analyzed: shar sgor rdo rje lcags kyu ma nam mkha' sngo bsangs g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal na nag po dang dkar po //

analyzed: phyag drug pa /

analyzed: lhor rdo rje zhags pa ma dkar ser g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal nag po dang dmar po phyag drug pa /

analyzed: nub tu rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dmar mo g-yas dang cig shos kyi zhal nag po dang dkar ba / phyag drug ma g-yas pas lcags sgrog dang rdo rje dang ral gri 'dzin cing /
translated: In the west is red Vajra-shakti, with a right and left face black and white, with six arms.

analyzed: g-yon pas 'khor lo dang dril bu dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The right hands hold a shakti, vajra, and sword, and the left hands hold a chakram, bell, and lasso with threatening forefinger.

analyzed: byang du rdo rje dril bu ma ljang gu g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal nag po dang dkar ba /
translated: In the north is green Vajraghanta, with a right and left face black and white.

original: phyag drug pa g-yas pa rnams kyis dril bu dang rdo rje dang ral gri rnams dang / g-yon pa rnams kyis 'khor lo dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa rnams 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug pa g-yas pa rnams kyis dril bu dang rdo rje dang ral gri rnams dang / g-yon pa rnams kyis 'khor lo dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa rnams 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams zhal so so la spyan gsum pa /

analyzed: skra dmar ser gyen du 'bar ba thod pa lnga dang 'khor lo can la sogs pas brgyan pa stag gi pags pa'i gos can /
