analyzed: g-yas brkyang gi zla bos gar byed pa ste sna tshogs padma dang thod pa dang nyi ma la'o //
translated: They dance on moon discs with right legs extended, on variegated lotuses, skulls, and suns.

original: rin chen 'byung ba dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa rnams kyang sna tshogs chu skyes dang thod pa dang nyi ma la ste /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ba dang 'od dpag med dang don yod grub pa rnams kyang sna tshogs chu skyes dang thod pa dang nyi ma la ste /
translated: Ratnasambhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi are on variegated lotuses, skulls, and suns.

analyzed: lha @136b gzhan rnams thams cad ni sna tshogs mtsho skyes dang thod pa dang zla ba la gnas pa ste thams cad nyi ma'i 'od can kho na'o //
translated: All the other deities are located on the variegated lotus, skull-cup, and moon, and all of them are radiant with the light of the sun.

original: de ltar sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid kyi lha'i 'khor lo 'di bkod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid kyi lha'i 'khor lo 'di bkod nas /
translated: Having thus arranged the circle of deities consisting of thirty-seven,

original: snying ga'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu spros la /
analyzed: snying ga'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu spros la /
translated: one should emit the hook of light rays from the heart.

original: snying ga'i 'od zer gzhan rnams kyis rdo rje lcags kyu ma yang dag par bskul te /
analyzed: snying ga'i 'od zer gzhan rnams kyis rdo rje lcags kyu ma yang dag par bskul te /
translated: And the other light rays from the heart should summon Vajra-Aṅkuśī.🔽She, uttering “Jaḥ,” summons the wrathful ones emitted from the heart, and they surround the wisdom-being.

original: des dza: zhes brjod pas snying ga nas spros pa'i khro bo rnams kyis yongs su bskor bas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drangs nas mdun du bzhugs su gsol te /

translated: Having invited the wisdom-being, one should request it to take its place in front.

original: mchod yon dang zhabs bsil phul cing yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: mchod yon dang zhabs bsil phul cing yang dag par mchod la /
translated: One should offer water for welcoming and water for the feet, and make perfect offerings.

original: snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i rdo rje zhags pa ma h'um yig brjod pa mos snying ga nas spros pa'i 'od zer dkar po rnams kyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo bzhengs su gsol te /
analyzed: snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i rdo rje zhags pa ma h'um yig brjod pa mos snying ga nas spros pa'i 'od zer dkar po rnams kyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo bzhengs su gsol te /
translated: The Vajra Rope Lady, impelled by the light rays from the heart, is imagined to emit white light rays from the heart, which invite the awareness beings.

original: aom ku ru ku ru sa ma ya aa dhi pa ti h'um dza: sv'a h'a zhes brjod cing spyan drangs nas pad kor sngon ma can gyis rang gi 'khor lo la gzhug go //🔽de lta kho na'i bam yig brjod pa mo'i rdo rje lcags sgrog mas snying ga nas spros pa'i 'od zer ser po rnams kyis dkyil 'khor la khyab par byed pa'i phyir 'ching ba'o //

translated: Saying Oṃ kuru kuru samaya adhipati hūṃ jaḥ svaḥā, one invites them and causes them to enter one’s wheel with the previously explained lotus gesture.🔽The Vajra Bell Lady, imagined to say the syllable vaṃ, binds the awareness beings to the mandala with yellow light rays emitted from the heart.

original: de lha kho nar rdo rje dril bu ma ho: yig brjod pa mos 'od zer dmar po rnams kyis dkyil 'khor 'gegs pa'i phyir mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lha kho nar rdo rje dril bu ma ho: yig brjod pa mos 'od zer dmar po rnams kyis dkyil 'khor 'gegs pa'i phyir mnyes par bya'o //
translated: The Vajra Bell Lady, imagined to say the syllable hoḥ, pleases the awareness beings with red light rays emitted from the heart, in order to fill the mandala.

original: thams cad la mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' ni lhag par mos pas bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' ni lhag par mos pas bskyed par bya'o //
translated: For all of them, one should consecrate the eyes, etc. , and consecrate the body, speech, and mind, and generate the gnosis being by way of imagination.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od rnams kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dang des bskul ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis ye shes lnga'i chus gang ba'i rin po che'i bum pa rnams kyis sngar bzhin du thams cad la dus gcig
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od rnams kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dang des bskul ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis ye shes lnga'i chus gang ba'i rin po che'i bum pa rnams kyis sngar bzhin du thams cad la dus gcig
translated: The light from the seed syllable at the heart of the lord of the mandala invokes the tathāgatas, and the yoginīs invoked by him confer empowerment on all of them simultaneously with jeweled vases filled with the water of the five gnoses, just as before.

original: tu dbang bskur ba na cod pan la rigs kyi dbang po 'grub par bsgom mo //🔽de la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang m'a ma k'i dang sgra rdo rje ma dang glu ma dang reg bya rdo rje ma dang chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ma @137a * //
analyzed: tu dbang bskur ba na cod pan la rigs kyi dbang po 'grub par bsgom mo // de la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang m'a ma k'i dang sgra rdo rje ma dang glu ma dang reg bya rdo rje ma dang chos kyi dbyings rdo rje ma @137a * //
translated: One should imagine that the lords of the respective families are established on the crowns of their heads.

original: rnams kyi rigs kyi dbang po mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi rigs kyi dbang po mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Therein, the lords of the families are Akṣobhya for the tathāgatas beginning with Vajrasattva, and for Māmakī, Śabdavajrā, Gītavāri, Sparśavajrā, and Dharmadhātuvajrā.

original: spyan ma dang rdo rje drag mo dang sa rdo rje ma dang me tog ma dang bzhad ma dang gling bu ma dang rdo rje lcags kyu ma rnams kyi rnam par snang mdzad do //🔽rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje gzugs ma dang bdug spos ma dang sgeg mo dang / pi wang ma dang rdo rje zhags pa ma rnams kyi rin chen 'byung ba'o //🔽gos dkar mo dang rdo rje chags pa ma dang mar me ma dang dri chab ma dang mu ku nda ma dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma rnams kyi 'od dpag med do //
analyzed: spyan ma dang rdo rje drag mo dang sa rdo rje ma dang me tog ma dang bzhad ma dang gling bu ma dang rdo rje lcags kyu ma rnams kyi rnam par snang mdzad do // rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje gzugs ma dang bdug spos ma dang sgeg mo dang / pi wang ma dang rdo rje zhags pa ma rnams kyi rin chen 'byung ba'o // gos dkar mo dang rdo rje chags pa ma dang mar me ma dang dri chab ma dang mu ku nda ma dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma rnams kyi 'od dpag med do //
translated: Vairocana is the nature of Locana, Vajravetālī, Pṛthivī, Puṣpā, Hasā, Veṇu, and Vajrāṅkuśī.🔽Ratnasaṃbhava is the nature of Vajradākinī, Vajrarūpā, Dhūpā, Lāsya, Vīnā, and Vajrapāśā.🔽Amitābha is the nature of Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Vajrarāgā, Dīpā, Gandhā, Mukandi, and Vajrasphoṭā.

original: sgrol ma dang rdo rje zhib ma dang rdo rje gnod sbyin mo dang gar ma dang ro ma dang rdza rnga ma dang rdo rje dril bu ma rnams kyi don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrol ma dang rdo rje zhib ma dang rdo rje gnod sbyin mo dang gar ma dang ro ma dang rdza rnga ma dang rdo rje dril bu ma rnams kyi don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is the nature of Tārā, Vajrasuci, Vajrayakṣī, Nṛtya, Urṇā, Muraja, and Vajraghaṇṭā.

original: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyis bkug cing zhal du zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems zhu ba las skyes pa padma'i nang du gnas pa'i lha mo bcu drug gi sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis bkug pa'i lha mo'i tshogs lha
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i sa bon gyis bkug cing zhal du zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems zhu ba las skyes pa padma'i nang du gnas pa'i lha mo bcu drug gi sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis bkug pa'i lha mo'i tshogs lha
translated: Then, the bodhicitta of the nature of the tathāgatas, which is drawn in by the seed syllable at the heart and enters the mouth, is generated from the melting of that.

original: mo'i zhal nas zhugs pa byang chub sems zhu ba'i ngo bos de nyid du dbab po //
analyzed: mo'i zhal nas zhugs pa byang chub sems zhu ba'i ngo bos de nyid du dbab po //
translated: The bodhicitta, which is the essence of the melting, is caused to descend to just that place by the bodhicitta that is drawn in by the light rays of the seed syllables of the sixteen goddesses abiding in the lotus.🔽Then, the bodhicitta together with the seed syllables and the light rays are emitted from the pores of the body of the wisdom being.

original: de nas sa bon dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dang 'od zer rnams shes rab ma'i ba spu'i bu ga nas phyung ba rnams las lha mo'i tshogs dang sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa dang nye bar spyod pa dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sa bon dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dang 'od zer rnams shes rab ma'i ba spu'i bu ga nas phyung ba rnams las lha mo'i tshogs dang sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa dang nye bar spyod pa dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: From that, the hosts of goddesses and the various offerings and enjoyments are emitted.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: The mantra is: oṃ sarvatathāgata pūja vajrasvabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o //
translated: With that mantra, one should make offerings to the maṇḍala.

original: de nas sum cu rtsa gnyis par 'chad par 'gyur ba rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das pa lha mo rnams kyis zhal rnams kyis bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sum cu rtsa gnyis par 'chad par 'gyur ba rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das pa lha mo rnams kyis zhal rnams kyis bstod par bya'o //
translated: Then, in the thirty-second chapter, the Blessed One should be praised with the eight-line praises by the goddesses.

original: 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i sems can thams cad kyis kyang phyag 'tshal ba dang bstod pa dang gsol ba 'debs pa mos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyis bskul ba'i sems can thams cad kyis kyang phyag 'tshal ba dang bstod pa dang gsol ba 'debs pa mos par bya'o //
translated: And all sentient beings who are impelled by light rays should be imagined to be bowing down, praising, and supplicating.

original: de nas sum cu rtsa bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas bdud rtsi rab tu bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de nas sum cu rtsa bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas bdud rtsi rab tu bsgrubs te /
translated: Then, in the thirty-fourth chapter, the elixir should be accomplished according to the rite.

original: snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba las /
analyzed: snying ga'i 'od zer gyis bskul ba las /
translated: The elixir is summoned by the light rays of the heart.

original: snod sum cu rtsa bdun du son pa'am so so'i lag par gnas pa /
analyzed: snod sum cu rtsa bdun du son pa'am so so'i lag par gnas pa /
translated: It is placed in the thirty-seven vessels or in the hands of each.🔽The elixir is blessed by the syllable hūṃ, which is the size of a mustard seed, arisen from a white hūṃ syllable. The elixir is drawn up by the light-ray tube of the tongue or drawn up by the mind.

original: h'um dkar po las skyes pa nas kyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa h'um yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i lce'i 'od zer gyi sbu gu rnams kyis sam yid kyis drangs @137b pa rnams ma zhen par myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: h'um dkar po las skyes pa nas kyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa h'um yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i lce'i 'od zer gyi sbu gu rnams kyis sam yid kyis drangs @137b pa rnams ma zhen par myang bar bya'o //
translated: The elixir should be tasted without attachment.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid kyang kun rdzob dang don dam pa yang brtag par bya'o zhes pa dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid kyang kun rdzob dang don dam pa yang brtag par bya'o zhes pa dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis pa'o //
translated: The reality of the mandala should also be examined in terms of the conventional and the ultimate. This is the second meditative stabilization called “the supreme king of mandalas.”

original: de'i rjes su rdo rje 'dzin pas bskul ba'i dkyil 'khor pa'i lha ma lus pa rnams dang bcom ldan 'das kyis sku'i bkod pa spros pa yud kyis nam mkha'i khongs khyab pa rnams kyis gzhan rnams kyi don dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang 'thob par nus
analyzed: de'i rjes su rdo rje 'dzin pas bskul ba'i dkyil 'khor pa'i lha ma lus pa rnams dang bcom ldan 'das kyis sku'i bkod pa spros pa yud kyis nam mkha'i khongs khyab pa rnams kyis gzhan rnams kyi don dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang 'thob par nus
translated: After that, the entire mandala of deities urged on by the vajra holder and the emanations of the array of the body of the Blessed One that pervade the realm of space generate the ability to attain the welfare of others and the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: pa nyid du bskyed nas rang gi lus kyi bkod pa rnams rtsa ba'i lus la bsdu'o zhes pa las rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid du bskyed nas rang gi lus kyi bkod pa rnams rtsa ba'i lus la bsdu'o zhes pa las rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum pa'o //
translated: Then, the array of his body is gathered into the fundamental body. This is the third meditative stabilization called “the supreme king of deeds.”

original: de'i rjes su dngos grub thams cad myur du 'grub pa'i ched du sems brtan par byed par 'dod pas lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang bde ba chen po'i mdud pa'i bu ga rnams su aam h'um aom ham ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dngos grub thams cad myur du 'grub pa'i ched du sems brtan par byed par 'dod pas lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang bde ba chen po'i mdud pa'i bu ga rnams su aam h'um aom ham ste /
translated: After that, in order to stabilize the mind for the sake of quickly accomplishing all powers, one who wishes to stabilize the mind should visualize the three syllables aṃ, hūṃ, and oṃ haṃ in the openings of the knots of the navel, heart, throat, and great-bliss chakras.

original: gsang ba'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i rlung gis me bskul ba'i gtum mo'i rang bzhin aam yig 'bar ba'i 'od zer gyis zhu ba'i ham yig la sogs pa yi ge gsum dang lhan cig dbyer med pa'i aam yig lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis thig ler
analyzed: gsang ba'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i rlung gis me bskul ba'i gtum mo'i rang bzhin aam yig 'bar ba'i 'od zer gyis zhu ba'i ham yig la sogs pa yi ge gsum dang lhan cig dbyer med pa'i aam yig lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis thig ler
translated: The wind that resides in the secret chakra ignites the fire, and the light rays of the blazing aṃ-syllable, which is the nature of caṇḍālī, melt the hūṃ-syllable, and so on, and the three syllables become inseparable with the aṃ-syllable, which is the nature of innate joy.

original: gyur par bsgom zhing sgom pa yongs su smin par mos nas /
analyzed: gyur par bsgom zhing sgom pa yongs su smin par mos nas /
translated: One should visualize that as a bindu and imagine that the meditation is perfected.

original: de nyid las 'od zer gyi re kh'a phra mo me lce gcig tu 'bar ba ltar gnas par blta'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'od zer gyi re kh'a phra mo me lce gcig tu 'bar ba ltar gnas par blta'o //
translated: From that, one should visualize a fine light-ray channel that is like a single flame of fire.

original: de'i mthus bdud rtsi 'dzag pas gang ba'i thig le brkyal  zhing /
analyzed: de'i mthus bdud rtsi 'dzag pas gang ba'i thig le brkyal  zhing /
translated: Through the power of that, the bindu is filled with dripping nectar.

original: 'od zer gyi re kh'a de yang bsil bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi re kh'a de yang bsil bar gyur te /
translated: That light-ray channel becomes cool.

original: de nas thig le sems nges pas ji srid du brtan pa thob par mtshan ma rnams kyis nye bar dmigs pa de srid du blta'o //
analyzed: de nas thig le sems nges pas ji srid du brtan pa thob par mtshan ma rnams kyis nye bar dmigs pa de srid du blta'o //
translated: Then, by the ascertainment of the mind in the drop, one should look for as long as one obtains stability by the observation of the signs.

original: brtan pa nye bar mtshon pa na 'od zer gyi re kh'a de'i snang ba gsal bas sna tshogs par mtshon par byed par bsams te thams cad lag pa'i mthil gyi skyu ru ra bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: brtan pa nye bar mtshon pa na 'od zer gyi re kh'a de'i snang ba gsal bas sna tshogs par mtshon par byed par bsams te thams cad lag pa'i mthil gyi skyu ru ra bzhin du blta'o //
translated: When one is indicated stability, one should imagine that the appearance of the ray lines is clarified and that they indicate the various things, and one should look at everything as if it were a myrobalan fruit on the palm of one's hand.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: And one's meditative concentration will quickly be perfected.

original: yang na snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pas der nang du 'dus pa @138a * //
analyzed: yang na snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas pas der nang du 'dus pa @138a * //
translated: Or else, one should imagine that the world is made into perfect buddhahood by the Tathagatas who arise from the mass of light rays from the mantra at the heart, and that they gather inwardly

original: na thig le'i rnam par h'um yig la ji srid 'dod par yid gzhag go //
analyzed: na thig le'i rnam par h'um yig la ji srid 'dod par yid gzhag go //
translated: into the form of a drop, and one should rest the mind in the syllable hum for as long as one wishes.

original: de'i rjes su dbugs 'byung ba nges par 'byin pa'i rim pas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i mthar thug par de'i 'od zer rnams kyis snang bar byas nas dbugs 'jug pa'i tshul gyis bsdus pa na sa bon dang thig le la ni yud kyis rdzogs pa'i dkyil🔽'khor du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dbugs 'byung ba nges par 'byin pa'i rim pas sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i mthar thug par de'i 'od zer rnams kyis snang bar byas nas dbugs 'jug pa'i tshul gyis bsdus pa na sa bon dang thig le la ni yud kyis rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du mos par bya'o //
translated: After that, by the process of exhaling the breath, one should imagine that the light rays from those seed syllables and spheres illuminate the ultimate of the body, speech, and mind vajras, and then, by the process of inhaling the breath, the light rays are gathered into the seed syllables and spheres, and in an instant the mandala is complete.

original: slar yang dbugs 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'od 'phro ba na 'gro ba snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: slar yang dbugs 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'od 'phro ba na 'gro ba snang bar byas nas /
translated: Again, when the light radiates by the process of exhaling the breath, one should imagine that it illuminates migrating beings,

original: de las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang 'gro ba'i don byed par mos te dbugs 'jug pa'i tshul gyis rang gi snying ga snang bar bya'o zhes pa ji srid 'dod par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni thig le'i rnal 'byor gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang 'gro ba'i don byed par mos te dbugs 'jug pa'i tshul gyis rang gi snying ga snang bar bya'o zhes pa ji srid 'dod par bya'o zhes pa 'di ni thig le'i rnal 'byor gzhan pa'o //
translated: and that the tathāgatas who emerge from that also act for the welfare of migrating beings, and that they illuminate one’s heart center by the process of inhaling the breath. One should do this for as long as one wishes. This is another sphere yoga.

original: yang na ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i 'od zer rnams kyis aa wa dh'u t'i nas song nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i byang chub sems zhu zhing de kho nas 'ongs nas snying gar h'um thig le la de'i bdag nyid du rdul phra rab kyi ngo
analyzed: yang na ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i 'od zer rnams kyis aa wa dh'u t'i nas song nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i byang chub sems zhu zhing de kho nas 'ongs nas snying gar h'um thig le la de'i bdag nyid du rdul phra rab kyi ngo
translated: Having come from there, at the heart, in the drop of the syllable hūṃ, one should think that it exists in the nature of that in the form of subtle particles.

original: bor gnas par de ltar bsam mo zhes pa thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: bor gnas par de ltar bsam mo zhes pa thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: This is the yoga of the drop.

original: de'i rjes su phra mo'i rnal 'byor sgom pa ni sems brtan par byed pa'i thabs dam pa'o zhes pas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su phra mo'i rnal 'byor sgom pa ni sems brtan par byed pa'i thabs dam pa'o zhes pas /
translated: After that, the meditation of the subtle yoga is the excellent method for stabilizing the mind.

original: de lta kho na aam yig la sogs pa'i yi ge zhu bar ro gcig pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin byang chub sems kyi thig le yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa yud kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa rdo rje'i
analyzed: de lta kho na aam yig la sogs pa'i yi ge zhu bar ro gcig pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin byang chub sems kyi thig le yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa yud kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa rdo rje'i
translated: In that way, the syllable aṃ and so on melt into one taste, the nature of the innate joy, the drop of bodhicitta, the size of a mustard seed, endowed with a maṇḍala that is instantly complete, the nature of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: che mo'i nor bu'am de las 'phos pa padma'i sna'i rtse mor bzhag nas brtag par bya zhing ji skad bshad pa'i brtan pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas dkyil 'khor spro bar bya'o zhes pa phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //🔽yang na snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyis bkug cing zhal du zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhu ba las skyes pa'i sa bon las yang dag par byung ba'i yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa yud kyis rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor
analyzed: che mo'i nor bu'am de las 'phos pa padma'i sna'i rtse mor bzhag nas brtag par bya zhing ji skad bshad pa'i brtan pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas dkyil 'khor spro bar bya'o zhes pa phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro // yang na snying ga'i sngags kyi 'od zer gyis bkug cing zhal du zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhu ba las skyes pa'i sa bon las yang dag par byung ba'i yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa yud kyis rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor
translated: Having placed the gem of the great one or that which is transferred to the tip of the nose of the lotus, one should examine it. Having seen the sign of stability as explained, one should emanate the mandala. This is the yoga of the subtle.

original: dang ldan pa rdo rje'i rtse mo nas padma'i sna rtser bzhag ste bsgom zhing /
analyzed: dang ldan pa rdo rje'i rtse mo nas padma'i sna rtser bzhag ste bsgom zhing /
translated: Or else, having summoned the Tathagatas who are drawn in by the light rays of the mantra at the heart and who enter the mouth, from the seed born from the melting, one should meditate on the vajra and so forth, the size of a mustard seed, arisen from the seed, endowed with the instant-perfect mandala, placed from the tip of the vajra to the tip of the nose of the lotus.

original: sngar bzhin @138b spro bar bya'o zhes pa 'di yang phra mo'i rnal 'byor ji ltar 'dod par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin @138b spro bar bya'o zhes pa 'di yang phra mo'i rnal 'byor ji ltar 'dod par bsam par bya'o //
translated: And as before, one should emanate. This also should be contemplated as the yoga of the subtle as one wishes.

original: de'i rjes su aom yig dkar po sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams sprul nas rlung dang lhan cig zhugs shing snying ga'i padmar gnas pa'i a'a: yig dkar po thung ngu'i steng du gnas pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes su aom yig dkar po sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams sprul nas rlung dang lhan cig zhugs shing snying ga'i padmar gnas pa'i a'a: yig dkar po thung ngu'i steng du gnas pa dang ldan pa /
translated: After that, having emanated the white syllable OṂ and so forth, the Buddhas and so forth, one should imagine that they enter together with the wind and abide on the short white AḤ syllable located in the heart lotus.

original: rlung dang lhan cig sprul pa rnams rgyun 'jug pa la gzhag cing /
analyzed: rlung dang lhan cig sprul pa rnams rgyun 'jug pa la gzhag cing /
translated: Having emanated the wind together with the emanations, one should imagine that they are continuously engaged.

original: brtan pa na a'a: yig dmar po rlung dang lhan cig sprul pa rnams 'byin cing sdud pa dang h'um yig nag po yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan pa na a'a: yig dmar po rlung dang lhan cig sprul pa rnams 'byin cing sdud pa dang h'um yig nag po yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When they are stable, one should imagine that the red AḤ syllable together with the wind emanates the emanations and draws them in, and also the black syllable HŪṂ.

original: de gsungs pa /🔽'jug dang gnas dang ldang rnams kyi //
analyzed: de gsungs pa / 'jug dang gnas dang ldang rnams kyi //
translated: That is stated:🔽The nature of following

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: the entering, abiding, and rising,

original: don gyi rjes 'gro'i bzlas pa ni //
analyzed: don gyi rjes 'gro'i bzlas pa ni //
translated: the recitation that follows the meaning,

original: rang bzhin med pa bzang po yis //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa bzang po yis //
translated: the excellent one without intrinsic reality,

original: shes rab thabs kyi go 'phang gnas //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi go 'phang gnas //
translated: abiding in the state of wisdom and method,

original: yan lag dbyer med sngags bzlas bya //
analyzed: yan lag dbyer med sngags bzlas bya //
translated: the recitation of mantra without division of the branches.

original: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'di ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'di ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of the non-dual nature, this is the neuter recitation.

original: 'on brjod pa dang rnam rtog dag gis sangs rgyas nyid ga la zhe na /
analyzed: 'on brjod pa dang rnam rtog dag gis sangs rgyas nyid ga la zhe na /
translated: But how can Buddhahood be attained by expression and discursive thought?

original: bden te 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs las 'di'i rtsol ba med par 'byung ba /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs las 'di'i rtsol ba med par 'byung ba /
translated: It is true, but still, this arises effortlessly from the Buddha's blessing.

original: de thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of that will be perfected.
