analyzed: de rnams kyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang gcig tu gyur pa bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i khu ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin khu ba'i rgyun gyi char rnams kyis lus mtha' dag khyab par bsgoms nas tshim par bya'o zhes pa lta ba bsgrubs
translated: The Tathāgatas summoned by those dissolve into the great bliss wheel, and the stream of the fluid of the nature of great bliss pervades the entire body.

original: nas ngal bso ste yang yang du sngar bzhin du bsgom pa dang bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nas ngal bso ste yang yang du sngar bzhin du bsgom pa dang bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on the satisfaction, one should rest, and again and again meditate and repeat as before.

original: gshegs su gsol bar 'dod na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas gtor ma byin te sngar bzhin du mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas yi ge gsum gyis 'khor lo snying ga'i sngags kyi nang du gzhug cing smon lam rnams kyang gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gshegs su gsol bar 'dod na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas gtor ma byin te sngar bzhin du mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas yi ge gsum gyis 'khor lo snying ga'i sngags kyi nang du gzhug cing smon lam rnams kyang gdab par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to request the departure, one should offer the bali according to the procedure to be explained, and having made offerings and so forth as before, one should cause the wheel to enter into the mantra at the heart with the three syllables and also make aspirations.

original: langs nas dag pa'i sems kyis bcom ldan 'das ma la 'khyud pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku can gyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin sgyu ma'i ngo bor bdag nyid dang mu mtha' med pa'i khams gsum pa lhag par mos shing
analyzed: langs nas dag pa'i sems kyis bcom ldan 'das ma la 'khyud pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku can gyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin sgyu ma'i ngo bor bdag nyid dang mu mtha' med pa'i khams gsum pa lhag par mos shing
translated: Having arisen, one should imagine oneself and the limitless three realms to be of the nature of illusion, the nature of great bliss, which is of one taste with emptiness, the nature of the body of the Bhagavat embracing the Bhagavatī with a pure mind.

original: / ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod pas bde bar gshegs pa mchod pa dang / gzhan gyi don kun du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: / ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod pas bde bar gshegs pa mchod pa dang / gzhan gyi don kun du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should worship the Sugata with conduct as one likes and accomplish all the aims of others.

original: khrus kyi dus su dbang bskur gyi cho gas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: khrus kyi dus su dbang bskur gyi cho gas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: At the time of bathing, one should practice with the rite of consecration.

original: bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho gas h'um yig tshim par byed cing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho gas h'um yig tshim par byed cing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should satisfy and eat the hūṃ syllable with the rite of tasting the elixir.

original: dam tshig nyams na ji lta ba bzhin du don yod grub pa'i 'khor lo can kham dang sna tshogs rdo rjes snying gar brgyan pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par 'gro ba bsam zhing sngar bzhin du bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig nyams na ji lta ba bzhin du don yod grub pa'i 'khor lo can kham dang sna tshogs rdo rjes snying gar brgyan pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par 'gro ba bsam zhing sngar bzhin du bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a transgression of the commitments, one should imagine that one goes to the natural purity, just as before, with the wheel of Amoghasiddhi, marked with a kham and a crossed vajra at the heart, and one should confer initiation on oneself, as before.

original: bla ma la brnyas pa la sogs pa'i skyon la ni ci nus pa ji lta bar ston mo byas te yon yang phul nas bzod par gsol ba sdom pa gzung bar bya'o zhes pa dam tshig las ldang bar bsgrub po //
analyzed: bla ma la brnyas pa la sogs pa'i skyon la ni ci nus pa ji lta bar ston mo byas te yon yang phul nas bzod par gsol ba sdom pa gzung bar bya'o zhes pa dam tshig las ldang bar bsgrub po //
translated: As for the fault of despising the guru and so forth, one should give a feast as much as possible, and also offer a gift, and request forbearance, and take up the commitments, and thus one accomplishes the arising from the commitments.

original: thun gzhan la ni snying ga'i sa bon las dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par spros te sngar bzhin bu mchod pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: thun gzhan la ni snying ga'i sa bon las dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par spros te sngar bzhin bu mchod pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: In another session, one should emanate the wheel of the mandala from the seed at the heart, and make the offering of the son and so forth, as before.

original: thun thams cad la yang mthar 'chad par 'gyur @140b pa'i yi ge brgya pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thun thams cad la yang mthar 'chad par 'gyur @140b pa'i yi ge brgya pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: And at the end of all sessions, one should recite the one-hundred-syllable mantra, which will be explained later.

original: nyal bar 'dod na ngag gi bya ba thams cad a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: nyal bar 'dod na ngag gi bya ba thams cad a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byas te /
translated: When one wishes to sleep, one should understand that all verbal actions are of the nature of ālikāli.🔽One should recite:

original: aom tshur gshegs tshur gshegs dpa' bo che //
analyzed: aom tshur gshegs tshur gshegs dpa' bo che //
translated: “Come, come, great hero,

original: dag pa'i ngag gi ston pa po //
analyzed: dag pa'i ngag gi ston pa po //
translated: teacher of pure speech,

original: stong nyid ye shes 'di lta bu //
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes 'di lta bu //
translated: such is the wisdom of emptiness,

original: spros dang sdud pa rang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: spros dang sdud pa rang 'byung ba'o //
translated: self-arisen, expanding and contracting.”

original: aa yig la sogs pa ksha yig gi bar dang h'um h'um phat zhes brjod de //
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa ksha yig gi bar dang h'um h'um phat zhes brjod de //
translated: One should recite the letters from a to kṣa, and hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bor bdag nyid dang gnyid kyang 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par mos nas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyis nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bor bdag nyid dang gnyid kyang 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par mos nas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyis nyal bar bya'o //
translated: One should imagine oneself and sleep as having the nature of emptiness, the essence of innate joy, and the nature of clear light, with the nature of wisdom and method.

original: tho rangs kyi thun la 'od gsal ba las langs te /
analyzed: tho rangs kyi thun la 'od gsal ba las langs te /
translated: In the early morning session, one should arise from clear light.

original: aom tshur gshegs tshur gshegs zhes pa la sogs pa thams cad brjod nas de lta kho nar thams cad ma tshang ba med par las dang po pas bya'o //
analyzed: aom tshur gshegs tshur gshegs zhes pa la sogs pa thams cad brjod nas de lta kho nar thams cad ma tshang ba med par las dang po pas bya'o //
translated: Reciting “Come, come, great hero, etc.,” one should do everything just as before, without omission, as a beginner.

original: brel pas ni thun gzhan gyi cho ga rjes su bsgrub po //
analyzed: brel pas ni thun gzhan gyi cho ga rjes su bsgrub po //
translated: By being in a hurry, one should perform the rite of the other periods.

original: skabs yod na ni mtha' dag bsgrub bo //
analyzed: skabs yod na ni mtha' dag bsgrub bo //
translated: If there is time, one should perform all of them.

original: gang zhig ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan ma thob pa /
analyzed: gang zhig ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan ma thob pa /
translated: One who has attained the signs as explained,

original: dang po'i rnal 'byor la sems brtan pa des ni cung zad ye shes la dbang bas 'bad pas yud kyis dkyil 'khor sprul te bsgom mo //
analyzed: dang po'i rnal 'byor la sems brtan pa des ni cung zad ye shes la dbang bas 'bad pas yud kyis dkyil 'khor sprul te bsgom mo //
translated: and whose mind is firm in the yoga of the first stage, should, by the power of a little bit of wisdom, emanate the mandala in an instant with effort and meditate on it.

original: gang yang goms pas dkyil 'khor mtha' dag la sems brtan pa de ni ye shes la dbang ba thob pa can ste spro ba dang sdud pa las 'gro ba'i don rgyas par byed cing chos nyid rjes su rtogs pa las byang chub sems mngon du byas te /
analyzed: gang yang goms pas dkyil 'khor mtha' dag la sems brtan pa de ni ye shes la dbang ba thob pa can ste spro ba dang sdud pa las 'gro ba'i don rgyas par byed cing chos nyid rjes su rtogs pa las byang chub sems mngon du byas te /
translated: One who has attained stability in the mind with respect to the entire mandala through practice is one who has attained power over wisdom. He expands the welfare of beings through emanation and re-absorption, and through realization of reality, he actualizes the spirit of enlightenment.

original: dri ma phra mo'i phra mo rnams bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma phra mo'i phra mo rnams bsal bar bya'o //
translated: He should remove the most subtle of the subtle taints.

original: de nas bsgom pa rab tu gyur pa las cho ga ji lta bar phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rtogs nas /
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa rab tu gyur pa las cho ga ji lta bar phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rtogs nas /
translated: Then, through the transformation of meditation, he should realize the attainment of the great seal in accordance with the rite.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dbang du gyur pa ni mu med par gzhan gyi don yang dag par sgrub pa'i nus par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dbang du gyur pa ni mu med par gzhan gyi don yang dag par sgrub pa'i nus par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: And when one has mastery over the perfect intuition, one has the power to accomplish the perfect benefit of others without limit.

original: gang gi tshe bzhad ma dang sgeg mo dang glu ma dang gar ma dang me long ma dang / ro ma dang reg bya ma dang chos ma rnams bsgom par mi bya ba de'i tshe lha nyi shu rtsa dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bsgom pa la sogs pa'i cho ga 'di kho na'o //🔽gang gi tshe brgyad po de rnams spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bzhad ma dang sgeg mo dang glu ma dang gar ma dang me long ma dang / ro ma dang reg bya ma dang chos ma rnams bsgom par mi bya ba de'i tshe lha nyi shu rtsa dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bsgom pa la sogs pa'i cho ga 'di kho na'o // gang gi tshe brgyad po de rnams spangs te /
translated: When one does not cultivate the Goddesses of Laughter, Beauty, Song, Dance, Mirror, Scent, Touch, and Doctrine, then this very rite of the mandala consisting of twenty-nine deities is the cultivation, etc.

original: rim pa gsum pa'i snam bu la byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chen po rnams bsgom pa de'i tshe yang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i cho ga @141a * //🔽'di kho na'o //
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa'i snam bu la byams pa la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chen po rnams bsgom pa de'i tshe yang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i cho ga @141a * // 'di kho na'o //
translated: When one abandons those eight and cultivates the great Bodhisattvas beginning with Maitreya on the third-stage pavilion, then this very rite is the cultivation, etc.

original: de la shar gyi snam bu la byams pa dang sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de la shar gyi snam bu la byams pa dang sa'i snying po'o //
translated: On the eastern pavilion are Maitreya and Kṣitigarbha.

original: lho ru phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dag go //
analyzed: lho ru phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dag go //
translated: On the southern pavilion are Vajrapāṇi and Ākāśagarbha.

original: nub tu 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'jam dpal dag go //
analyzed: nub tu 'jig rten dbang phyug dang 'jam dpal dag go //
translated: In the west are Lokeśvara and Mañjuśrī.

original: byang du sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel pa dang kun du bzang po dag go //
analyzed: byang du sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel pa dang kun du bzang po dag go //
translated: In the north are Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin and Samantabhadra.

original: 'jam dpal ni mam yig las skyes pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ni mam yig las skyes pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī is born from the syllable maṃ.

original: gur gum ltar dmar pa mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa'i ral pa'i cod pan can spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lnga can rdo rje dril bu g-yas dang cig shos kyi phyag gnyis kyis 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gur gum ltar dmar pa mi bskyod pas rgyas btab pa'i ral pa'i cod pan can spyan gsum pa phyag rgya lnga can rdo rje dril bu g-yas dang cig shos kyi phyag gnyis kyis 'dzin pa /
translated: He is red like saffron, with an Akṣobhya crest, three eyes, and the five symbolic ornaments. He holds a vajra and a bell with his two right and left hands.

original: zhal gcig pa g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can no //
analyzed: zhal gcig pa g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can no //
translated: He has one face and stands with his right leg straight.

original: byams pa ni mim yig las skyes pa gser gyi mdog can rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa'i ral pa'i cod pan can spyan gsum pa'i phyag rgya lnga can n'a ga ge sar dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa'i phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: byams pa ni mim yig las skyes pa gser gyi mdog can rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa'i ral pa'i cod pan can spyan gsum pa'i phyag rgya lnga can n'a ga ge sar dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa'i phyag gnyis pa /
translated: Maitreya is born from the syllable miṃ. He is golden colored, with a Vairocana crest, three eyes, and the five symbolic ornaments. He holds a nāgapuṣpa and a vajra and bell with his two right and left hands.

original: zhal gcig pa g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can no //
analyzed: zhal gcig pa g-yas brkyang gi zhabs stabs can no //
translated: He has one face and stands with his right leg straight.

original: gzhan drug rnams ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ltar ro //
analyzed: gzhan drug rnams ni ji ltar mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ltar ro //
translated: The other six are like the consecration of the eyes, etc.

original: phyogs 'di la ni byams pas mgo bo byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni byams pas mgo bo byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: In this case, Maitreya consecrates the head.

original: 'jam dpal gyis ni dbang po thams cad kyi shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis ni dbang po thams cad kyi shes pa rnams so //
translated: Mañjuśrī consecrates the consciousnesses of all the sense organs.

original: phyogs gsum ka la yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' kho na ji skad bshad pa ltar shes rab ma la 'khyud pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gsum ka la yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' kho na ji skad bshad pa ltar shes rab ma la 'khyud pa ste /
translated: In all three cases, the Blessed One Vajrasattva alone, as described, embraces the wisdom lady.

original: lha gzhan rnams thams cad shes rab ma med pa'o zhes pa phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams thams cad shes rab ma med pa'o zhes pa phyogs gcig go //
translated: One position is that all the other deities are without wisdom ladies.

original: rang 'dra'i shes rab ma dang bcas pa rnams so zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rang 'dra'i shes rab ma dang bcas pa rnams so zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second position is that they are with wisdom ladies who are similar to themselves.

original: las thams cad pa'i cho ga la rdo rje phag mo dang bcom ldan 'das dag ji skad bshad pa'i sku mdog can dag ste /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i cho ga la rdo rje phag mo dang bcom ldan 'das dag ji skad bshad pa'i sku mdog can dag ste /
translated: In the rite of all activities, Vajravārāhī and the Blessed One have the colors as described.

original: zhi ba la dkar po dag dang / rgyas pa la ser po dag dang / dbang du bya ba la dmar po dag dang / drag po la nag po dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la dkar po dag dang / rgyas pa la ser po dag dang / dbang du bya ba la dmar po dag dang / drag po la nag po dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: In pacifying, they are white; in enriching, they are yellow; in controlling, they are red; and in fierce activities, they are black.

original: 'dir rnam par gzhag pa gzhan yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par gzhag pa gzhan yang shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should understand another presentation.

original: ji skad du gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: As the Yamari Tantra teaches:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa ni //
translated: The perfection of Vajrasattva

original: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon brjod bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes par mngon brjod bya //
translated: Is called “yoga.”🔽The deity that is similar to that

original: de yi rgyu mthun lha gang zhig / rjes su rnal 'byor du brjod do //
analyzed: de yi rgyu mthun lha gang zhig / rjes su rnal 'byor du brjod do //
translated: Is called “after yoga.”

original: 'khor lo thams cad rdzogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'khor lo thams cad rdzogs pa ni //
translated: The perfection of all chakras

original: shin tu rnal 'byor rnam bsgoms pa //
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor rnam bsgoms pa //
translated: Is the meditation of “great yoga.”

original: lha yi mig sogs @141b byin brlab cing //
analyzed: lha yi mig sogs @141b byin brlab cing //
translated: The consecration of the deity’s eyes and so forth,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid kyang //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid kyang //
translated: The body, speech, and mind,🔽The entry of the gnosis mandala,

original: ye shes 'khor lo gzhug pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo gzhug pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The tasting of elixir,

original: mchod pa che dang bstod pa yang //
analyzed: mchod pa che dang bstod pa yang //
translated: The great offering, and praise

original: rnal 'byor chen por 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen por 'dod pa'o //
translated: Are asserted to be “great yoga.”

original: zhes so // 'dir ni dpal 'dus par /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir ni dpal 'dus par /
translated: Here, in the glorious Guhyasamaja,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams thams cad yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams thams cad yod de /
translated: the Bhagavat Akshobya and so forth are all present.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad rig ma bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig sems can gyi don bya ba la gar rab tu ston cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thams cad rig ma bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig sems can gyi don bya ba la gar rab tu ston cing /
translated: In the same way, all the Tathagatas, together with many quintillions of dakinis, display dance for the sake of sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas thams cad du 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba rnams kyis rtse zhing dgyes la rab tu rgyu'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas thams cad du 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba rnams kyis rtse zhing dgyes la rab tu rgyu'o //
translated: They play, delight, and enjoy themselves with the pleasures of the five senses in all the world systems that extend to the ends of the ten directions.

original: de rnams kyis gsang sngags spyod pa la mngon par brtson par mi gzigs so zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyis gsang sngags spyod pa la mngon par brtson par mi gzigs so zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that they do not see anyone who is diligent in the practice of secret mantra, and so on, extensively,

original: btsan thabs kyi sgrub thabs kyi cho ga nye bar ston to //
analyzed: btsan thabs kyi sgrub thabs kyi cho ga nye bar ston to //
translated: the method of the forceful practice is taught.

original: mthar thug pa na yang ji lta ba bzhin du zla ba drug rnams rig ma'i brtul zhugs spyad pas snying ga'i 'od zer gyis spros pa'i khro bo rnams kyis dang rang nyid kyang thal mo sbyar bas phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas rnams la dngos grub sgrub pa'i
analyzed: mthar thug pa na yang ji lta ba bzhin du zla ba drug rnams rig ma'i brtul zhugs spyad pas snying ga'i 'od zer gyis spros pa'i khro bo rnams kyis dang rang nyid kyang thal mo sbyar bas phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas rnams la dngos grub sgrub pa'i
translated: Finally, having practiced the conduct of the spiritual deportment of the consort for six months, the wrathful ones emanated by the light rays from the heart and oneself with palms joined request the spiritual powers from the buddhas in the ten directions.🔽

original: don du gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: don du gsol ba btab ste /
translated: Finally, having practiced the conduct of the awareness consort for six months, the wrathful ones emanated by the light rays from the heart and oneself with palms joined supplicate the buddhas in the ten directions for the sake of accomplishing feats.

original: ting nge 'dzin du'am rmi lam du rjes su gnang bas sam ma bkag pas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du'am rmi lam du rjes su gnang bas sam ma bkag pas /
translated: In samādhi or in dreams, one is granted permission or is not prohibited.

original: mchod pa dang nye bar bsgrub pa longs spyad pa'i don dang dngos grub ster ba'i don du /
analyzed: mchod pa dang nye bar bsgrub pa longs spyad pa'i don dang dngos grub ster ba'i don du /
translated: For the sake of enjoying the offerings and services and for the sake of bestowing feats,

original: de lta kho nar 'di rnams la srod la snyan gsan phab ste /
analyzed: de lta kho nar 'di rnams la srod la snyan gsan phab ste /
translated: in that way alone, one invites them in the evening.

original: nang par sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor mngon par sprul nas de lta kho nar rjes su bsgrub po //
analyzed: nang par sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor mngon par sprul nas de lta kho nar rjes su bsgrub po //
translated: In the morning, having emanated the mandala of the accomplishment, one accomplishes in that way alone.

original: de lta na yang mi gzigs na phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams blos dmigs te yang dag par mchod nas bzod par gsol la zla ba drug pa'i rig ma'i brtul zhugs spyad cing de nas de lta kho nar rjes su bsgrub bo //🔽de lta na yang mi gzigs na slar yang de lta kho nar zla ba drug pa'i rig ma'i brtul zhugs spyad nas de lta kho nar rnam par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: de lta na yang mi gzigs na phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams blos dmigs te yang dag par mchod nas bzod par gsol la zla ba drug pa'i rig ma'i brtul zhugs spyad cing de nas de lta kho nar rjes su bsgrub bo // de lta na yang mi gzigs na slar yang de lta kho nar zla ba drug pa'i rig ma'i brtul zhugs spyad nas de lta kho nar rnam par bsgrub bo //
translated: If he does not see in that way, then having mentally perceived the Buddhas dwelling in the ten directions, he should make perfect offerings to them, request forbearance, practice the spiritual discipline of the knowledge consort for six months, and then accomplish it in just that way.🔽If he does not see in that way, then again he should practice the spiritual discipline of the knowledge consort for six months and accomplish it in just that way.

original: de lta na yang ma grub na nyes pa med pa'i rnal 'byor pas btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa bya @142a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang ma grub na nyes pa med pa'i rnal 'byor pas btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa bya @142a * //
translated: If he does not accomplish it in that way, then the yogī who is without fault should perform the forceful means of accomplishment.

original: ba ste / rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pas nag cing khros pa'i dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor las snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis rnam par snang mdzad bkug nas rig ma'i padmar ji ltar bsgoms
analyzed: ba ste / rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pas nag cing khros pa'i dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor las snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis rnam par snang mdzad bkug nas rig ma'i padmar ji ltar bsgoms
translated: From the yoga of Vairocana, light rays from the seed syllable at the heart summon Vairocana, who enters into the lotus of the knowledge consort in the manner of meditation.

original: pa'i tshul gyis gtum mo'i me'i dkyil 'khor la 'jigs shing 'jigs pas 'dar bzhin bcug ste /
analyzed: pa'i tshul gyis gtum mo'i me'i dkyil 'khor la 'jigs shing 'jigs pas 'dar bzhin bcug ste /
translated: Terrified and trembling with fear of the mandala of the fire of caṇḍālī,🔽the assembly of tathāgatas summoned by the hook of light rays from the heart and entering the mouth, united with the wisdom, melt.

original: snying ga'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus bkug cing khar zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshes pa'i tshogs shes rab dang sbyor bas zhu bar gyur nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung ba byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid gshin rje mthar byed kyi phur bur bskyed de /
analyzed: snying ga'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyus bkug cing khar zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshes pa'i tshogs shes rab dang sbyor bas zhu bar gyur nas rdo rje'i lam nas byung ba byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid gshin rje mthar byed kyi phur bur bskyed de /
translated: Having arisen from the vajra path, one should generate the dagger of Yamāntaka, the nature of bodhicitta.

original: de lta kho nar rnam par snang mdzad nag por gzhan bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta kho nar rnam par snang mdzad nag por gzhan bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In that way alone, one should generate the other as black Vairocana.

original: de nas bkug pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje bsdams te /
analyzed: de nas bkug pa'i rnam par snang mdzad rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje bsdams te /
translated: Then, having summoned the form of Vairocana, he should bind his secret vajra.

original: bskyed pa'i rnam par snang mdzad phyag g-yas pa dang cig shos dag gis phur bu'i mgrin pa dang tho ba bzung bas /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rnam par snang mdzad phyag g-yas pa dang cig shos dag gis phur bu'i mgrin pa dang tho ba bzung bas /
translated: With the right and left hands of the generated Vairocana, he should hold the neck of the dagger and the hammer.🔽He should recite with a roar:

original: aom a'a: tstshi nda tstshi nda /🔽ha na ha na /
analyzed: aom a'a: tstshi nda tstshi nda / ha na ha na /
translated: oṃ āḥ ciṇā ciṇā🔽haṃ haṃ

original: da ha da ha /
analyzed: da ha da ha /
translated: daṃ daṃ

original: da'i pta tsa kr'a bee ro tsa na badzra bee ro tsa na ku la de wa t'am wa k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: da'i pta tsa kr'a bee ro tsa na badzra bee ro tsa na ku la de wa t'am wa k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: dīptacakrapadmavairocana vajravairocanakuladevatāṃ vakṣyāmi hūṃ phaṭ

original: zhes pa bsgyings pa dang bcas pa brjod pas phur bus gdab po //
analyzed: zhes pa bsgyings pa dang bcas pa brjod pas phur bus gdab po //
translated: and he should strike with the dagger.

original: de nas phur bus btab pa tsam gyi rjes thogs su dngos su mngon par phyogs pa'am mngon par ma phyogs pa yang rung /
analyzed: de nas phur bus btab pa tsam gyi rjes thogs su dngos su mngon par phyogs pa'am mngon par ma phyogs pa yang rung /
translated: Then, immediately after the striking with the dagger, whether the one to be struck is actually present or not,

original: de ltar bsam pa gser gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa gser gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas nas /
translated: he should imagine him standing on a golden mandala.🔽He should recite:

original: aom a'a: badzra ka'i la au da k'i la ya h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra ka'i la au da k'i la ya h'um /
translated: oṃ āḥ vajra kilaya udayakīlaya hūṃ

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis phur bu phyung nas snying ga'i 'od kyis spros pa'i spyan ma rnams kyis /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis phur bu phyung nas snying ga'i 'od kyis spros pa'i spyan ma rnams kyis /
translated: Having extracted the dagger with the mantra, one should visualize Locanā emanated by the light from the heart.

original: aom ru ru spu ru dzva la ti shtha siddha lo tsa ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ru ru spu ru dzva la ti shtha siddha lo tsa ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Reciting “Oṃ ruru sphu ru jvālā tiṣṭha siddha locani svāhā,”

original: zhes zlos shing mngon par dbang bskur te /
analyzed: zhes zlos shing mngon par dbang bskur te /
translated: one should confer the actual consecration.

original: mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang bzod par gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang bzod par gsol bar bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings, praise, taste the elixir, and request forbearance.

original: de ltar nyi ma bdun ji srid par rjes su bsgrub ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma bdun ji srid par rjes su bsgrub ste 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one should practice for seven days, and one will be successful.

original: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad dang de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad dang de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the forceful practice of Vairocana and the deities of his family.

original: de bzhin du nag cing khros pa'i 'od dpag med kyi rnal 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du nag cing khros pa'i 'od dpag med kyi rnal 'byor gyis /
translated: Similarly, with the yoga of dark and wrathful Amitābha,

original: padma mthar byed dmar po'i phur @142b bus /
analyzed: padma mthar byed dmar po'i phur @142b bus /
translated: one should strike with the red dagger of Padmanateśvara.

original: aom a'a: hr'i: bhu rbhu wa: aa mi t'a bham aa mi t'a bham ku la de wa t'am wa k'i la ya h'um phat ces pa'i khyad par gyis 'od dpag med dang de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: hr'i: bhu rbhu wa: aa mi t'a bham aa mi t'a bham ku la de wa t'am wa k'i la ya h'um phat ces pa'i khyad par gyis 'od dpag med dang de'i rigs kyi lha rnams kyi btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The special feature is the forceful rite of Amitābha and the deities of his family by the mantra Oṃ āḥ hrīḥ bhur bhuvaḥ amṛtabhañja amṛtabhañja kuladevatāṃ vāk kālaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de bzhin du nag cing khros pa'i mi bskyod pa dang rin chen 'byung ba dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i phur bus /🔽aom a'a: badzra r'a dza aa ksho bhyam ra tna sa mbha wa aa mo gha siddhim ta ta ta ku la de wa t'am w'a k'i la ya h'um phat /
analyzed: de bzhin du nag cing khros pa'i mi bskyod pa dang rin chen 'byung ba dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor gyis bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i phur bus / aom a'a: badzra r'a dza aa ksho bhyam ra tna sa mbha wa aa mo gha siddhim ta ta ta ku la de wa t'am w'a k'i la ya h'um phat /
translated: Similarly, with the yoga of Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, and Amoghasiddhi, who are dark and wrathful, one should drive in the dagger of Amṛtakuṇḍali with the mantra Oṃ āḥ vajra rāja akṣobhya ratna sambhava amogha siddhi ta ta kula devatāṃ vāk kālaya hūṃ phaṭ.🔽The special feature is the forceful rite of Akṣobhya and so forth by the mantra Oṃ āḥ vajra rāja akṣobhya ratna sambhava amogha siddhi ta ta kula devatāṃ vāk kālaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pas phur bus gdab po zhes pa'i khyad par gyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ces pas phur bus gdab po zhes pa'i khyad par gyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis btsan thabs kyi bsgrub pa'o //
translated: One should drive in the dagger with the mantra Oṃ āḥ vajra rāja akṣobhya ratna sambhava amogha siddhi ta ta kula devatāṃ vāk kālaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'di thams cad ni phur bu gdab bya dang 'debs pa po dang 'debs par mngon par ma zhen par byas na dngos grub 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni phur bu gdab bya dang 'debs pa po dang 'debs par mngon par ma zhen par byas na dngos grub 'thob bo //
translated: All of this is the attainment of power by the non-apprehension of the one who is to be struck by the dagger, the one who strikes, and the striking.

original: de ci gang las btsan thabs su bsgrub par bya ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gzhan dbang can rnams thugs rje dang mi ldan pa rnams sam rnal 'byor pa yang de rnams la mi 'dud pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci gang las btsan thabs su bsgrub par bya ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gzhan dbang can rnams thugs rje dang mi ldan pa rnams sam rnal 'byor pa yang de rnams la mi 'dud pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Conquerors, who are to be accomplished by force, are dependent, and those without compassion or yogis do not bow to them?🔽In the Guhyasamaja it is said:

original: 'dus par / gar 'di rnams ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: 'dus par / gar 'di rnams ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: These dances truly arise.

original: zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is this not so?

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi gar te /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi gar te /
translated: This is the dance of the Buddhas.

original: ci zhig ltar rnal 'byor ba rnam pa gzhan du sems mthon por dang rnal 'byor ba'i yang de ltar rjes su bsgrub pa ma gzigs pa rnams kyi rtsed mo pa'i bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la rjes su chags pa'i don du gar kho na'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ltar rnal 'byor ba rnam pa gzhan du sems mthon por dang rnal 'byor ba'i yang de ltar rjes su bsgrub pa ma gzigs pa rnams kyi rtsed mo pa'i bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la rjes su chags pa'i don du gar kho na'o //
translated: In some way, the yogis are of high mind, and the yogis also practice in that way. Those who do not see are like children, and the Tathagatas are only dancing for the sake of attachment.

original: bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyang 'jigs pa bzhin du 'jigs pa rnams so zhes pa yang gar gzhan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyang 'jigs pa bzhin du 'jigs pa rnams so zhes pa yang gar gzhan te /
translated: The Blessed Ones are also like those who are frightened by fear. This is another dance,

original: snying rje'i gzhan dbang can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i gzhan dbang can rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who are dependent on compassion.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is said:

original: 'jigs shing skrag pa'i yid can ni //
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag pa'i yid can ni //
translated: The one with a fearful, terrified mind

original: mchog ster rnam par gzigs par mdzad //
analyzed: mchog ster rnam par gzigs par mdzad //
translated: is seen to grant the supreme.

original: yid ni dga' zhing mgu rnams la //
analyzed: yid ni dga' zhing mgu rnams la //
translated: To those with a mind that is pleased and delighted,

original: dngos grub rgya chen thob par mdzad //
analyzed: dngos grub rgya chen thob par mdzad //
translated: he grants the attainment of the great.

original: ces so // dur khrod la dgyes pa phyag gnyis pa'i he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // dur khrod la dgyes pa phyag gnyis pa'i he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: The maṇḍala of the two-armed Heruka, who delights in the charnel ground, is taught:

original: phyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Outside,” etc.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ltar grub bzhi pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa lta nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang @143a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ltar grub bzhi pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa lta nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang @143a * //
translated: “As before” means endowed with four sides, etc., like the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, and endowed with twenty-eight, like Vajravetālī, etc.

original: ldan pa'o // phyi'i dkyil 'khor de'i phyed kyi nang du zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ldan pa'o // phyi'i dkyil 'khor de'i phyed kyi nang du zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Inside half of that outer maṇḍala, there is a maṇḍala in the form of a half-moon.

original: phyi rol zhes pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa las te /
analyzed: phyi rol zhes pa zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa las te /
translated: “Outside” means from the form of the half-moon.

original: ri mo bzhi rnams ni rdo rje dang 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i ri mo gsum las pha rol tu padma dang / 'khor lo'i phreng ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: ri mo bzhi rnams ni rdo rje dang 'od zer gyi phreng ba'i ri mo gsum las pha rol tu padma dang / 'khor lo'i phreng ba dag gi'o //
translated: The four lines are of the lotus and wheel garlands beyond the three lines of the vajra and garland of light rays.

original: lha thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the deities are Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special [deities] are taught:

original: goo r'i la sogs pa rnams zhes pa ste /
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa rnams zhes pa ste /
translated: Gauri and so forth.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa brgyad rnams kyi gnas rnams su'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa brgyad rnams kyi gnas rnams su'o //
translated: In the places of the eight [deities] beginning with Vairochana.

original: dbus su rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su he ru ka'i bskyed pa'i sa bon hr'i: 'o //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su he ru ka'i bskyed pa'i sa bon hr'i: 'o //
translated: In the center, in the place of Vajrasattva, the seed syllable of the generation of Heruka is hriḥ.

original: hr'i: yig la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: hr'i: yig la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The seed syllables such as hriḥ are of Gauri and so forth.

original: 'di rnams kyi ming dang dgod pa dang / kha dog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni phyag bcu drug pa'i dkyil 'khor du ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi ming dang dgod pa dang / kha dog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni phyag bcu drug pa'i dkyil 'khor du ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Their names, arrangement, colors, hand implements, and so forth are as explained in the mandala with sixteen hands.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor du zhes pa zla ba phyed pa'i dbyibs las so //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor du zhes pa zla ba phyed pa'i dbyibs las so //
translated: In the outer mandala, in the shape of a half-moon.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes pa 'dir phyag bcu drug pa'i dkyil 'khor ltar zhes pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i ched du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sngags kyi rjes su 'brang bas ji ltar rigs par rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi yang sa bon rnams nye bar mtshon🔽pa'i ched du /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes pa 'dir phyag bcu drug pa'i dkyil 'khor ltar zhes pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i ched du 'chad par 'gyur pa'i sngags kyi rjes su 'brang bas ji ltar rigs par rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi yang sa bon rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i ched du /
translated: in accordance with the mantra that will be explained,

original: gling bu ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon aom yig la sogs pa rnams gsungs so zhes bla ma kha cig go //🔽dbus kyi rim par bcom ldan 'das dang goo r'i la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: gling bu ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon aom yig la sogs pa rnams gsungs so zhes bla ma kha cig go // dbus kyi rim par bcom ldan 'das dang goo r'i la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: some gurus say that the seed syllables of the flute lady and so on are the syllable oṃ and so forth.🔽Other gurus say that the seventeen deities of the second level are this mandala,

original: gnyis par gling bu ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa'i lha bcu bdun pa rim pa gnyis pa rnams dkyil 'khor 'di'o zhes bla ma gzhan rnams gsung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis par gling bu ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa'i lha bcu bdun pa rim pa gnyis pa rnams dkyil 'khor 'di'o zhes bla ma gzhan rnams gsung ngo //
translated: with the Bhagavat and Gaurī and so on in the center and the flute lady and so on in the second.

original: phyogs 'di la ri mo bzhi rnams ni rdo rje dang 'od zer gyi phreng ba dang lha rnams kyi thig rnams te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ri mo bzhi rnams ni rdo rje dang 'od zer gyi phreng ba dang lha rnams kyi thig rnams te /
translated: In this system, the four lines are the vajra lines, the lines of light rays, and the lines of the deities.

original: phyi rol zhes pa khang pa brtsegs pa las so //
analyzed: phyi rol zhes pa khang pa brtsegs pa las so //
translated: The external is the mansion.

original: ha ri bha sa ni shing tsandan no //
analyzed: ha ri bha sa ni shing tsandan no //
translated: Haribhadra is the sandalwood tree.

original: lha'i tshogs ni brgya byin no //
analyzed: lha'i tshogs ni brgya byin no //
translated: The host of gods is Indra.

original: sprin gyi rgyal po ni chu lha ste /
analyzed: sprin gyi rgyal po ni chu lha ste /
translated: The king of clouds is Varuna,

original: sprin rnams la bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin rnams la bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the lord of the clouds.

original: gnod sbyin gyi sde can zhes pa gang gi sde gnod sbyin yin pa de @143b ni de skad de lus ngan pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sde can zhes pa gang gi sde gnod sbyin yin pa de @143b ni de skad de lus ngan pa'o //
translated: The one who has a host of yakshas is called the lord of the yakshas, that is, Kubera.

original: drang srong gi tshogs kun du 'khrigs pa ni me lha ste /
analyzed: drang srong gi tshogs kun du 'khrigs pa ni me lha ste /
translated: The host of rishis is Agni,

original: drang srong rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: drang srong rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is surrounded by rishis.

original: srin po ni bden bral lo //
analyzed: srin po ni bden bral lo //
translated: The rakshasa is Nairrita.

original: yi dags ni bhri nggi la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams te /
analyzed: yi dags ni bhri nggi la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams te /
translated: The pretas are the hosts of Bhutasantaka and so forth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las ring du rab tu song zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa las ring du rab tu song zhes byas nas so //
translated: who have gone far from the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: de rnams gang gi 'dus pa ste dbang du gyur pa yin pa de ni yi dags 'dus pa ste bde byed do //
analyzed: de rnams gang gi 'dus pa ste dbang du gyur pa yin pa de ni yi dags 'dus pa ste bde byed do //
translated: The one who has their assembly, who has brought them under his power, is the lord of the pretas, i.e., Jambhala.

original: kha cig tu gzhi tha dad pa 'bru mang po'i phyir drag po dang bcas pa'i tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: kha cig tu gzhi tha dad pa 'bru mang po'i phyir drag po dang bcas pa'i tshogs rnams so //
translated: In some places, the hosts of Rudra and so forth are mentioned, because of the many seeds of different bases.

original: dbang bcas nye dbang bcas ni lha rnams so //
analyzed: dbang bcas nye dbang bcas ni lha rnams so //
translated: The gods are the lords and the minor lords.

original: zla ba nyi mar bcas ni tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zla ba nyi mar bcas ni tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Brahma and so forth are the moon and the sun.

original: gshin rje ni chu lha la sogs pa rnams nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje ni chu lha la sogs pa rnams nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: Yama and so forth are the water gods and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi cha shas can ni rang rang gi phyogs na gnas pa'i sems can gyi phung po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi cha shas can ni rang rang gi phyogs na gnas pa'i sems can gyi phung po ste /
translated: The parts of those are the aggregates of sentient beings who abide in their own directions.🔽Those are sealed by the emanations of Mara, who are possessed by Mara, who are not accustomed to compassion and wisdom, but are very accustomed to harming others.

original: de phyogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa snying rje dang shes rab ma goms shing gzhan la gnong pa byed pa shin tu goms par byas pa'i bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdud kyi sprul pa de rnams kyis rgyas btab ste /🔽dge ba rjes su sgrub pa la rang dbang med par byas shing /
analyzed: de phyogs kyi bdag po la sogs pa snying rje dang shes rab ma goms shing gzhan la gnong pa byed pa shin tu goms par byas pa'i bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdud kyi sprul pa de rnams kyis rgyas btab ste / dge ba rjes su sgrub pa la rang dbang med par byas shing /
translated: They are the lords of the directions and so forth.

original: rmongs byas te blang bya dang ngor bya la phyin ci log tu byas la /
analyzed: rmongs byas te blang bya dang ngor bya la phyin ci log tu byas la /
translated: They are confused and are made to be mistaken about what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected.

original: zos te dge ba'i phyogs zad par byed pa'i phyir dang / thal bar bcas kyang zhes pa thal bar bcas pa rnams kyang zos te dge ba'i bag chags kyang 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zos te dge ba'i phyogs zad par byed pa'i phyir dang / thal bar bcas kyang zhes pa thal bar bcas pa rnams kyang zos te dge ba'i bag chags kyang 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they eat the roots of virtue, and even the ashes means that they also eat the ashes, destroying even the latent tendencies of virtue.

original: gso bar mdzad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams zil gyis mnan nas de dang de las bzlog par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso bar mdzad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams zil gyis mnan nas de dang de las bzlog par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One nourishes them by subduing them and turning them away from those actions.

original: 'dir 'di ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'ang 'du ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'ang 'du ba'o //
translated: Here, this is the gathering of what is taught in other tantras.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa'i shar phyogs su gtum drag ces pa'i dur khrod de /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa'i shar phyogs su gtum drag ces pa'i dur khrod de /
translated: To the east of the Mound House is the charnel ground called Caṇḍogra.

original: sgrub pa po rjes su 'dzin pa zhes pa ming gzhan no //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rjes su 'dzin pa zhes pa ming gzhan no //
translated: It is also called the one who supports the practitioner.

original: shing tsandan te /🔽rdzu 'phrul chen po ba glang po che'i gdong ba can dang / phyogs skyong ba dbang po dang khyab 'jug dang / klu nor rgyas dkar po dang / sprin sgrogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing tsandan te / rdzu 'phrul chen po ba glang po che'i gdong ba can dang / phyogs skyong ba dbang po dang khyab 'jug dang / klu nor rgyas dkar po dang / sprin sgrogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the sandalwood tree.🔽The great powerful ones are the elephant-faced one, Indra, Vishnu, the naga Muchilinda, and the one called Cloud-roarer.

original: mer drag tu dgod pa'am ming gzhan rab 'jigs @144a * //
analyzed: mer drag tu dgod pa'am ming gzhan rab 'jigs @144a * //
translated: In the south is the charnel ground called Raudra, or the one with another name, Abhayada.

original: chen po zhes bya ba'i dur khrod do //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba'i dur khrod do //
translated: The charnel ground of the great one.

original: shing ka ra nydza dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa ra'i gdong ba can dang me lha dang padma chen po dkar po dang sprin stug po'o //
analyzed: shing ka ra nydza dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa ra'i gdong ba can dang me lha dang padma chen po dkar po dang sprin stug po'o //
translated: The trees are the karñja and the one with the face of a great wonder-working buffalo, the fire god, the great white lotus, and the cloud thick.

original: lhor keng rus 'jigs pa'am ming gzhan 'jigs su rung ba mun pa can zhes bya ba'i dur khrod de /
analyzed: lhor keng rus 'jigs pa'am ming gzhan 'jigs su rung ba mun pa can zhes bya ba'i dur khrod de /
translated: In the south is the charnel ground of the fearful skeleton, or the one with the other name of the fearful one, the dark one.

original: shing aa mra dang / rdzu 'phrul chen po ba ma he'i gdong pa can dang / gshin rje dang padma dkar po dang sprin 'khor byed do //
analyzed: shing aa mra dang / rdzu 'phrul chen po ba ma he'i gdong pa can dang / gshin rje dang padma dkar po dang sprin 'khor byed do //
translated: The trees are the mango and the one with the face of a great wonder-working buffalo, the lord of death, the white lotus, and the cloud that turns in circles.

original: bden bral du ku co ca co sgrogs pa'am /
analyzed: bden bral du ku co ca co sgrogs pa'am /
translated: In the southwest is the charnel ground of the wailing and crying,

original: ming gzhan rnal 'byor mang du 'dus pa chen po'i dur khrod de /
analyzed: ming gzhan rnal 'byor mang du 'dus pa chen po'i dur khrod de /
translated: or the one with the other name of the great gathering of many yoginis.

original: bar ka ta'i dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa ro'i gdong pa can dang / srin po dang / mtha' yas sngon po dang / sprin 'gengs byed do //
analyzed: bar ka ta'i dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa ro'i gdong pa can dang / srin po dang / mtha' yas sngon po dang / sprin 'gengs byed do //
translated: The trees are the barkat and the one with the face of a great wonder-working corpse, the rakshasa, the blue limitless, and the cloud that fills.

original: nub tu 'bar ba 'khrigs pa'i dur khrod ming gzhan khro bo'i me ste /
analyzed: nub tu 'bar ba 'khrigs pa'i dur khrod ming gzhan khro bo'i me ste /
translated: In the west is the charnel ground of the blazing and swirling, or the one with the other name of the fire of wrath.

original: shing kam ke lli dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa chu srin gyi gdong ba can dang chu lha stobs rgyu ljang gu dang sprin 'jigs su rung ngo //🔽rlung du 'jigs rung mun pa can gyi dur khrod ming gzhan seng ge'i sgra phat yig chen po sgrogs pa ste /
analyzed: shing kam ke lli dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa chu srin gyi gdong ba can dang chu lha stobs rgyu ljang gu dang sprin 'jigs su rung ngo // rlung du 'jigs rung mun pa can gyi dur khrod ming gzhan seng ge'i sgra phat yig chen po sgrogs pa ste /
translated: In the northwest is the Kamkeśa tree, the great ṛṣi Makara-mukha, the green Varuṇa, and the cloud Bhayaṅkara.

original: shing aa rdzun dang rdzu 'phrul chen po ba ri dags kyi gdong ba can dang / rlung lha dang rigs ldan khra bo dang sprin char 'bebs so //
analyzed: shing aa rdzun dang rdzu 'phrul chen po ba ri dags kyi gdong ba can dang / rlung lha dang rigs ldan khra bo dang sprin char 'bebs so //
translated: In the northeast is the terrifying Tamondhakāra charnel ground, also called Siṃhanāda, where the great ṛṣi Mṛga-mukha, the wind god, and the multicolored Kṛṣṇa reside, and the cloud Varṣa-varṣa.

original: byang du gam ga ra'i dur khrod ming gzhan gnyis mi byed de /
analyzed: byang du gam ga ra'i dur khrod ming gzhan gnyis mi byed de /
translated: In the north is the Gaṅgā charnel ground, also called Dveṣṭā,

original: shing aa shva ttha dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa mi'i gdong ba can dang lus ngan dang log 'dren sde dang bcas pa dag dang / 'jog po dmar po dang sprin 'ur 'ur sgrogs so //
analyzed: shing aa shva ttha dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa mi'i gdong ba can dang lus ngan dang log 'dren sde dang bcas pa dag dang / 'jog po dmar po dang sprin 'ur 'ur sgrogs so //
translated: where the aśvattha tree, the great ṛṣi Manava, the evil spirit Kubera, the demon Kāmadeva, the red Takṣaka, and the cloud Megha-garjita reside.

original: dbang ldan du phun tshogs nags zhes bya ba'i dur khrod ming gzhan mtsho skyes dpa' bo ste /
analyzed: dbang ldan du phun tshogs nags zhes bya ba'i dur khrod ming gzhan mtsho skyes dpa' bo ste /
translated: In the northeast is the Pūrṇārāma charnel ground, also called Padma-garbha,🔽where the great ṛṣi Nāga-mukha, the evil spirit Varuṇa, the demon Rāvaṇa, the nāga Takṣaka, and the cloud Megha-megha reside.

original: shing wa ta dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa ba lang gi gdong ba can dang dbang ldan dang dung skyong ser po dang sprin gtum byed can no //
analyzed: shing wa ta dang rdzu 'phrul chen po pa ba lang gi gdong ba can dang dbang ldan dang dung skyong ser po dang sprin gtum byed can no //
translated: The tree is the Vata, the great magician is the one with the face of a cow, the powerful one is yellow, and the cloud is the one with the fierce one.

original: thams cad mchod rten blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mchod rten blta bar bya'o //
translated: All of them should be seen as stupas.

original: de la / sa srung dkar po la zhon pa //
analyzed: de la / sa srung dkar po la zhon pa //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: and so forth,

analyzed: cang te'u yis brel ba'i phyag / ces pa'i bar sum cu rtsa bzhi par 'chad par 'gyur ba 'dir shes par bya'o //

original: gdengs can brgyad rnams mi'i gdong can //
analyzed: gdengs can brgyad rnams mi'i gdong can //

analyzed: nyi mar gshin rje srin por me //
translated: In the sun, Yama is Rakshasa, in the fire,

original: gzhan rnams zla bar zla 'od can //
analyzed: gzhan rnams zla bar zla 'od can //

analyzed: sgrin rnams ni nam mkha' la kha dog sna tshogs pa glog 'gyur ba dang / sgra sgrogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The wise ones are lightning in the sky, of various colors, flashing and roaring,

analyzed: 'ga' zhig char gyi rgyun can rnams so //

translated: These eight are also beautiful with various other excellent trees.🔽They are terrifying with crows, owls, vultures, dogs, jackals, lions, pigs, tigers, and so on.

analyzed: go nas la sogs pa'i sbrul rnams kyis shin tu bag tsha bar byed pa can /

translated: The charnel grounds are terrifying with skeletons, impaled bodies, and hanging corpses, half-burned corpses, heads, skulls, knees, and headless torsos, bones, pieces of skulls, and so forth.🔽The charnel grounds are filled with various accomplished masters and knowledge holders, and with groups of male and female practitioners who keep their sacred pledges.🔽The charnel grounds are filled with the sounds of zombies, yakṣas, rākṣasas, and so forth, who run here and there, move about, stand, sit, lie down, and rise up.

original: bzhin pa'i ro langs dang gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pa rnams kyis dang / 'di nas dang de nas rgyug pa dang / g-yo ba dang 'greng ba dang sdod pa dang nyal ba dang / ldang ba rnams kyis shin tu ngo mtshar bar byed pa'i dur khrod chen po rnams so //

translated: The charnel grounds are filled with these and other amazing sights.

analyzed: 'di rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang du lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyis yongs su bskor ba'i bcom ldan 'das bde mchog sku mdog sngon po nor bu dang sna tshogs rdo rje dang zla ba'i cha dang mi bskyod pas mtshan pa'i ral pa'i
translated: He is blue, with a topknot of hair marked by a jewel, a crossed vajra, a moon, and Akṣobhya.🔽He wears a garland of skulls

analyzed: cod pan can dpral pa'i steng du thod @145a * // pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa /

analyzed: spyan gsum pa /

analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal gcig pa /

original: mgo bo'i phreng ba mdun du 'phyang ba /
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng ba mdun du 'phyang ba /

translated: He holds a khaṭvāṅga staff with a skull cup filled with blood in the manner of holding something in front of the chest. His left hand embraces Vajravārāhī.

analyzed: phyag g-yas pa steng du phyar ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba 'dzin pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yang dmar mo spyan gsum pa /

analyzed: dbu skra grol ba /

analyzed: phyag rgya lnga pa can /

translated: The two-armed one who delights in the cremation ground and the two-armed one with a cremation ground seat are similar to the previously described one, as is appropriate.

analyzed: @145b gzhung mangs par ma gyur cig ces pas 'dir rnam par ma phye'o //

analyzed: dngos grub ces pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'thob bo zhes pa'o //

analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa ;

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bcu gnyis pa'o /

original: // / de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'am bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po 'di'i rnal 'byor ba gnas pa la rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams 'du ba'i don du bdag nyid brdas nges par ston te /
analyzed: // / de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'am bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po 'di'i rnal 'byor ba gnas pa la rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams 'du ba'i don du bdag nyid brdas nges par ston te /

original: de'i phyir brda de shes pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir brda de shes pa'i don du gsungs pa /

analyzed: phyag rgya ni brda ste de gsal bar byed pa'i ngag gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: gsang chen ni sba bar bya ba'o //

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yang ngo //

analyzed: bha ru ni mang po'o //

analyzed: aom ga ni yan lag rnams la'o //

analyzed: ta him dza ni der yang ngo //

analyzed: de kho na gsungs pa ma la aa dze zhes pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa drang ba'i don to //

analyzed: nges pa'i don ni ko lla ai ri ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'o //

analyzed: mu mmu ni ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //

analyzed: de dag n'i da ni cang te'u'i sgra'o //

analyzed: 'dir yang aa yig gi n'a das gyen du bskyod pa'i gtum mo dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das rtsod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //

analyzed: snying rje chen po bcom ldan 'das ni snying rje bdud rtsi'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das ni de la 'khyud pa kho na'o //

analyzed: ba la ste snying ga'i 'khor lo la sogs par son pa gtum mos sreg pa ni za ba'o //

analyzed: myos byed ni byang chub sems kyi rgyun no //

analyzed: k'a li nydza ra ni rjes su mthun pa'i rlung ste de gzhug pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i ru'o //

analyzed: ru ndu ro ni rkyang ma dang ro mar song ba'i rlung ngo //

original: dor ba ni der de rab tu mi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: dor ba ni der de rab tu mi rgyu ba'o //

analyzed: bzhi mnyam pa la sogs pa rnams gtum mo'i 'od kyis gdungs pa'i yan lag rnams su thim pa ni sbyar ba'o //

original: de nas thim pa'i bzhi mnyam yan lag thams cad pa sh'a la'i tshod mar gzhag par bya ba gtum mo'i 'od kyi me la ji ltar 'dod par sbyin sreg mchog ni bza' pa'o ;

original: / phrem kha na kha ta dag ni bcom ldan 'das gnas su 'gro ba dang de dang lhan cig gtum mo 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: / phrem kha na kha ta dag ni bcom ldan 'das gnas su 'gro ba dang de dang lhan cig gtum mo 'ong ba'o //

original: de'i tshe yang bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa'i sems la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung ba ni dag pa dang ma dag pa dag mi sems pa'o ;

analyzed: / gtum mo'i 'od kyis yongs su sbyangs pa'i rtsa rnams su bde ba chen po'i zla ba'i 'od rnams kyis kun du 'gengs pa ni /

original: ram shu yan lag rnams la 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: ram shu yan lag rnams la 'dogs pa'o //
translated: which is the binding of the rasanā and lalanā.

original: de ltar ro ru gyur pa'i lus kyi lhag ma zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rnams la rnam pa thams cad du thim @146b pa ni ro gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ro ru gyur pa'i lus kyi lhag ma zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rnams la rnam pa thams cad du thim @146b pa ni ro gzhug pa'o //

original: de ltar yan lag thams cad la mngon par khyab pa'i shes rab thabs dag 'khor ba'i bar du ro mnyam pa'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba ni ma la yar skyes pas ku ndu ru 'jug pa'o //

translated: Thus, the wisdom and means which pervade all the limbs experience the great bliss of the same taste as cyclic existence until the end of time, which is the birth of the child in Malaya and the entry into the pleasure grove.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i skabs su yang thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa gnyid skyes par gyur pa na di ndi ma dang 'dra ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dor bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i skabs su yang thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa gnyid skyes par gyur pa na di ndi ma dang 'dra ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dor bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: At that time, when he is superior to all, when he is born in the sleep of deep sleep, the afflictions that are like the mother of sleep are not cast off.

original: 'on kyang yongs su dag cing de dang ro gcig pa 'di rnams de'i tshe mngon par mtho ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yongs su dag cing de dang ro gcig pa 'di rnams de'i tshe mngon par mtho ba kho na'o //

original: nges pa'i don 'di la yang sngar bshad pa'i drang ba'i don nye bar mkho zhing /
analyzed: nges pa'i don 'di la yang sngar bshad pa'i drang ba'i don nye bar mkho zhing /

analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi yan lag kyang ngo //

original: de skad du yang sngar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang sngar gsungs pa /

original: byang chub sems ni sum cu gnyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni sum cu gnyis //

original: gang tshe gang ba nyid 'dir gyur //
analyzed: gang tshe gang ba nyid 'dir gyur //

analyzed: de yi rjes thogs dbang po dang // phung po 'byung ba sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: immediately after that, the faculties, aggregates, and elements are buddhahood.

analyzed: ces so // 'di tsam kho nas rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This alone is not the state of Vajradhara.

original: 'on kyang tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i ched dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i ched du man ngag ji lta bar bsgrub par bya ste /

analyzed: de las 'bad pa med par phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba'o zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: 'di rgyas par bstan pa ni nyi shu rtsa lnga par ro //

analyzed: gho ghu zhes pa ngag gi brda dang spyi bor thal mo sbyar ba gzhag pa ni mar me ma'i mtshan ma'o //

original: 'dri ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba gsal bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: skyes pa ni d'a ru brjod par bya'o //
