original: gzhan rnams gang las yongs su gyur pa de ni yongs gyur ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams gang las yongs su gyur pa de ni yongs gyur ma'o //
translated: The word transformed means that she is transformed from something else.

original: byis pas mtshon nas gcig tu 'gro ba ste de dang lhan cig pa de ni byis bcas ma'o //
analyzed: byis pas mtshon nas gcig tu 'gro ba ste de dang lhan cig pa de ni byis bcas ma'o //
translated: The word with children means that she is accompanied by children, who are indicated by the word childish.

original: skyo ba na ni yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: skyo ba na ni yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba na'o //
translated: The word weary means when there is weariness.

original: mi ldog ma ni 'di la phyir ldog pa med ces byas nas so //
analyzed: mi ldog ma ni 'di la phyir ldog pa med ces byas nas so //
translated: The word unretreating means not retreating from this.

original: rgod byed ces pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la glo bur zhes pa 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: rgod byed ces pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la glo bur zhes pa 'brel par bya'o //
translated: The word suddenly is to be connected with the verbs laughing and so forth.

original: phyogs 'dir yun ring du gnas so zhes pa 'di dpa' mo'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'dir yun ring du gnas so zhes pa 'di dpa' mo'o //
translated: The word heroine means she who remains in this direction for a long time.

original: rnal 'byor ma mo zhes pa rnal 'byor dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma mo zhes pa rnal 'byor dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word yoginī means she who is in accord with yoga.

original: rab tu rgod ces pa la sogs pa brgyad pa rdo rje phag mo'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: rab tu rgod ces pa la sogs pa brgyad pa rdo rje phag mo'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: The word very excited and so forth are the characteristics of the eighth, Vajravārāhī.

original: / de skad du yang rnal 'byor ma bzhi sbyor ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de skad du yang rnal 'byor ma bzhi sbyor ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Yoga of the Four Yoginis:

original: gzugs can 'o byed l'a ma dang / yongs sgyur ma dang byis bcas ma //
analyzed: gzugs can 'o byed l'a ma dang / yongs sgyur ma dang byis bcas ma //
translated: The one with form, the one who kisses, the one who turns around, the one with a child,

original: mi ldog ma dang 'di pa mo //
analyzed: mi ldog ma dang 'di pa mo //
translated: The one who does not turn back, the one who is here,

original: rdo rje ma ni brgyad por bshad //
analyzed: rdo rje ma ni brgyad por bshad //
translated: The one with a vajra is explained as the eighth.

original: dang po rgyas 'debs phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: dang po rgyas 'debs phyag rgya ste //
translated: The first is the seal of the seal,

original: gnyis pa snying nas 'gugs byed ma //
analyzed: gnyis pa snying nas 'gugs byed ma //
translated: The second is the one who attracts from the heart,

original: gsum pa rmongs pa byed phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa rmongs pa byed phyag rgya'o //
translated: The third is the seal of the one who causes confusion,

original: de bzhin bzhi pa langs byed ma //
analyzed: de bzhin bzhi pa langs byed ma //
translated: The fourth is the one who causes to rise,

original: lnga pa gar byed phyag rgya ma'o //
analyzed: lnga pa gar byed phyag rgya ma'o //
translated: The fifth is the seal of the one who dances,

original: de bzhin drug pa gsod byed 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin drug pa gsod byed 'gyur //
translated: The sixth is the one who kills,

original: bdun pa za byed phyag rgya mo //
analyzed: bdun pa za byed phyag rgya mo //
translated: The seventh is the seal of the one who eats,

original: brgyad pa nges par slong byed ma //
analyzed: brgyad pa nges par slong byed ma //
translated: The eighth is the one who definitely causes to rise.

original: gshin rje skrag byed drag mo dang // @149a * //
analyzed: gshin rje skrag byed drag mo dang // @149a * //
translated: Yama, the one who causes fear, the fierce one,

original: gtum mo dang ni tshe za mo //
analyzed: gtum mo dang ni tshe za mo //
translated: The fierce one, the one who eats life,

original: 'od gsal ma dang k'a na n'i //
analyzed: 'od gsal ma dang k'a na n'i //
translated: The one with light, and Kanakhalini,

original: phag mo'ang brgyad par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: phag mo'ang brgyad par 'dod pa yin //
translated: The sow is also asserted as the eighth.

original: zhes so // mche ba ni phag gi so'o //
analyzed: zhes so // mche ba ni phag gi so'o //
translated: The fangs are the teeth of a pig.

original: thod pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya brgyad ni rim pa ji lta bar rnal 'byor ma brgyad rnams kyi phyag rgya ste khyim du bris pa yang mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thod pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya brgyad ni rim pa ji lta bar rnal 'byor ma brgyad rnams kyi phyag rgya ste khyim du bris pa yang mtshan nyid do //
translated: The eight emblems such as the skull cup are the emblems of the eight yoginis, and they are also the characteristics of the yoginis drawn in the house.

original: bdun pa zhes kha cig tu klog pa ni yig mkhan gyi skyon las so //
analyzed: bdun pa zhes kha cig tu klog pa ni yig mkhan gyi skyon las so //
translated: Some read “the seventh” but that is a fault of the scribe.

original: gzugs can ma la sogs pa mtshon pa 'di rnams dang lhan cig yang dag par sbyar bas de snyoms par zhugs pas so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma la sogs pa mtshon pa 'di rnams dang lhan cig yang dag par sbyar bas de snyoms par zhugs pas so //
translated: By uniting with these indicated Nairatmya and so on, he enters into union with them.

original: bsgrub par bya bas na cho ga ste lhan cig skyes pa bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bas na cho ga ste lhan cig skyes pa bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The rite is that which is to be accomplished, namely, the innate great bliss.

original: mtshon par byas te stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i rnal 'byor ma la mkhas pas so //
analyzed: mtshon par byas te stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i rnal 'byor ma la mkhas pas so //
translated: Having indicated it, the yoginis are skilled in the yoga of emptiness and compassion.

original: lus sprul pa mo ni 'jig rten rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ma ma gzugs can ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: lus sprul pa mo ni 'jig rten rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ma ma gzugs can ma la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The emanation of the body is the worldly nurses such as Nairatmya and so on.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan ma mtshan nyid dang phyag rgya thod pa la sogs pa mtshan ma'i phyag rgya ste de rjod par byed pa'i rab tu byed pa yang de skad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan ma mtshan nyid dang phyag rgya thod pa la sogs pa mtshan ma'i phyag rgya ste de rjod par byed pa'i rab tu byed pa yang de skad do //
translated: The signs of those are the characteristics, the hand-symbols, the skull-cup, etc., the symbolic hand-symbols. The chapter that describes them is called that.

original: mo rtags nyid ni /
analyzed: mo rtags nyid ni /
translated: The female signs are

original: bdun ma mi rnams gzhug par bya //
analyzed: bdun ma mi rnams gzhug par bya //
translated: the seven [signs] that are to be placed on men.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes pa'o //🔽dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes pa'o // dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: And so on.

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: The fourteenth flower of the Sheaf of Instructions, the commentary on the glorious Yoga Tantra.

original: // / l'a ma'i rigs can gyi bud med rnams kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa /
analyzed: // / l'a ma'i rigs can gyi bud med rnams kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa /
translated: The Introduction to the Characteristics of Women of the Lāmā Family

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: padma gar dbang ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: padma gar dbang ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The Lotus Lord of Dance is Amitābha.

original: ri ni ra nyid do //
analyzed: ri ni ra nyid do //
translated: The mountain is the ra.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes pa mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The dakinis are the dakinis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgata is Vairocana.

original: spu ldan zhes pa ni lus la spu rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: spu ldan zhes pa ni lus la spu rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The hairy one is the one with hair on the body.

original: 'dres pa ni rna shal te de'i rnam pa can gyi ri mo'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni rna shal te de'i rnam pa can gyi ri mo'o //
translated: The “mixed” is the ear-ring, the figure having that form.

original: rnam par 'dren pa ni dpal bde mchog go //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pa ni dpal bde mchog go //
translated: The “leader” is Śrī Heruka.

original: mi g-yo ba ni shin tu brtan pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni shin tu brtan pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The “immovable” is the one endowed with great firmness.

original: lag pa gnyis sbyar bar bya ste mthe bo gnyis bkug nas sor mo gzhan rnams cung zad bkug cing rtse mo dang rtse mo sprad pa las padma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis sbyar bar bya ste mthe bo gnyis bkug nas sor mo gzhan rnams cung zad bkug cing rtse mo dang rtse mo sprad pa las padma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: One should join the two hands, bend the two thumbs, and slightly bend the other fingers, touching tip to tip, and make the lotus gesture.

original: lag pa gcig brkyang nas de'i steng du de las gzhan pa'i lag pa bskum pa rus sbal ltar gnas pa las rus sbal gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gcig brkyang nas de'i steng du de las gzhan pa'i lag pa bskum pa rus sbal ltar gnas pa las rus sbal gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: One should extend one hand and place the other hand on top of it, like a tortoise, and make the tortoise gesture.

original: @149b phyag rgya gnyis po 'di ni sgrub pa po'i'o //
analyzed: @149b phyag rgya gnyis po 'di ni sgrub pa po'i'o //
translated: These two gestures are of the practitioner.

original: phrag pa g-yon pa nas 'phyang ba'i gos g-yo ba dpung pa g-yon pa bskum pas 'dzin pa'i tshul ni rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phrag pa g-yon pa nas 'phyang ba'i gos g-yo ba dpung pa g-yon pa bskum pas 'dzin pa'i tshul ni rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The “victorious” gesture is the garment hanging from the left shoulder, held by the left arm bent, as if holding it.

original: mchod par bya zhes klog pa la ni /
analyzed: mchod par bya zhes klog pa la ni /
translated: One should recite “make offerings.”

original: gang mchod par bya ba de rgyal ba de kho na'o zhes pas rgyal ba'i phyag rgya kho na dkyogs  pas gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mchod par bya ba de rgyal ba de kho na'o zhes pas rgyal ba'i phyag rgya kho na dkyogs  pas gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is to be worshipped is the Victor alone, so it is said by the Victor's seal alone, by the seal of the Victor.

original: phyag rgya gnyis po 'di ni rim pa ji lta bar phyag rgya'i lan du rnal 'byor mas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gnyis po 'di ni rim pa ji lta bar phyag rgya'i lan du rnal 'byor mas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: These two seals are to be given by the yoginis in response to the seals, in the proper order.

original: mdung gi phyag rgya zhes pa mthe bos mthe chung mnan nas de la gzhan pa'i sor mo rnams gyen du brkyang ba las so //
analyzed: mdung gi phyag rgya zhes pa mthe bos mthe chung mnan nas de la gzhan pa'i sor mo rnams gyen du brkyang ba las so //
translated: The spear seal is made by pressing the thumb against the little finger and raising the other fingers.

original: rkang ba g-yon pa bskum nas skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis g-yon du yongs su bskor ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rkang ba g-yon pa bskum nas skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis g-yon du yongs su bskor ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The yoginis' response seal is made by turning to the left in the dance posture with the left leg extended and the right drawn in.

original: mchod ces pa mchod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mchod ces pa mchod pa'i dus so //
translated: Worship is the time of worship.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug ma rnams kyi zhes pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs can ma rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug ma rnams kyi zhes pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs can ma rnams kyi'o //
translated: The women of Lokesvara are those of the family of Amitabha.

original: dar bcings pa zhes pa dpral bar dar bcings pa lta bu'i ri mo gcig go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dar bcings pa zhes pa dpral bar dar bcings pa lta bu'i ri mo gcig go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The bound cloth is a single line on the forehead, as if a cloth were bound there.

original: mthe bos sor mo thams cad mnan nas gyen du sdigs mdzub brkyang ba las 'phang mdung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe bos sor mo thams cad mnan nas gyen du sdigs mdzub brkyang ba las 'phang mdung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra of the spear is made by pressing down all the fingers with the thumbs and extending the index fingers upward.

original: dril bu dkrol ba'i tshul gyis dril bu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dril bu dkrol ba'i tshul gyis dril bu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra of the bell is made by ringing the bell.

original: gnyis pa zhes pa lan gyi phyag rgya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes pa lan gyi phyag rgya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The second is the mudra of the reply.

original: de byas nas yongs su bsgyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de byas nas yongs su bsgyur bar bya ste /
translated: Having made that, one should transform it.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma la yang ngo //
translated: The same is done for the following.

original: rdo rje thal mo byas nas gung mo gnyis bslang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo byas nas gung mo gnyis bslang ste /
translated: Having made the vajra-folded-hands, one should raise the two middle fingers.

original: sdigs mdzub gnyis kyis ming med gnyis dkris shing //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub gnyis kyis ming med gnyis dkris shing //
translated: The two index fingers should be crossed with the two name fingers,

original: mthe bo gnyis drang por byas nas kha dang nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes pa kha'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis drang por byas nas kha dang nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes pa kha'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: and the two thumbs should be extended and placed near the mouth. This is the mouth mudra.

original: ming med bzlog pa dag lag pa dag gi nang du byas la /
analyzed: ming med bzlog pa dag lag pa dag gi nang du byas la /
translated: The two name fingers should be reversed and placed in the middle of the hands.

original: mthe bong gdengs ka'i rnam pa dag sbyar zhing mthe chung dang gung mo khab lta bu ngag ste /
analyzed: mthe bong gdengs ka'i rnam pa dag sbyar zhing mthe chung dang gung mo khab lta bu ngag ste /
translated: The two thumbs should be joined in the form of a hook, and the two little fingers and middle fingers should be like needles.

original: gung mo khab lta bu'i ngos su sdigs mdzub dag bskum nas tshigs gsum par bya'o zhes pa kha'i phyag rgya'o zhes dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po'i rgyud du gsungs so //
analyzed: gung mo khab lta bu'i ngos su sdigs mdzub dag bskum nas tshigs gsum par bya'o zhes pa kha'i phyag rgya'o zhes dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po'i rgyud du gsungs so //
translated: The index fingers are bent at the third joint, like a needle, and are placed on the middle fingers. This is the mouth seal.

original: 'khor lo'i phyag rgya zhes kha cig tu klog ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i phyag rgya zhes kha cig tu klog ste /
translated: Some read “the wheel seal.”

original: de'i tshe lag pa gnyis gan rkyal du byas shing gung mo dang ming med kyi sen mo dag gi steng du mthe bo dgod par @150a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe lag pa gnyis gan rkyal du byas shing gung mo dang ming med kyi sen mo dag gi steng du mthe bo dgod par @150a * //
translated: At that time, the two hands are placed face up, and the thumbs are placed on top of the nails of the middle fingers and ring fingers.

original: bya'o zhes pa 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: bya'o zhes pa 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the wheel seal.

original: dung gi phyag rgya zhes pa gung mo dang ming med dang mthe chung rnams bskum nas dung gi tshul gyis mthe bo dang sdigs mdzub dag brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: dung gi phyag rgya zhes pa gung mo dang ming med dang mthe chung rnams bskum nas dung gi tshul gyis mthe bo dang sdigs mdzub dag brkyang ba'o //
translated: The conch seal is formed by bending the middle fingers, ring fingers, and little fingers, and extending the thumbs and index fingers in the shape of a conch.

original: de bzhin kho na zhes pa g-yon pa yis lan gyi phyag rgya'o zhes bshad pa ste ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin kho na zhes pa g-yon pa yis lan gyi phyag rgya'o zhes bshad pa ste ji lta ba'o //
translated: “Just like that” means that the left hand is the response seal.

original: dus tshigs zhes pa bsod nams kyi dga' ston gyi dus so //
analyzed: dus tshigs zhes pa bsod nams kyi dga' ston gyi dus so //
translated: “Season” means the time of the festival of merit.

original: gcig pa zhes pa so bsnyer ba'o //
analyzed: gcig pa zhes pa so bsnyer ba'o //
translated: “One” means the time of the full moon.

original: lag pa g-yon pa phyung bar byas te /🔽de'i steng du gru mo g-yas pa bzhag nas mthe bong dang sdigs mdzub dag bslang zhing /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa phyung bar byas te / de'i steng du gru mo g-yas pa bzhag nas mthe bong dang sdigs mdzub dag bslang zhing /
translated: Having extended the left hand,🔽placing the right elbow on top of that, one should hold the right hand with the thumb and forefinger extended and the three fingers bent.

original: sor mo gsum bskum pa'i lag pa g-yas pa gzung bar bya'o zhes pa sprul gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sor mo gsum bskum pa'i lag pa g-yas pa gzung bar bya'o zhes pa sprul gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the snake mudra.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes pa g-yon pas lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes pa g-yon pas lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The as before is the reply mudra with the left hand.

original: 'di rnams phal cher l'a ma'i rigs can rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gsungs shing /
analyzed: 'di rnams phal cher l'a ma'i rigs can rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gsungs shing /
translated: For the most part, these are said to be the characteristics of the Lāmā class.

original: rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams kyi 'ang 'di rnams su rig par bya'o zhes pa man ngag go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams kyi 'ang 'di rnams su rig par bya'o zhes pa man ngag go //
translated: And it should be understood that these are also the mudras of the thirty-seven yoginīs.

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: This concludes the fifteenth chapter of the glorious Heruka Tantra,

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bco lnga pa'o /🔽// / phyag rgya gzhan brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bco lnga pa'o / // / phyag rgya gzhan brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: the fifteenth flower of the Bouquet of Instructions.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to describe other mudras, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: yan lag phyag rgya zhes pa yan lag gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: yan lag phyag rgya zhes pa yan lag gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The “limb mudra” is the limb mudra.

original: ku l'a zhes pa ni 'phongs tshos so //
analyzed: ku l'a zhes pa ni 'phongs tshos so //
translated: Kula means the buttocks.

original: gsang ba ni skye gnas so //
analyzed: gsang ba ni skye gnas so //
translated: Secret means the sexual organ.

original: mthe bong dang mdzub mo dag dang por byas te rtse mo dang rtse mo sbyar nas sor mo lhag ma rnams bskum pa las chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe bong dang mdzub mo dag dang por byas te rtse mo dang rtse mo sbyar nas sor mo lhag ma rnams bskum pa las chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The dharma-mudra is made by first forming the thumb and forefinger into a point and then bending the remaining fingers.

original: mthil zhes pa rkang pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mthil zhes pa rkang pa'i 'o //
translated: The palm is the foot.

original: lag pa'i zhes pa kha cig go ;
analyzed: lag pa'i zhes pa kha cig go ;
translated: The hand is the hand.

original: / nyi ma zhes pa ni lus g-yas so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: / nyi ma zhes pa ni lus g-yas so zhes kha cig go //
translated: The sun is the right side of the body.

original: chu bo zhes pa lag pas nam mkha' la ri mo 'khyog po byed pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: chu bo zhes pa lag pas nam mkha' la ri mo 'khyog po byed pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The river is the hand drawn in the sky in a crooked line.

original: rab tu brkyang ba'i sor mo bskyod bzhin pa'i lag pa gnyis kyis chu rlabs kyi tshul gyis nye bar ston pa las rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rab tu brkyang ba'i sor mo bskyod bzhin pa'i lag pa gnyis kyis chu rlabs kyi tshul gyis nye bar ston pa las rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The ocean mudra is made by showing the two hands as if they were waves, with the fingers extended and moving.

original: gang zhig sor mo gcig ston ma //
analyzed: gang zhig sor mo gcig ston ma //
translated: The one who shows one finger

original: zhes pa skyes pa'i nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa skyes pa'i nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: is the male symbol.

original: phyi mar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi mar yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for the next.

original: sor mo gnyis kyi zhes pa sor mo gnyis te /
analyzed: sor mo gnyis kyi zhes pa sor mo gnyis te /
translated: Two fingers is two fingers.

original: 'di ni lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lan gyi phyag rgya'o //

analyzed: da lta'i dgos pa'o zhes pa'i don to // dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /

analyzed: // / de ltar brda shes pa gang du 'du bar bya ba de brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /

analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'du ba der ts'a ru'i bza' ba ni bdud rtsir byas pa'o //

analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dag gi snod gnyis su son pa lhag ma bza' bar bya ste /

analyzed: brtson par ji ltar 'gyur ba'o //

original: gnas zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'o //

translated: These are the abodes and so forth, which are the twelve stages of devoted conduct such as the Joyous and so forth.🔽They arise in these, which are the stages.

original: su rnams she na /
analyzed: su rnams she na /
translated: Who arises in them?

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ni byang chub sems dpa'o //

original: mgon po zhes pa sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mgon po zhes pa sangs rgyas so //
translated: The protector is the Buddha.

translated: The lords of the ten stages, except for the stage of the Buddha and the stage of the common man, are the bodhisattvas, who are characterized by faith in that.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sa thams cad kyi dbang phyug go //

original: 'di rnams kyis ni gnas la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni gnas la sogs pa rnams so //

analyzed: gzhan gyis min zhes pa gnas la sogs pa las gzhan pa rnams kyis te /

original: rgya chen ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgya chen ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Extensive refers to the perfection of ones own aim.

translated: Vast refers to the perfection of the aims of others.🔽Those that arise from the Buddhas and bodhisattvas are extensive and vast.

original: 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: They are the great elements.

original: thung du nyid ni lung ngo //
analyzed: thung du nyid ni lung ngo //

original: gnas ni dz'a la ndha ra dang / ao di ya na dang pu ll'i ra ma la ya dang aa rbu da'o //
analyzed: gnas ni dz'a la ndha ra dang / ao di ya na dang pu ll'i ra ma la ya dang aa rbu da'o //

analyzed: bolla gi ri dang ko lla gi ri dang pu ll'i ra ma la ya dang rdo rje'i gnas zhes pa rnam grangs so //

analyzed: nye ba'i gnas ni go d'a ba r'i dang r'a me shva ri dang de w'i ko ta dang m'a la wa yang ngo //
translated: The neighboring sacred places are Godāvarī, Rāmeśvara, Devīkoṭa, and Mālava.

original: zhing ni k'a ma r'u pa dang ao tre'o //
analyzed: zhing ni k'a ma r'u pa dang ao tre'o //

analyzed: nye ba'i zhing ni tri sha ku ne dang ko sha la'o //

analyzed: tsando ha ni ka li ngka dang la mb'a ka'o //

original: nye ba'i tshando do ha ni k'a nytsi dang kha ba'i khor yug can no //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshando do ha ni k'a nytsi dang kha ba'i khor yug can no //

original: 'du ba ni pre ta pu ri dang gri ha de wa ta'o //
analyzed: 'du ba ni pre ta pu ri dang gri ha de wa ta'o //

analyzed: nye ba'i 'du ba ni soo r'a shta dang gser gling ngo //

analyzed: dur khrod ni grong khyer phat li pu tra dang si ndhu zhes pa gnyis so //

analyzed: nye ba'i dur khrod ni ma ru dang ku lu t'a'o //

original: 'thung gcod ni k'a ra n+ya p'a ta ka dang kar ma p'a ta ka dang / ha ri ke la dang 'bigs byed kyi nags dang gzhon nu'i grong khyer pa lnga dang tsa ri tra dang grong dang grong khyer gyi mtha'i sa zhes pa gnyis kyang rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa 'dir man ngag las shes par bya'o zhes pa bdun no //

analyzed: lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i dbus son pa //

analyzed: skyed tshal dang rdzing bu'i 'gram ni nye ba'i dur khrod do //

analyzed: de skad du yang rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rgyud du gsungs pa /

analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes yang dag grags //

analyzed: rdo rje dkyil 'khor gtso mo de /

analyzed: ye shes ldan rnams yul yul du //

analyzed: gnas ni dz'a la ndha ra dang / ao di ya na dang p'u rna gi ri dang k'a ma r'u pa'o //

analyzed: nye ba'i gnas ni m'a la wa dang si ndhu dang n'a ga ra'o //

analyzed: nye ba'i tshando ha ni ka li ngka dang gser gling dang ko ngka na'o //

analyzed: nye ba'i 'thung gcod ni 'thung gcod dang nye ba lnga'o //

analyzed: dur khrod ni dur khrod kyis gzhi dang rgya mtsho'i 'gram zhes pa gnyis so //

analyzed: nye ba'i dur khrod ni skyed mos tshal dang rdzing bu'i 'gram mo zhes rgyas par bshad la 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba dag ni rgyas par ma bstan pa dang / phyag rgya chen po'i thig le'i rgyud du ni gnas ni dz'a la ndha ra dang ao di ya na dang /
translated: The five assemblies and the five neighboring assemblies are not explained in detail, and the Great Seal Drop Tantra explains the places as Jālandhara, Oḍḍiyāna,

original: p'u rna gi ri dang k'a ma r'u pa'o //
analyzed: p'u rna gi ri dang k'a ma r'u pa'o //
translated: Pūrṇagiri, and Kāmarūpa.

analyzed: nye ba'i gnas ni m'a la wa dang n'a ga ra dang si ndhu dang sing ha la'o //

original: zhing ni mu mmu ni dang de w'i ko ta'o //
analyzed: zhing ni mu mmu ni dang de w'i ko ta'o //
translated: The fields are Mummu and Devīkoṭa.

original: nye ba'i zhing ni ku lu t'a dang aa rbu da'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i zhing ni ku lu t'a dang aa rbu da'o //
translated: The neighboring fields are Kuluta and Arbuda.

original: tshando ha ni go d'a wa r'i dang ha ri ke la'o //
analyzed: tshando ha ni go d'a wa r'i dang ha ri ke la'o //
translated: The gathering places are Godāvarī and Harikelā.

original: nye ba'i tshando ha ni k'a nytsi dang la mp'a ka'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshando ha ni k'a nytsi dang la mp'a ka'o //
translated: The neighboring gathering places are Kāñcī and Lampāka.

original: 'du ba ni ka rm'a ra pa ta ka dang gser gling ngo //
analyzed: 'du ba ni ka rm'a ra pa ta ka dang gser gling ngo //
translated: The charnel grounds are Karmarapāṭaka and Suvarṇadvīpa.

original: nye ba'i 'du ba ni ko ngka na dang 'bigs byed do //🔽dur khrod ni rab song gis gzhi dang rgya mtsho'i ngogs so //🔽nye ba'i dur khrod ni tsa ri tra dang gzhon nu'i grong khyer ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'du ba ni ko ngka na dang 'bigs byed do // dur khrod ni rab song gis gzhi dang rgya mtsho'i ngogs so // nye ba'i dur khrod ni tsa ri tra dang gzhon nu'i grong khyer ro //
translated: The neighboring charnel grounds are Koṅkaṇa and Vindhya.

original: 'thung gcod ni kha che dang ki r'a ta'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'thung gcod ni kha che dang ki r'a ta'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The drinking places are Kashmir and the mandala of Kirāta.🔽The neighboring drinking places are Nepal and Kānyakubja.

original: nye ba'i 'thung gcod ni bal po dang k'a n+ya ku ba dza'o zhes gsal por mdzad pa dang / ri g'i aa ra li'i rgyud du /
analyzed: nye ba'i 'thung gcod ni bal po dang k'a n+ya ku ba dza'o zhes gsal por mdzad pa dang / ri g'i aa ra li'i rgyud du /
translated: This is clearly stated in the commentary and in the Āryā Tantra:

original: shar lus 'phags po dang lho 'dzam bu gling dang nub pa glang spyod dang byang sgra mi snyan ni gnas te /
analyzed: shar lus 'phags po dang lho 'dzam bu gling dang nub pa glang spyod dang byang sgra mi snyan ni gnas te /
translated: The eastern continent is Videha, the southern continent is Jambudvīpa, the western continent is Godānīya and the northern continent is Kuru.🔽

original: gnas bzhis ni lha @152a * //
analyzed: gnas bzhis ni lha @152a * //
translated: The four continents are in the east, Videha, in the south, Jambudvīpa, in the west, Godānīya, and in the north, Kuru.🔽The four abodes are in the four directions of Meru.

original: mo bzhi rnams dang ri rab kyi rtse mo la ri g'i gnas so zhes gsungs pa dang / rgyud gzhan rnams su yang gnas la sogs pa phyi dang nang du yang rnam pa gzhan du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: mo bzhi rnams dang ri rab kyi rtse mo la ri g'i gnas so zhes gsungs pa dang / rgyud gzhan rnams su yang gnas la sogs pa phyi dang nang du yang rnam pa gzhan du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In other tantras, the abodes and so on are presented in other ways, both externally and internally.

original: ci tsam bri bar bya /
analyzed: ci tsam bri bar bya /
translated: How much should be written?

original: de'i phyir thams cad du phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhen mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhen mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: gang phyir aa rbu da la gnas dang nye ba'i zhing nyid dag grang ba dang dro ba bzhin nam dngos po dang dngos med dag bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba srid pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gang phyir aa rbu da la gnas dang nye ba'i zhing nyid dag grang ba dang dro ba bzhin nam dngos po dang dngos med dag bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba srid pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Because it is not possible for the abodes and the adjacent lands to be mutually contradictory, like cold and heat, or like entities and nonentities.

original: gcig la ming sna tshogs pa ji ltar yang mi 'gal bas so //
analyzed: gcig la ming sna tshogs pa ji ltar yang mi 'gal bas so //
translated: It is not contradictory for a single thing to have various names.

original: de bzhin du go d'a ba r'i la nye ba'i gnas nyid dang nye ba'i zhing nyid dang tshando ha rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du go d'a ba r'i la nye ba'i gnas nyid dang nye ba'i zhing nyid dang tshando ha rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the near-places and near-fields of Godāvarī, and the caṇḍohas.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang mi 'gal ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang mi 'gal ba shes par bya'o //
translated: And likewise, the others should be understood without contradiction.

original: gzhan yang gdul bya'i bsam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa las thugs rje'i rang bzhin gyi sku can rnams kyi bstan pa sna tshogs pa nyid do ;
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul bya'i bsam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa las thugs rje'i rang bzhin gyi sku can rnams kyi bstan pa sna tshogs pa nyid do ;
translated: Moreover, the variety of teachings of those whose nature is compassion, who act in accordance with the inclinations of those to be trained, is due to the variety of those to be trained.

original: / gdul bya'i sems can rnams kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: / gdul bya'i sems can rnams kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: And those to be trained are of five kinds,

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i chung ngu dang chen po'i 'bring dang chen po'i chen po'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i chung ngu dang chen po'i 'bring dang chen po'i chen po'i dbye ba las so //
translated: due to the distinctions of small, middling, and great, each of which is again divided into small, middling, and great.

original: de la chung ngu'i dbang du byas nas phyi rol gyi gnas la sogs pa'i yul bstan to //
analyzed: de la chung ngu'i dbang du byas nas phyi rol gyi gnas la sogs pa'i yul bstan to //
translated: For those of the small type, external places, etc., are taught.

original: de skad du yang dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang dri ma med pa'i 'od du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Vimalaprabhā:

original: 'dir thun mong du byis pa rnams yul du 'khyam pa'i don du dz'a la ndha ra la sogs pas gnas la sogs par gsungs shing /
analyzed: 'dir thun mong du byis pa rnams yul du 'khyam pa'i don du dz'a la ndha ra la sogs pas gnas la sogs par gsungs shing /
translated: Here, in common, for the sake of wandering children in the land, Jalandhara and so forth are taught as the places, and so forth.

original: de yang thams cad la khyab par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang thams cad la khyab par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that does not pervade all.

original: bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje rigs dang dmangs rigs mtha'i rigs rnams su skyes pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams ni grong khyer gcig na yang gnas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje rigs dang dmangs rigs mtha'i rigs rnams su skyes pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams ni grong khyer gcig na yang gnas pa'i phyir na /
translated: The Vajrayoginis born in the castes of Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras dwell even in one city.

original: bod dang rgya nag la sogs pa'i yul rnams na yang gnas pa la sogs pa rnams yod do //
analyzed: bod dang rgya nag la sogs pa'i yul rnams na yang gnas pa la sogs pa rnams yod do //
translated: Therefore, in countries such as Tibet and China, there are also those who dwell and so forth.

original: de rnams ni bsdus pa'i rgyud gzhan du ma bstan pa rnams so ;
analyzed: de rnams ni bsdus pa'i rgyud gzhan du ma bstan pa rnams so ;
translated: Those are not taught in other condensed tantras.

original: / rgyas pa'i rgyud gzhan du ni yul thams cad dang grong khyer thams cad du gnas la sogs pa rnams su gsungs so zhes so //
analyzed: / rgyas pa'i rgyud gzhan du ni yul thams cad dang grong khyer thams cad du gnas la sogs pa rnams su gsungs so zhes so //
translated: In other extensive tantras, the places and so forth are taught in all countries and all cities.

original: 'bring gi dbang du byas nas khang pa brtsegs pa'i sa gzhi la dkyil 'khor ba'i lha mo rnams kyi gnas la sogs pa rnam par @152b gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gi dbang du byas nas khang pa brtsegs pa'i sa gzhi la dkyil 'khor ba'i lha mo rnams kyi gnas la sogs pa rnam par @152b gzhag pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of the medium, the places of the goddesses of the mandala on the ground of the Mound Palace are presented.

original: chen po'i chung ngu'i dbang du byas nas pum yig la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'i byis pa'i 'khor lo'i tshul gyis gnas la sogs pa rnams lus la mgo bo la sogs pa rnams la bstan cing /
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngu'i dbang du byas nas pum yig la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa'i byis pa'i 'khor lo'i tshul gyis gnas la sogs pa rnams lus la mgo bo la sogs pa rnams la bstan cing /
translated: From the perspective of the small of the great, the places, and so on, are explained in the body, in the head, and so on, by way of the transformation of the syllable puṃ, and so on, into the form of a child.

original: de dang der son pa'i rtsa rnams kyang lha mo rnams zhes par ro ;
analyzed: de dang der son pa'i rtsa rnams kyang lha mo rnams zhes par ro ;
translated: The channels that reach there are the goddesses.

original: / chen po'i 'bring po'i dbang du byas pa las rdzogs pa'i rim pas sa bon gyi yi ge la sogs pa med par yang lus la ji ltar gnas pa'i spyi bo la sogs pa rnams gnas la sogs pa rnams su dang / de dang der son pa'i rtsa'i rang bzhin ngo bo rnams su rdo rje lha mo rnams zhes par lhag par mos pa'i don du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: / chen po'i 'bring po'i dbang du byas pa las rdzogs pa'i rim pas sa bon gyi yi ge la sogs pa med par yang lus la ji ltar gnas pa'i spyi bo la sogs pa rnams gnas la sogs pa rnams su dang / de dang der son pa'i rtsa'i rang bzhin ngo bo rnams su rdo rje lha mo rnams zhes par lhag par mos pa'i don du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In the medium of the great, in the context of the stage of completion, even without seed syllables and so forth, the Vajra goddesses are posited in the body, in the head and so forth, in the places and in the natures of the channels that reach there, in order to imagine them.

original: chen po'i chen po rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: The great of the great, who abide in the stage of completion,

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems lus la sogs pa mig yor gyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin gnas la sogs pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo kun nas sgyu rtsal du byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems lus la sogs pa mig yor gyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin gnas la sogs pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo kun nas sgyu rtsal du byed do //
translated: with the mind of enlightenment, the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, in the body and so forth, in the nature of an optical illusion, in the places and so forth, with the stages and perfections, create the mandala wheel as an art.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas sngar gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas sngar gsungs te /
translated: In the context of that, it was previously said:

original: ye shes chen po rang lus gnas //

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //

analyzed: 'gyur bar 'di la the tshom med //

analyzed: nges par gang bshad de 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lnga pa la ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa'i rang bzhin kho na gnas la sogs pa ste /
translated: But the fifth has the stages, etc. of the supramundane, such as the Joyous, etc. by nature.

original: nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to //
translated: It is definitive in meaning.

original: gang yang phyi rol du dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor dang lus la yang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnam par gzhag pa de yang drang ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang yang phyi rol du dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor dang lus la yang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnam par gzhag pa de yang drang ba'i don te /
translated: Also, the arrangement of the stages, such as the Joyous, etc. in the external, in the mandala circle, and in the body is interpretable in meaning.

original: gang phyir de dang de'i sar lhag par mos pa las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa de dang de gsal bar gyur pa'i ched du 'bad par @153b gyur na ci ma rung zhes pas so //
analyzed: gang phyir de dang de'i sar lhag par mos pa las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa de dang de gsal bar gyur pa'i ched du 'bad par @153b gyur na ci ma rung zhes pas so //
translated: It is so because it is for the sake of the bodhisattva’s striving to manifest the respective supramundane stage, such as the Joyous, etc. by the power of his respective faith in those stages.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this proliferation.

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams phal cher 'du ba'i gnas kyi shing rnams brjod pa'i don du gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams phal cher 'du ba'i gnas kyi shing rnams brjod pa'i don du gsungs pa de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement Then and so forth is to express the trees of the meeting place of the yoginis.

original: 'dir lhag par gnas par byed do zhes pa lhag par gnas te /
analyzed: 'dir lhag par gnas par byed do zhes pa lhag par gnas te /
translated: Here, they abide means they abide in excess.

original: shing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the trees and so forth.

original: tsu ta ni shing aa mra ste gang du lha mo aa ma bi ka dang zhing skyong me yod pa'o //
analyzed: tsu ta ni shing aa mra ste gang du lha mo aa ma bi ka dang zhing skyong me yod pa'o //
translated: The cuta tree is the mango tree, where the goddess Ambika and the field protector Agni exist.

original: ka ra nydza la gnas pa'i lha mo ka ra nydza la gnas pa mo dang zhing skyong dril bu chen po'o //
analyzed: ka ra nydza la gnas pa'i lha mo ka ra nydza la gnas pa mo dang zhing skyong dril bu chen po'o //
translated: The goddess Karanjaka and the field protector Mahāghantā exist in the Karanjaka tree.

original: shing ka dam pa la lha mo bzhin bzangs ma dang zhing skyong rgyu can no //
analyzed: shing ka dam pa la lha mo bzhin bzangs ma dang zhing skyong rgyu can no //
translated: The goddess Sundarī and the field protector Hetuka exist in the kadamba tree.

original: shing wa ta pa la gnas pa'i lha mo rna ba chen po dang zhing skyong rgyu'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: shing wa ta pa la gnas pa'i lha mo rna ba chen po dang zhing skyong rgyu'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The goddess Mahākarṇa and the field protector Hetīśvara exist in the vatapa tree.

original: ha ri ni aa ru ra'i shing ngo //
analyzed: ha ri ni aa ru ra'i shing ngo //
translated: The harīni tree is the arura tree.

original: shing mya ngan med la gnas pa'i lha mo gsang ba ma dang zhing skyong stobs po che'o //
analyzed: shing mya ngan med la gnas pa'i lha mo gsang ba ma dang zhing skyong stobs po che'o //
translated: The goddess Guhyā and the field protector Mahābala exist in the aśoka tree.

original: gser shing ni gser gyi se ph'a l'i la ste /
analyzed: gser shing ni gser gyi se ph'a l'i la ste /
translated: The golden tree is a golden sala tree.

original: gang du lha mo gtum mo dang / zhing skyong skye ba 'dren yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang du lha mo gtum mo dang / zhing skyong skye ba 'dren yod pa'o //
translated: It is the place where the goddess Caṇḍī and the field-born leader of beings are.

original: rdul bral la sogs pas ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i gnas rnams nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rdul bral la sogs pas ni rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i gnas rnams nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The place called Vimalaprabhā and so forth refers to the places taught in other tantras.

original: de p'u rnam gi ri ru ra'i rtse mo ni 'du ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: de p'u rnam gi ri ru ra'i rtse mo ni 'du ba'i gnas te /
translated: The peak of Mount Meru is the place of assembly.

original: gang na lha mo phun tshogs chen mo dang zhing skyong me'i gdong can yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang na lha mo phun tshogs chen mo dang zhing skyong me'i gdong can yod pa'o //
translated: It is the place where the goddess Mahāpuṇyā and the field-born Agnivaktra are.

original: 'dzin mar shing ta la ste gang na lha mo bde byed ma dang zhing skyong skra gyen du brdzes pa can no //
analyzed: 'dzin mar shing ta la ste gang na lha mo bde byed ma dang zhing skyong skra gyen du brdzes pa can no //
translated: In Jambudvīpa, the tree is a palm tree. It is the place where the goddess Kṣemā and the field-born Urdhvaśikhā are.

original: ae ru d'a ni shing ksham tsa na ste /
analyzed: ae ru d'a ni shing ksham tsa na ste /
translated: In Airāvana, the tree is a khañjana tree.

original: gang du lha mo me lce'i gdong pa can dang zhing skyong dril bu'i sgra can no //
analyzed: gang du lha mo me lce'i gdong pa can dang zhing skyong dril bu'i sgra can no //
translated: It is the place where the goddess Jihva and the field-born Ghaṇṭā are.

analyzed: dmar ser pre ta'i grong du shing dza d'a ste gang du lha mo dmar ser mo dang zhing skyong byin pa chen po can no //
translated: In the city of the red-yellow pretas, the tree is a jada tree. It is the place where the red-yellow goddess and the field-born Mahāpāda are.

original: ae la'i grong du shing a'a la ta na ste gang du lha mo bong bu la gnas ma dang zhing skyong glang po'i rna ba can no //

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi chos rtogs pa dang ston pa dang phul du dbyung du med cing rab kyi mthar thug pa rtogs pa dag rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'thung ba ste nyon mongs pa'i phung po 'dis gcod pa'o zhes pa 'thung gcod mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: This is the stage of the heroines' conduct, called drinking-cutting, because the mass of afflictions is cut off by this drinking.

original: 'dis ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa skyed par byed pa'i rim pas nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa skyed par byed pa'i rim pas nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the afflictions are to be abandoned by the process of generating the stages of the Joyous and so forth.

original: de ltar bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs par gyur pa nas bcu gnyis pa kun du 'od ni nye ba'i 'thung gcod do //
analyzed: de ltar bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs par gyur pa nas bcu gnyis pa kun du 'od ni nye ba'i 'thung gcod do //
translated: Thus, the twelfth stage, Universal Light, is the proximate drinking-cutting, since it is the abandonment of all obscurations along with their propensities.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin sa bcu gnyis po rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyi ji ltar rigs par rnal 'byor ma rnams rten dang bcas pa rnam par gzhag par
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin sa bcu gnyis po rnams la de'i bdag nyid kyi ji ltar rigs par rnal 'byor ma rnams rten dang bcas pa rnam par gzhag par
translated: Thus, the twelve stages, which are of the nature of the awakening mind endowed with the ten perfections along with their results, should be understood as the arrangement of the heroines along with their supports in accordance with their natures.

original: bya'o // kla klo'i skad ces pa brda'i skad kyis so //
analyzed: bya'o // kla klo'i skad ces pa brda'i skad kyis so //
translated: Barbarian language is the symbolic language.

original: phal cher phyi rol gyi 'thung gcod dang gnas la sogs pa nye ba'i 'thung gcod kyi mthar thug pa rnams la rim pa ji lta bar mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i sa'i dbang phyug pa rnal 'byor ma rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phal cher phyi rol gyi 'thung gcod dang gnas la sogs pa nye ba'i 'thung gcod kyi mthar thug pa rnams la rim pa ji lta bar mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i sa'i dbang phyug pa rnal 'byor ma rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoginis of the stage of the lord of the stage of conduct, etc., are born in the external Chedus, the internal Chedus, and the proximate Chedus, etc., in accordance with the stages.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ma rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa rnams de rnams su skyes pa ni shin tu nyung ba'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ma rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa rnams de rnams su skyes pa ni shin tu nyung ba'o //
translated: The lord of the ten stages, Prachaṇḍā, etc., are born in those places, but they are very few.

original: de'i phyir de'i rten k'a r'a n+ya p'a ta le sogs pa dang pu ll'i ra ma la ya la sogs pa rnams dang k'a r'a n+ya p'a ta ka la sogs pa dang nye ba'i sa gzhi rnams kyang mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i sa nyid du lhag🔽par mos par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rten k'a r'a n+ya p'a ta le sogs pa dang pu ll'i ra ma la ya la sogs pa rnams dang k'a r'a n+ya p'a ta ka la sogs pa dang nye ba'i sa gzhi rnams kyang mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i sa nyid du lhag par mos par byed de /
translated: Therefore, the Karanyapāṭala, etc., and the Pullairāma, etc., and the Karanyapāṭaka, etc., and the proximate lands are also imagined as the stage of conduct, etc., by the imagination.

original: phyi rol du 'dzin pas slu ba phra mo las kyang grol ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'dzin pas slu ba phra mo las kyang grol ba'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of being liberated from even the subtle deception of external grasping.

original: ji ltar rtul po la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyi'i yul du 'dzin pa rags pa bsal ba'i ched du phyi'i 'thung gcod dang gnas la sogs pa rnams la mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i sar lhag par mos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rtul po la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi phyi'i yul du 'dzin pa rags pa bsal ba'i ched du phyi'i 'thung gcod dang gnas la sogs pa rnams la mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i sar lhag par mos pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as for the sake of those sentient beings who are dull-witted and so forth, in order to remove their coarse grasping at external objects, they are made to aspire to the stages of the conduct of devoted interest and so forth, such as the external Potala, abode and so forth.

original: des na 'di thams cad la mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na 'di thams cad la mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, intending all of this, it is said:

original: pum yig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pum yig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The syllable puṃ and so forth.

original: pum yig la sogs pa'i yul pu ll'i ra ma la ya la sogs pa phyi rol pa ni rab tu grags pa'i gnas dang gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: pum yig la sogs pa'i yul pu ll'i ra ma la ya la sogs pa phyi rol pa ni rab tu grags pa'i gnas dang gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: The external Potala, and so forth, which are the objects of the syllable puṃ and so forth, are the well-known abodes and celestial mansions.

original: nang du ni lus dang byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: nang du ni lus dang byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Internally, they are the body and bodhicitta.

original: gal te yang kha cig tu dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang byang chub kyi sems kyang lhur len pa gsungs mod //
analyzed: gal te yang kha cig tu dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang byang chub kyi sems kyang lhur len pa gsungs mod //
translated: Even though in some places the maṇḍala wheel and bodhicitta are said to be the main point,

original: de lta na yang 'dir de ltar rnam par gzhag pa ma @156a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir de ltar rnam par gzhag pa ma @156a * //
translated: that is not the case here.

original: yin no // lus la pu ll'i ra la sogs pa rnams 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin no // lus la pu ll'i ra la sogs pa rnams 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Potala and so forth are explained in the body.

original: phyi rol du 'du ba'i dus gsungs pa nyin par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du 'du ba'i dus gsungs pa nyin par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The time for gathering externally is stated by “during the day” and so on.

original: yi dags kyi phyogs ni nag po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: yi dags kyi phyogs ni nag po'i phyogs so //
translated: The direction of the pretas is the dark direction.

original: rgyal mtshan ni dbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan ni dbyangs pa'o //
translated: The banner is the sound.

original: rang nyid sha dang rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don bdag gis bya'o zhes smon lam byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na bar ma chad par mi'i skye ba bdun rnams kyi mthar 'jug
analyzed: rang nyid sha dang rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don bdag gis bya'o zhes smon lam byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na bar ma chad par mi'i skye ba bdun rnams kyi mthar 'jug
translated: The bodhisattvas who have made the aspiration “I will accomplish the aims desired by all sentient beings with my flesh, bones, marrow, and so on” are uninterruptedly reborn as humans for seven lifetimes.

original: pa'i phyir na skye ba bdun pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir na skye ba bdun pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are seven-lifetime ones.

original: gang gi grib ma bdun rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi grib ma bdun rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: They are the ones who have seven shadows.

original: de ni de rnams kyis mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyis mtshon par bya'o //
translated: They are indicated by those.

original: de gang gi tshe rang nyid shi ba de'i tshe khyad par du bza' bar bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe rang nyid shi ba de'i tshe khyad par du bza' bar bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: When they die, they should be eaten in particular. This is the remainder.

original: gsod du gzhug par bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes mgo bo skra lta bus gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsod du gzhug par bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes mgo bo skra lta bus gsungs pa /
translated: They should not be made to kill. This is stated by the head hair.

original: snying rje bskyed nas 'bad pas ni ;
analyzed: snying rje bskyed nas 'bad pas ni ;
translated: Having generated compassion, strive with effort.🔽

original: / gsang bar bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: / gsang bar bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Having generated compassion, one should make an effort to give,🔽but not if it is not so.

original: 'on kyang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.🔽When a bodhisattva is certain to give his own flesh, etc.,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' bslang bar bya ba nges rang gi sha la sogs pa ster ba de'i tshe slong ba po rnams la sems can gdung ba byas pa'i kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' bslang bar bya ba nges rang gi sha la sogs pa ster ba de'i tshe slong ba po rnams la sems can gdung ba byas pa'i kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: at that time, there is no sin for the bodhisattva in tormenting sentient beings, the petitioners.

original: gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur te /🔽slong ba po'i skye bo la sdig par dogs pas na /
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur te / slong ba po'i skye bo la sdig par dogs pas na /
translated: Otherwise, the bodhisattvas would not have the perfection of giving,

original: sbyin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absence of giving due to the fear of sin in the petitioner.

original: gdug pa'i bsam pa can rnams las gzhan du slong ba po dmyal bar 'gro ba ni gang du yang ma thos so //
analyzed: gdug pa'i bsam pa can rnams las gzhan du slong ba po dmyal bar 'gro ba ni gang du yang ma thos so //
translated: And nowhere have I heard that a petitioner goes to hell other than from the wicked.

original: yang na dmyal ba'i las la mngon du phyogs pa'i gdug pa can rnams kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang na dmyal ba'i las la mngon du phyogs pa'i gdug pa can rnams kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: Or else, it is stated with reference to the wicked who are facing the karma of hell:

original: snying rje bskyed nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje bskyed nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Having generated compassion, etc.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said in the second chapter:

original: gdug pa gzhug pa cho ga ni //
analyzed: gdug pa gzhug pa cho ga ni //
translated: The rite of subduing the wicked

original: thams cad gtso bo las 'grub 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad gtso bo las 'grub 'gyur //
translated: is accomplished from the principal.

original: zhes so // gdug pa can rnams dam pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du ste /
analyzed: zhes so // gdug pa can rnams dam pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du ste /
translated: The reason for causing the wicked to enter the path of the holy is

original: thams cad ces pa mngon spyod 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dbye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gdug can rnams gzhug pa'i don kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa mngon spyod 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dbye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gdug can rnams gzhug pa'i don kho na'o //
translated: that all of them, not only the subjugation rite, are of the nature of the rite of causing the wicked to enter.

original: gtso bo las te gtso bor 'jug pas ni 'di thams cad 'grub @156b pa'o ;
analyzed: gtso bo las te gtso bor 'jug pas ni 'di thams cad 'grub @156b pa'o ;
translated: From the principal, that is, from the principal engagement, all of this is accomplished.

original: / de la de ltar byed pa'i rnal 'byor bas gal te de yang dag pa'i lam la gzhug par nus pa de'i tshe 'di bya ste /
analyzed: / de la de ltar byed pa'i rnal 'byor bas gal te de yang dag pa'i lam la gzhug par nus pa de'i tshe 'di bya ste /
translated: The yogi/nī who acts in that way, if able to cause the wicked to enter the true path, should do this.

original: gzhan du na 'di la 'di'i snying rje nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa snying rje dman pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di la 'di'i snying rje nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa snying rje dman pas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, this would not be compassion for them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshar gcad pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pa ma thob pa rnams la gsod pa rgyud rnams thams cad du bkag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshar gcad pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pa ma thob pa rnams la gsod pa rgyud rnams thams cad du bkag go //
translated: Therefore, killing is prohibited in all tantras for those who have not attained the ability to destroy and to protect.

original: de la dpal 'dus par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la dpal 'dus par gsungs pa /
translated: In this regard, the glorious Guhyasamaja states:

original: khams gsum po ni ma lus nas //
analyzed: khams gsum po ni ma lus nas //
translated: In the three realms, without exception,

original: gsod pa dang ni gso ba nyid //
analyzed: gsod pa dang ni gso ba nyid //
translated: killing and protecting

original: skad cig tsam gyis byed pa ni //
analyzed: skad cig tsam gyis byed pa ni //
translated: are performed in an instant.

original: gsal bar nus par the tshom med //
analyzed: gsal bar nus par the tshom med //
translated: There is no doubt that one is able to manifest.

original: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su de'i rnam par shes pa drangs nas de ltar rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir yang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su de'i rnam par shes pa drangs nas de ltar rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in the worlds of Akshobya and so forth, one should draw the consciousness of the victim and perform the rite in that way.

original: gang yang kha cig tu shig shig bzhin pa'i srog chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bza' bar gsungs pa de la yang shi ba na'o zhes go bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang kha cig tu shig shig bzhin pa'i srog chags dang bcas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bza' bar gsungs pa de la yang shi ba na'o zhes go bar bya'o //
translated: Also, in some places, it is stated that one should eat the flesh of beings such as Vairochana who are still alive and trembling. But in that case, it should be understood that the victim is dead.

original: de gdan bzhi par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gdan bzhi par gsungs pa /
translated: The Catuhpitha Tantra states:

original: dang por skye bor mi 'tshe ba //
analyzed: dang por skye bor mi 'tshe ba //
translated: First, do not harm living beings.

original: snying rjes bskyed pa'i sems ldan pas //
analyzed: snying rjes bskyed pa'i sems ldan pas //
translated: One who has a mind generated by compassion

original: srog chags gsad par bya ba min //
analyzed: srog chags gsad par bya ba min //
translated: should not kill a living being.

original: de bas 'chi ba 'ongs pa mchog / ces so //
analyzed: de bas 'chi ba 'ongs pa mchog / ces so //
translated: Therefore, death is the best.

original: snying rje ston te ji ltar bdag nyid la nga'o zhes mos pa de ltar sems can yang ngo zhes mos par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje ston te ji ltar bdag nyid la nga'o zhes mos pa de ltar sems can yang ngo zhes mos par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Compassion is taught. Just as one is devoted to oneself, one should be devoted to sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang bdag mnyam pa nyid du 'dir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag mnyam pa nyid du 'dir bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, here it is taught that one should be equal to oneself.

original: snying rje 'ba' zhig gis 'di ltar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snying rje 'ba' zhig gis 'di ltar bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that one should act in this way only out of compassion.

original: 'on kyang shes rab kyis kyang ngo zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes rab kyis kyang ngo zhes gsungs pa /
translated: However, it is also taught that one should act out of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: rnal 'byor bdag nyid ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bdag nyid ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The yogi/ni is the Vajra Holder who is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Heruka's Tantra

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: is the seventeenth flower in the garland of instructions.

original: // / rim pa gnyis po kho nas goms pas nye bar yongs spyad bzhin pa'i yul rnam par dag pas rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid 'grub po zhes de rtogs pa'i don du 'jug ste /
analyzed: // / rim pa gnyis po kho nas goms pas nye bar yongs spyad bzhin pa'i yul rnam par dag pas rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid 'grub po zhes de rtogs pa'i don du 'jug ste /
translated: By the two stages alone, one enters for the sake of realizing that, “the state of Vajradhara is achieved by the purification of the objects of experience which are cultivated by practice.”

original: nyan par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyan par zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Listen to the secret” and so forth.

original: gsang ba ni skal pa med pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na nang ngo //
analyzed: gsang ba ni skal pa med pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyis na nang ngo //
translated: “Secret” is inner, because it is not the domain of those who are unfortunate.

original: padma ni bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i padma rnams te /
analyzed: padma ni bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i padma rnams te /
translated: “Lotus” is the lotuses of great bliss and so forth.

original: @157a * // rigs la gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: @157a * // rigs la gcig gi tshig go //
translated: The “family” is the word for one.

original: ni ni khyad par du'o //
analyzed: ni ni khyad par du'o //
translated: “Indeed” is for the sake of distinction.

original: mtshan nyid ni ji ltar mtshon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni ji ltar mtshon par bya ba'o //
translated: “Characteristic” is how it is to be illustrated.

original: de la ye shes dang sems zhes pa rdul dang khu ba 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes dang sems zhes pa rdul dang khu ba 'dus pa'o //
translated: There, “wisdom and mind” are the union of the ovum and sperm.

original: yang dag byang chub ni rim pa las ci 'drar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub ni rim pa las ci 'drar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “True enlightenment” is how it becomes from the stage.

original: gnas bzhi zhes pa chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang bde ba chen po sprul pa'i chu skyes bzhi po rim pa ji lta bar bdag dang gzhan dang sbyor ba dang gsang ba'i gdan rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: gnas bzhi zhes pa chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang bde ba chen po sprul pa'i chu skyes bzhi po rim pa ji lta bar bdag dang gzhan dang sbyor ba dang gsang ba'i gdan rnams kyi ste /
translated: The four places are the four lotuses of the Dharma, the Enjoyment, the Great Bliss, and the Emanation.

original: kun du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bsdus pa'o //
translated: They are the seats of self, other, union, and secret, respectively.

original: bdag ni sems te de'i rten ni snying ga'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sems te de'i rten ni snying ga'o //
translated: Self is the mind, and its seat is the heart.

original: gzhan gyi ste ston par byed pa la longs spyod pas dang gzhan te ro drug longs spyod pas mgrin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ste ston par byed pa la longs spyod pas dang gzhan te ro drug longs spyod pas mgrin pa'o //
translated: Other is the throat, because it is the seat of the enjoyment of the six tastes.

original: sbyor ba'i ste bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag ro gcig pa nyid kyi gdan mgo bo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ste bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag ro gcig pa nyid kyi gdan mgo bo'o //
translated: Union is the head, because it is the seat of the one taste of the Bhagavān and the Bhagavatī.

original: gsang ba'i ste lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang sprul pa'i yang lte ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i ste lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang sprul pa'i yang lte ba'o //
translated: Secret is the navel, because it is the seat of the innate bliss and the emanation.

original: gsang ba yang yin la de gdan kyang ngo zhes par yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba yang yin la de gdan kyang ngo zhes par yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is secret and it is a seat.

original: padma yang gsang ba ste rung ba yang ma yin pa la gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: padma yang gsang ba ste rung ba yang ma yin pa la gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The lotus is also secret, because it is not suitable to be disclosed.

original: kha cig gis ni 'ga' zhig tu bdag gi gdan la sogs pa rnams rnam pa gzhan du rnam par 'jog pa ni bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni 'ga' zhig tu bdag gi gdan la sogs pa rnams rnam pa gzhan du rnam par 'jog pa ni bsam par bya'o //
translated: Some should be understood to be established in a different way in some places, such as the seat of the self.

original: rgyud gzhan du ni /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du ni /
translated: In another tantra,

original: gzhan gyi gdan la shes rab brjod //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gdan la shes rab brjod //
translated: the seat of the other is called wisdom,

original: bdag gi gdan ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi gdan ni thabs yin no //
translated: and the seat of the self is method.

original: 'di dag gnyis med gyur pa ni //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyis med gyur pa ni //
translated: The nonduality of these two🔽is established as the meaning of union.

original: sbyor ba'i don du rnam par gzhag / de las skyes pa de nyid gdan //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i don du rnam par gzhag / de las skyes pa de nyid gdan //
translated: That which arises from that is the seat of reality,

original: de spangs par ni gang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de spangs par ni gang 'gyur ba //
translated: and that which abandons that

original: lhan cig skyes zhes yang dag bshad //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes zhes yang dag bshad //
translated: is said to be innate.

original: dag gi lam gyi spyod yul 'das //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dag gi lam gyi spyod yul 'das // zhes gsungs te /
translated: It transcends the domain of the path of the pure.

original: de spangs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyis kyi rtog pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyis kyi rtog pas stong pa'o //
translated: That which abandons that is empty of the concepts of both self and other.

original: de ltar 'di ni dri ba dang po'i lan mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni dri ba dang po'i lan mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, this is the brief explanation of the answer to the first question.

original: gnyis pa'i ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni /
translated: The second is

original: rdzogs byang chub rim rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: rdzogs byang chub rim rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: the vajra holder of perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ste ye shes dang sems shes pa dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes pa ste ye shes dang sems shes pa dang 'brel lo //
translated: This is connected with the knowledge of wisdom and mind.

original: rim pa mdor bstan pa ni mnyam nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa mdor bstan pa ni mnyam nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The brief explanation of the stages is “equality” and so on.

original: mnyam nyid sems ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mnyam nyid sems ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind of sameness is the mind that is of one taste with emptiness.

original: 'dod chags la sogs rnams ring du ste rgyu yang mngon par 'jug pa med pas @157b spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs rnams ring du ste rgyu yang mngon par 'jug pa med pas @157b spangs pa'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are far away, abandoned, because they do not manifest.

original: gnas pa nyid kyi rnam g-yeng med pa nye bar mtshon to //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid kyi rnam g-yeng med pa nye bar mtshon to //
translated: The absence of distraction in abiding is indicated.

original: brtan pa rnams la brtse ba ni nye bar btags pa las te /
analyzed: brtan pa rnams la brtse ba ni nye bar btags pa las te /
translated: The love of the steadfast is imputed.

original: de ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa las 'don par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa las 'don par 'dod pa'o //
translated: That is the desire to deliver sentient beings from suffering and its cause.

original: sa dang sa las skyes pa la sogs pa yang rdo ba dang mi zhim pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sa dang sa las skyes pa la sogs pa yang rdo ba dang mi zhim pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering that arises from the stages and so on is suffering because it is the cause of suffering, since it is associated with stones, bitter fruit and so on.

original: de'i rgyu yang sems can rnams kyi thun mong ba'i las mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yang sems can rnams kyi thun mong ba'i las mi dge ba'o //
translated: The cause of that is nonvirtuous karma common to sentient beings.

original: de las 'don pa ni snod kyi zhing dag pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'don pa ni snod kyi zhing dag pa'o //
translated: Delivering from that is the purification of the environment.

original: yang na gnas pa ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po rnams kun la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: yang na gnas pa ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po rnams kun la mnyam pa nyid kyi sems bskyed nas /
translated: Or else, having generated the mind of sameness toward all things, both stable and moving,

original: snying rje dang bcas pa ni rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: snying rje dang bcas pa ni rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur zhes 'brel lo //
translated: he who is compassionate becomes Vajrasattva.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How so? It is said:

original: mgon med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mgon med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “without a protector, etc.”

original: mgon med ni bdag gi gdan te /
analyzed: mgon med ni bdag gi gdan te /
translated: The “protectorless” is one’s own seat,

original: sems kyi rten nyid kyis na 'dra ba la dgag pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rten nyid kyis na 'dra ba la dgag pa'o //
translated: since it is the support of the mind, like a negation.

original: mgo bo ni mngon par phyogs pa'i chu skyes nyid kyi phyir mgo bo ste gzhan gyi gdan no //
analyzed: mgo bo ni mngon par phyogs pa'i chu skyes nyid kyi phyir mgo bo ste gzhan gyi gdan no //
translated: The “head” is the other’s seat, since it is the lotus that faces upward.

original: gtum mo'i n'a da mthar byed do zhes pas n'a da mtha' ste sbyor ba'i gdan yin zhing de kho na nyid kyi gdan yang de'o //
analyzed: gtum mo'i n'a da mthar byed do zhes pas n'a da mtha' ste sbyor ba'i gdan yin zhing de kho na nyid kyi gdan yang de'o //
translated: The “end of the nāda of Caṇḍālī” is the end of the nāda, which is the seat of union, and that is the seat of reality.

original: gsang ba'i padma ni gsang ba'i gdan te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma ni gsang ba'i gdan te /
translated: The “secret lotus” is the secret seat.

original: sngags kyi gdan du yang brjod do //
analyzed: sngags kyi gdan du yang brjod do //
translated: It is also called the mantra seat.

original: cha ni zla ba'i cha ste 'khyud pa'i rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: cha ni zla ba'i cha ste 'khyud pa'i rtsa rnams so //
translated: The “part” is the part of the moon, which are the channels of embrace.

original: sna tshogs pa'i gzugs rnams te gdan rnams ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gzugs rnams te gdan rnams ni /
translated: The various forms are the seats.

original: de rnams kyi so sor nye ba las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i pu ll'i ra ma la ya la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi so sor nye ba las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i pu ll'i ra ma la ya la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: They are the individual parts of those, the Pūrṇagiri Ramāyaṇa, etc., which will be explained.

original: sku gsung thugs rnams kyi rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid rnams rdo rje sems dpa' gang gi yin pa ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs rnams kyi rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid rnams rdo rje sems dpa' gang gi yin pa ste /
translated: The vajras of body, speech, and mind, which have the nature of emptiness, are the vajra beings of the one who is Vajrasattva.

original: 'di thams cad de'i bdag nyid du 'brel ba can no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad de'i bdag nyid du 'brel ba can no //
translated: All of these are connected as having the nature of him.

original: gang gi phyir chos zhes pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos zhes pa /
translated: Because of the dharmas,

original: chos skye mched drug la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyings rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos skye mched drug la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyings rang bzhin te /
translated: the dhātu of the six sense bases, etc., is the nature.

original: kun rdzob pa khu ba dang khrag dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa gang nyi shu rtsa gcig par 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa khu ba dang khrag dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa gang nyi shu rtsa gcig par 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The relative is the gathering of semen, blood, and consciousness, which will be explained as twenty-one.

original: de 'dus pa'ang chos kyi dbyings bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dus pa'ang chos kyi dbyings bsdus pa'o //
translated: That gathering is also included in the dharmadhātu.🔽The nature of sattva is the body, rajas is speech,

original: snying stobs lus dang rdul ngag dang // sems mun pa'i rang bzhin la ste //
analyzed: snying stobs lus dang rdul ngag dang // sems mun pa'i rang bzhin la ste //
translated: and tamas is the mind.

original: snying stobs khu ba rdul ni khrag / skyed @158a * //
analyzed: snying stobs khu ba rdul ni khrag / skyed @158a * //
translated: Sattva is semen, rajas is blood,

original: pa nyid ni mun pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid ni mun pa'o //
translated: and tamas is the generation.

original: zhes so // de'i rnam 'phrul ni rnam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i rnam 'phrul ni rnam 'gyur ro //
translated: Its emanation is the transformation.

original: don dam pa ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa ni chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The ultimate is the dharma-element, thusness.

original: de'i rnam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam 'gyur ro //
translated: Its transformation is the body of a buddha.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /🔽stong pa kho na'i chos rnams las //
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa / stong pa kho na'i chos rnams las //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽From only empty phenomena

original: stong pa'i chos rnams rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos rnams rab tu 'byung //
translated: empty phenomena arise.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir bsdus nas zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ston pa chu khams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir bsdus nas zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ston pa chu khams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “in brief” and so forth is taught extensively with “the water element” and so forth.

original: khu ba dang rdul gyi khams dag la sems kyang ro mnyam pa gong bu'i ngo bo ni go 'phang gnas pa'i rgyu ste rdo rje 'dzin pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu ba dang rdul gyi khams dag la sems kyang ro mnyam pa gong bu'i ngo bo ni go 'phang gnas pa'i rgyu ste rdo rje 'dzin pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is of the same taste as the elements of semen and ovum, the essence of the aggregate, the cause of abiding in the state, because of the completion of the vajra-holder.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab thabs bdag ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab thabs bdag ste /
translated: Because of the self of method and wisdom,

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'o //
translated: emptiness and compassion are inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Therefore, it is yoga.

original: dbang po drug can ni 'di'i dbang po drug rnams yin pa zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dbang po drug can ni 'di'i dbang po drug rnams yin pa zhes byas nas so //
translated: The one with six faculties is the one whose six faculties are the six vajras.

original: sangs rgyas gzugs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: The buddha-form is the body of the vajra-holder.

original: de ltar gar gi phyir rdo rje sems dpa' rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa de'i phyir de kho na las yang dag bstan bcos te phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bstan pa rnams su 'gyur gyi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gar gi phyir rdo rje sems dpa' rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa de'i phyir de kho na las yang dag bstan bcos te phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bstan pa rnams su 'gyur gyi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
